monster.name: Aberrant Host

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The host makes two Mind Spike attacks.

action.name: Mind Spike
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) Psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Barrage (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 17, up to three creatures the host can see within 60 feet. Failure: 28 (8d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Jinxed condition (1d8; save ends). Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The host casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17, +9 to spell attacks): At Will: Detect Thoughts, Mage Hand (the hand is invisible) 3/Day: Levitate, Suggestion 1/Day: Dominate Person

reaction.name: Thought Shield
reaction.text: Trigger: The host or a creature it can see fails a saving throw or is hit by an attack. Response: The target rolls 1d6 and adds the result to its AC or saving throw, potentially turning a hit into a miss or a failure into a success.

monster.spells: detect thought, mage hand, levitate, suggestion, dominate person
monster.description:
The grim-faced doctor's jaw tightens as they lower their brow and sigh. Suddenly, their face contorts into a wicked, impossible grimace, a smile stretched too wide for the muscles on their face. Fiendish light glimmers in their eyes as hornlike bulges rip through the flesh of their forehead. Profane runes suddenly blaze upon their flesh, releasing the smell of burning meat and sulfur. The body rises into the air, the muscle spasms barely containing the evil spirit bound within this mortal host. A spiral of flame encircles the apothecary's body as they unleash a horrific scream, speaking in a voice which is not their own. "Now, you will die, mortal."
Desperate Gambit. A Soulbound Host (Fiendish, Faerie or Aberrant) is usually created under truly desperate circumstances, such as when a heroic apothecary faces a dangerous otherworldly being such as a demon, fey, spirit, or inscrutable entity from the Space Between Worlds. Not only are these planar invaders pernicious foes, many are effectively immortal—often these creatures simply reform when killed outside their native planes. Thus, an apothecary who lacks the ability to defeat the demon on their own, or who wishes to defeat a powerful outsider in a more permanent fashion, may instead decide upon a heroic act of self-sacrifice by turning themselves into a Soulbound Host.
Preparing the Trap. Using an array of implanted metals, ingested tinctures, mental preparations, and occult incantations, a skilled apothecary may willingly prepare their body for possession. During the process, the apothecary can weave a unique spiritual trap. It then falls to the apothecary to convince the otherworldly creature to possess them, an act that many outsiders are eager to do. Thus, the canny apothecary preys on the ego of the monster itself.
Mortal Curse. When the outsider inhabits the body, the apothecary's soul departs, leaving the extraplanar creature to take their place spiritually. If this mortal form is killed or destroyed, the bound creature does not simply return to their plane of origin. Instead, the spirit departs to the afterworlds like any other mortal soul, losing their accumulated otherworldly power forever. Thus, the Soulbound Host becomes both a prison and a death sentence for the other wielding being tricked into the apothecary's body.
Rogue Hosts. Unfortunately, this act of self-sacrifice is not without its imperfections. The apothecary's body is filled with otherworldly essence, and while the creature's power is greatly diminished, they often remain extremely dangerous—allies of the departed apothecary may still find it challenging to slay the Soulbound Host. Many escape, wandering the world with stolen lives and even assuming the identity of their host while they search for the means to escape their now mortal form. All bound outsiders are painfully aware of their new mortality, frustrated that returning to their planes of origin is not a simple matter of destroying their flesh-cage or switching their essence into a different host, one which lacks the binding wards placed by the apothecary.
Price of Freedom. Trapped outsiders can win their freedom by calling back the soul of the apothecary who trapped them, and resurrecting them into their body. This is a thing many outsiders are loathe to do out of fiendish ego, since it puts the original soul in a bargaining position. In this way, the apothecary can force the spirit to accept a bargain which requires them to remain in their own worlds for at least the duration of the apothecary's lifetime.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Religion, Medicine, or Survival gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Soulbound Host, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Possessed Body. You know the Soulbound Host's type and damage Resistances. (15+) Extraplanar Magic. Depending on the type of spirit, you learn either the Hellfire Chain, Illusory Assault, or Psychic Barrage actions, as well as the Spellcasting trait of the host. (20+) Cursed Fate. You recognize its desperation caused by its spirit-bound mortality and its Reactions.
Combat Tactics A Soulbound Host is a careful combatant. Though powerful, the last thing they want is to be killed in their mortal form. If they are seriously injured, they often attempt to bargain, offering power and knowledge to assailants who spare them.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Fiend, Fey, or Aberrant. Fluid: Monster Blood. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts. Bones: Skull, Spine. Natural Weapons: Claws. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Fiendish, Fey, or Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 215 -217 (Third Party)

monster.name: Academy Apprentice

action.name: Force Dart
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) Force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The apprentice casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12, +4 to spell attacks): At Will: Detect Magic, Mage Hand, Minor Illusion, Prestidigitation 1/Day Each: Burning Hands, Find Familiar, Magic Missile

monster.spells: detect magic, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, burning hands, find familiar, magic missile
monster.description:
Dressed in simple purple robes with the symbol of the Amethyst Academy upon their left breast, the apprentice carries a spellbook fastened to their belt, and a simple satchel of alchemical ingredients.
Academy Combat Tactics Broadly speaking, Amethyst Academy mages eschew combat, valuing their own lives too highly to take such risks. They view themselves as researchers, craftspeople, and scholars, not war mages—few bother learning damaging spells beyond simple cantrips, instead focusing on practical magic for their academic and industrial pursuits. Nevertheless, they know that magic is still a dangerous vocation, and ready themselves to flee perilous situations with Invisibility spells or teleportation magic. When violent confrontation seems inevitable, Amethyst Academy agents often hire mercenaries or adventurers, or dispatch summoned creatures in their stead. Nevertheless, there are bold explorers who take to field research and prepare themselves for dangerous expeditions—particularly, those who personally study the ruins of Drakkenheim. They often utilize constructs such as Shield Guardians or summoned elementals bound to service with Planar Binding. Mages usually begin combat with defensive or control spells as befits the situation, such as taking to the air with Fly or subduing foes with Slow. Only once they are certain the situation is under control will they use their signature Prismatic Blasts or area-of-effect spells like Fireball and Lightning Bolt. These mages almost always flee once they've become Bloodied, viewing a temporary setback or mission failure as a preferable outcome over their deaths.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 336 -337 (Third Party)

action.name: Misty Step (recharge 5–6) (Bonus Action)

reaction.name: Contingency (1/Day)

monster.name: Adult Delerium Dragon (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 95 (7d12 + 49) + 95 (7d12 + 49) per player character.

trait.name: Haze Aura
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the dragon takes 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The dragon always takes its turn on Initiative count 20. On its turn, the dragon can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the dragon takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach 10 ft. Hit: 34 (4d12 + 8) Force damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 22). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach 10 ft. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) Force damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 22, one creature within 20 feet of the dragon. Failure: 14 (4d6) Force damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

action.name: Mindfire
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature the dragon can see within 120 feet. Failure: The target takes 22 (4d10) Psychic damage and has the Burning condition (2d8 Psychic). Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Terrifying Roar (recharges After a Short Rest)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 21, each creature in a 120-foot Emanation originating from the dragon that can hear it. Failure: 18 (4d8) Thunder damage, and the target has the Frightened condition (save ends).

action.name: Breathe Deep (1/round)
action.text: The dragon's Breath Weapon recharges. The dragon can only use this Epic Action if it's the first Epic Action it has taken this round.

action.name: Breath Weapon (special Recharge)
action.text: The dragon can only use this Epic Action if it's the last Epic Action it takes this round. It chooses one of the following effects: Mutation Breath. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 21, each creature in a 120-foot Cone. Failure: 72 (16d8) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. Instead of rolling to determine if it gains a mutation, the target automatically gains a mutation. Success: Half damage only. Madness Breath. Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 21, each creature in a 120-foot Cone. Failure: 66 (12d10) Psychic damage, and the target has the Dazed condition (save ends). Failure by 5 or More: 132 (24d10) Psychic damage, and the target instead has the Incapacitated condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only. Wild Magic Breath. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 21, each creature in a 120-foot long, 5-foot wide Line. Failure: 55 (10d10) Radiant damage, and the target triggers an Arcane Anomaly centered on itself. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Spellcasting (1/round)
action.text: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20): At Will: Dimension Door, Telekinesis 2/Day Each: Dispel Magic 1/Day Each: Contact Other Plane, Plane Shift (self only), Scrying

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: The dragon chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The dragon can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

reaction.name: Draconic Rebuke
reaction.text: Trigger: The dragon becomes Bloodied. It can use this Reaction even if it has the Incapacitated condition or is otherwise unable to take Reactions. Response: All conditions and spells on the dragon immediately end unless it chooses to be affected by them, and it can move up to its Fly Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and ignoring Difficult Terrain. The dragon recharges and immediately uses its Terrifying Roar.

monster.spells: dimension door, telekinesis, dispel magic, contact other plane, plane shift, scrying
monster.description:
This unearthly dragon is a crystalline horror, its body formed from angular gem-like scales pulsing with octarine light. Its form is raw delerium. Each scale is a gleaming crystal refracting light into eerie hues of purple, yellow, and green, with an unnatural sharpness that feels both fragile and impossibly durable. The dragon's wings are translucent and webbed with glowing crystal veins that shimmer, casting kaleidoscopic patterns as it moves. Each beat causes the air to hum, vibrating with a chaotic energy that overwhelms and distorts the senses. Each step the dragon takes leaves delicate motes of crystal growing into jagged formations, tainting the landscape. Its eyes are like multifaceted gems, swirling with chaotic magic pooling within their depths. The beast's crystalline horns and talons are razor-sharp, gleaming like polished jewels, yet crackling with eldritch energy.
A fully mature Delerium Dragon establishes its own domain within the Space Between Worlds, finding a place suitable to its temperament. There it seeks to understand itself and the world around it.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Delerium Dragon, learning the following based on the result. (15+) Empowered by Eldritch Magic. You understand the dragon's Resistances and senses. (20+) Octarine Breath. You recognize the effects of the Delerium Dragon's breath weapon, as well as noting its Spellcasting capabilities. (25+) Few Weaknesses. You learn its highest and lowest saving throws.
Combat Tactics A Delerium Dragon views combat less as a violent encounter and more as a chance to change foes into a new form. It darts about using flight and teleportation, seldom remaining in the same place for more than a turn. Their movement makes it easy for the dragon to find the perfect place to catch many enemies with its breath weapon. Delerium Dragons love to spread contamination and cause arcane anomalies, and delight causing monstrous transformations with their contaminated attacks. Delerium Dragons use their Bite, Contaminated Rend, and Tail attacks to tear opponents apart in between uses of their breath weapon. When they are unable to close the distance, Delerium Dragons mentally assault their targets with Mindfire.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Glands, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Claws, Teeth. Hide: Scales, Webbed Membrane. Dust: Aberrant Dust. Delerium. In addition, characters can collect delerium crystals from its body. An adult has 2d6 crystals.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 294 -296 (Third Party)

monster.name: Agog
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but does not speak

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The agog makes one Claw attack and one Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the Prone condition.

action.name: Gobble (Bonus Action)
action.text: The agog makes a Bite attack against a Prone target.

monster.description:
This horrific thing has no shape or body resembling anything from the Mortal World. It roughly resembles a tree stump with four root-like legs each ending in a misshapen hoof. It has a wet, mottled, bark-like hide, and sprouting from the side of it like branches are knobbly arms ending in sharp claws. The top of its body is a gaping, tooth-filled mouth. It is shovelling chunks of horse-flesh into itself, and giggling as it swallows the ripped flesh. Whatever passes for arms, on the inside of the palm are yellow eyes.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine an Agog, learning the following based on the result. (5+) Climbing Aberration. You know the creature's type, and movement speeds. (10+) Attack the Fallen. You are aware of the creature's Gobble Bonus Action. (15+) Dim but Sturdy. You recognize the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics The Agog barrels towards its enemies, flailing its arms towards them and attempting to grab them and toss them to the ground. If it knocks a creature down, it will immediately begin attempting to devour them.
Harvestable Components (Common) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Sap. Organs: Guts. Natural Weapons: Claws, Teeth. Hide: Bark. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 292 (Third Party), Sebastian Crowes Terror in Tierhaven p. 18 (Third Party)

monster.name: Alienist
monster.skill: Arcana +8, Deception +7, Insight +8, Medicine +8, Perception +8, Persuasion +7

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Studded Leather

trait.name: Lie Detection
trait.text: The alienist always knows if it hears a lie, and has Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks.

trait.name: Unmatched Intellect
trait.text: The alienist adds its Intelligence modifier to its Initiative rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The alienist makes three Mind Thrust attacks.

action.name: Mind Thrust
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 26 (4d10 + 4) Force damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet in any horizontal direction.

action.name: Mass Manipulation (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 16, up to six creatures within 60 feet of the alienist that can see and hear it. Failure: The target must use its Reaction to move up to its Speed and make a weapon attack or cast a cantrip. The alienist chooses the direction of the movement and the target of the attack or cantrip.

action.name: Nerve Gas (1/Day)
action.text: The alienist creates a 10-foot radius Sphere of psychoactive fog centered on a point it can see within 60 feet. The fog spreads around corners and renders its area Heavily Obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it. A creature that enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there is subjected to the following effect. Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 35 (10d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Incapacitated condition until the start of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The alienist casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, +8 to spell attacks): 2/Day Each: Detect Thoughts, Suggestion 1/Day Each: Modify Memory, Telekinesis

action.name: Teleport (Bonus Action)
action.text: The alienist teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet.

reaction.name: Mind Over Matter
reaction.text: Trigger: The alienist takes damage. Response: The alienist gains Resistance to the triggering damage.

monster.spells: detect thoughts, suggestion, modify memory, tekeinesis
monster.description:
Hovering inches from the ground, lab coat billowing in an unknown breeze that seems to swirl around the figure, the Alienist mutters under their breath, eyes glowing white as they pull on the threads of your mind. You feel the imminent threat of your psyche shattering to this apothecary's will with little more than a flick of their wrist.
Alienist Minions. Alienists keep several experiments of their own on hand. They have been known to keep Wretched Patients, their minds melted by the Alienist's inhuman experimentation, turning them into obedient and loyal servants. Disembodied Psyches and Cerebrografts are a few of their higher-end creations, having removed the brain of a creature and given it a unique and bespoke form of sentience, these creatures serve as guards to an Alienist's work, or minions capable of complex thought and aid.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. I can't help but analyze every person who comes before me. I want to know what they think, and why they are the way they are. • Bond. I study the mind for scientific advancement. How easily this muscle can be manipulated, altered, and used in unforeseen ways is fascinating research that must be explored. • Ideal. I am the only one capable of this level of advanced mental research, someone else would have gotten it wrong! • Flaw. My unbound intellect means that I can never be fooled, tricked, or manipulated, and thus I can never be out-smarted, to think I could is laughable.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Medicine or Arcana gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study an Alienist, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Mental Master. You are aware of the Alienist's Immunities as well as its Unmatched Intellect trait. (15+) Mind Control. You know of its Mass Manipulation action. (20+) Brilliant but Vulnerable. You learn its AC, as well as its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics An Alienist is a smart combatant who does not wildly use their abilities, nor easily fall victim to manipulation or deception. They begin interactions by attempting to persuade foes to leave them be, resorting to spells such as Suggestion and Detect Thoughts to help navigate social encounters. If combat arises, the Alienist unleashes Mass Manipulation to confuse its foes while it Teleports away to make an escape. The Alienist leaves Nerve Gas in its wake to dissuade enemies from pursuit. The Alienist flees at the first opportunity it has—they are too clever to give in to needless combat. If the Alienist is trapped, it does its best to undo the party, attempting to flee at all costs if it feels it is in a losing situation and below half its Hit Points.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 182 (Third Party)

monster.name: Allopine
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but does not speak

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The allopine makes three Quill attacks.

action.name: Quill
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing Damage.

action.name: Nimble Escape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The allopine takes the Disengage or Hide action.

monster.description:
This creature has gaunt and misshapen form, with the scaled body, tail, and head of an alligator, bony spokes covering its body like a porcupine, batlike wings, and long, spindly limbs.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine an Allopine, learning the following based on the result. (5+) Flying Aberration. You know the creature's type, and movement speeds. (10+) Shifty. You are aware of the creature's Nimble Escape Bonus Action. (15+) Agile but Meek. They learn the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics Allopines are not warriors, but they are hostile to creatures who enter their territory and will fire Quills at anyone who comes too close. They do not stick around in a fight by themselves, and if they are with a flock, they will prefer to take to the air and fire Quills from afar.
Harvestable Components (Common) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Guts. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Needles. Hide: Scales, Webbed Membrane. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 293 (Third Party), Sebastian Crowes Terror in Tierhaven p. 18 (Third Party)

monster.name: Amalgamation (Epic)
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, stunned

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 175 (10d20 + 70) + 175 (10d20 + 70) per player character.

trait.name: Contaminating Presence
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the Amalgamation is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 20. Failure: The target gains a Contamination level. Failure or Success: 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The Amalgamation has Immunity to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Malignancy
trait.text: The Amalgamation can't be teleported or travel to another plane against its will.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If the Amalgamation is destroyed in the Mortal World, it reappears 1d10 days later with all of its Hit Points unless its roots in the Space Between Worlds are also destroyed.

trait.name: Ultimate Corruption
trait.text: Necrotic damage dealt by the Amalgamation ignores Resistance and treats Immunity as Resistance instead.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The Amalgamation always takes its turn on initiative count 20. On its turn, the Amalgamation can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Amalgamation takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +17, reach 10 ft. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) Force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature Grappled by the Amalgamation, the grapple ends and the target is swallowed. While swallowed, the target has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, has Total Cover from effects originating from outside the Amalgamation, and takes 42 (12d6) Necrotic damage and gains a Contamination level at the start of each of the Amalgamation's turns. If the Amalgamation takes 50+ damage in a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which land in spaces within 10 feet of the Amalgamation and have the Prone condition. If the Amalgamation dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape the corpse using 15 feet of its movement, exiting with the Prone condition.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +17, reach 60 ft. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) Force damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 25). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition. The Amalgamation has twelve tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
action.text: One Large or smaller object held or creature Grappled by the Amalgamation is thrown up to 60 feet, landing with the Prone condition. If the target strikes a solid surface, it takes 35 (10d6) Force damage. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and have the Prone condition.

action.name: Mind-breaking Whispers (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 25, one creature within 120 feet of the Amalgamation. Failure: The target becomes insane until it finishes a Long Rest. While insane, the target can't take actions, understand other creatures, read, or speak anything but gibberish. A Greater Restoration or Heal spell ends the effect early. Failure or Success: 70 (20d6) Psychic damage.

action.name: Forced Mutation (1/round)
action.text: Each creature within 120 feet of the Amalgamation with one or more Contamination levels takes 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage and gains a randomly determined mutation.

action.name: Piper At the Gate (1/round)
action.text: A Pyknic Maunder appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the Amalgamation, acting after the Amalgamation on Initiative count 20 and under the Amalgamation's direct control. The Amalgamation can have up to ten Pyknic Maunders under its control at a time.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: The Amalgamation chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The Amalgamation can use this Epic Action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

monster.description:
Before the throne is a gibbering amalgamation of fleshy tumors, rotting bones, and rancid layers of bloated fat suspended between the ceiling and floor by stalky strands of gnarled tissue. A palpable aura of contamination emanates from the beast. The mass is covered in bursting sores and shuddering mucus nodules that weep bile and delerium sludge. The creature mutters in alien tongues from six yawning mouths, piping and sputtering in discordant musical tones, and lazily shifting eyes of massive size open and close throughout its bulk. Thick trunk-like tentacles reach out from its hideous stinking form to squirm and writhe around the chamber. Several appendages are wrapped around pulsing human organs: lungs, liver, kidney, a heart, a brain, and dangling amongst them is the jeweled Crown of Westemär.
Study the Foe: Characters who have one or more mutations, or who are afflicted with any form of madness gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they Study the Amalgamation, learning the following based on the result: (20+) Multidimensional. You recognize its Immunities, and its Rejuvenation, Malignancy, and Immutable Form traits. (25+) Insatiable Hunger. You know of the creature's Bite attack, as well as its Mind-Breaking Whispers ability. (30+) Beyond Comprehension. You are aware of its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics: The Amalgamation is a formidable foe capable of grappling multiple targets and eating them or throwing them around the battlefield. It constantly summons Pyknic Maunders as additional support while it uses Mind-Breaking Whispers to shatter the minds of its greatest threats. The Amalgamation does not fear any mortal creature, believing itself indestructible to mortal means. It does not flee or cower.
Harvestable Components (Legendary): Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze, Acidic Bile. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Flesh, Guts. Natural Weapons: Tentacles, Teeth. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust. Trophy: The Crown of Westemär
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 24 -25 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ancient Delerium Dragon (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 136 (7d20 + 63) + 136 (7d20 + 63) per player character.

trait.name: Haze Aura
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the dragon takes 21 (6d6) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Order Over Chaos
trait.text: Whenever the dragon is present when a roll is made on the Arcane Anomaly, Drakkenheim Madness, or Mutations table, the dragon makes an additional roll on the table and chooses which result applies.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The dragon always takes its turn on Initiative count 20. On its turn, the dragon can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the dragon takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +18, reach 10 ft. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) Force damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 26). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +18, reach 10 ft. Hit: 17 (2d6 + 10) Force damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 26, one creature within 20 feet of the dragon. Failure: 24 (4d6 + 10) Force damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

action.name: Mindfire
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 25, one creature the dragon can see within 120 feet. Failure: The target takes 22 (4d10) Psychic damage and has the Burning condition (2d8 Psychic). Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Wing Blast (1/round)
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 25, each creature in a 30 foot Cone. Failure: 20 (3d6 + 10) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed up to 20 feet away from the dragon. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Terrifying Roar (recharges After a Short Rest)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 25, each creature in a 120-foot Emanation originating from the dragon that can hear it. Failure: 18 (4d8) Thunder damage, and the target has the Frightened condition (save ends).

action.name: Breathe Deep (1/round)
action.text: The dragon's Breath Weapon recharges. The dragon can only use this Epic Action if it's the first Epic Action it has taken this round. After using this Epic Action, the dragon can't use its Bite or Terrifying Roar until the start of the next round.

action.name: Breath Weapon (special Recharge)
action.text: The dragon can only use this Epic Action if it's the last Epic Action it takes this round. It chooses one of the following effects: Octarine Breath. The dragon breathes a 120-foot cone of prismatic rays. Each ray is a different color and has a different power and purpose. Choose one ability score, then choose Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Psychic, or Radiant damage. Each target must succeed on a DC 25 saving throw using the chosen ability score; it takes 105 (30d6) damage of the chosen type on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a successful one. Mutation Breath. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 25, each creature in a 120-foot Cone. Failure: 90 (20d8) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. Instead of rolling to determine if it gains a mutation, the target automatically gains a mutation. Success: Half damage only. Madness Breath. Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 25, each creature in a 120-foot Cone. Failure: 83 (15d10)Psychic damage, and the target has the Dazed condition (save ends). Failure by 5 or More: 165 (30d10) Psychic damage, and the target instead has the Incapacitated condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only. Wild Magic Breath. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 25, each creature in a 120-foot long, 5-foot wide Line. Failure: 83 (15d10) Radiant damage, and the target triggers an Arcane Anomaly centered on itself. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Spellcasting (1/round)
action.text: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 22, +14 to spell attacks): At Will: Dimension Door, Telekinesis 2/Day Each: Dispel Magic 1/Day Each: Contact Other Plane, Plane Shift (self only), Scrying, Wish

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: The dragon chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The dragon can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

reaction.name: Draconic Rebuke
reaction.text: Trigger: The dragon becomes Bloodied. It can use this Reaction even if it has the Incapacitated condition or is otherwise unable to take Reactions. Response: All conditions and spells on the dragon immediately end unless it chooses to be affected by them, and it can move up to its Fly Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and ignoring Difficult Terrain. The dragon recharges and immediately uses its Terrifying Roar.

monster.spells: Dimension Door, Telekinesis, Dispel Magic, Contact Other Plane, Plane Shift, Scrying, Wish
monster.description:
This unearthly dragon is a crystalline horror, its body formed from angular gem-like scales pulsing with octarine light. Its form is raw delerium. Each scale is a gleaming crystal refracting light into eerie hues of purple, yellow, and green, with an unnatural sharpness that feels both fragile and impossibly durable. The dragon's wings are translucent and webbed with glowing crystal veins that shimmer, casting kaleidoscopic patterns as it moves. Each beat causes the air to hum, vibrating with a chaotic energy that overwhelms and distorts the senses. Each step the dragon takes leaves delicate motes of crystal growing into jagged formations, tainting the landscape. Its eyes are like multifaceted gems, swirling with chaotic magic pooling within their depths. The beast's crystalline horns and talons are razor-sharp, gleaming like polished jewels, yet crackling with eldritch energy.
Perhaps older than the cosmos itself, Ancient Delerium Dragons possess knowledge and memories of worlds and eons which have passed, many more which never were, and countless which cannot be. Their very presence warps the world around them according to their whims.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Delerium Dragon, learning the following based on the result. (15+) Empowered by Eldritch Magic. You understand the dragon's Resistances and senses. (20+) Octarine Breath. You recognize the effects of the Delerium Dragon's breath weapon, as well as noting its Spellcasting capabilities. (25+) Few Weaknesses. You learn its highest and lowest saving throws.
Combat Tactics A Delerium Dragon views combat less as a violent encounter and more as a chance to change foes into a new form. It darts about using flight and teleportation, seldom remaining in the same place for more than a turn. Their movement makes it easy for the dragon to find the perfect place to catch many enemies with its breath weapon. Delerium Dragons love to spread contamination and cause arcane anomalies, and delight causing monstrous transformations with their contaminated attacks. Delerium Dragons use their Bite, Contaminated Rend, and Tail attacks to tear opponents apart in between uses of their breath weapon. When they are unable to close the distance, older Delerium Dragons mentally assault their targets with Mindfire.
Harvestable Components (Legendary) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Glands, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Claws, Teeth. Hide: Scales, Webbed Membrane. Dust: Aberrant Dust. Delerium. In addition, characters can collect delerium crystals from its body. An Ancient Delerium Dragon's body has 1 delerium geode and 2d6 crystals.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 294 -297 (Third Party)

monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Sludge Form
trait.text: The elemental can enter a Hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Contaminated Touch
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: The target gains one Contamination level.

action.name: Engulf
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 15, each Large or smaller creature in the elemental's space. Success: The target is pushed out of the elemental's space. Failure: The target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 15). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition. The elemental can grapple one Large creature or two Medium or smaller creatures at a time. At the start of each of the elemental's turns, the target takes 28 (8d6) Necrotic damage and is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: The target gains one Contamination level. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can take an action to pull a creature or object out of it with a successful DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check.

monster.description:
A mound of iridescently streaked black muck lumbers through the ruins, splashing with each ponderous step. The sludge reshapes into a towering, almost human-like form, with slimy arms and thick unsteady legs. A head bubbles atop its viscous body revealing a slime drooling maw and two hollows for eyes. Yet, it carries a strangely mirthful expression, as if finding joy in its grotesque existence. The mound emits a gravelly roar, full of sinister glee, and barrels towards you, undeterred by the debris in its way.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they Study an Animated Delerium Sludge, learning the following based on their result: (10+) Malleable and Resilient. You learn of the creature's Immunities. (15+) Contamination by Contact. You are aware of its Contaminated Touch and Engulf actions. (20+) Easy to Outwit. You know the elemental's mental ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Animated Delerium Sludge often lies dormant in bodies of water before attempting to Engulf an unsuspecting creature. If reduced to less than 20 Hit Points, it attempts to slip back into the nearby sludge and Hide, hoping to be left alone.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Elemental. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze. Dust: Elemental Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 46 (Third Party)

monster.name: Anomollusk
monster.resist: spell damage, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Snail Trail
trait.text: When the anomollusk moves through a space, it fills the space with contaminated mucus that remains for 10 minutes. A creature that ends its turn in the mucus is covered in goop and subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17. Failure: 20 (8d4) Acid damage, and the target has the Slowed condition. Each time the creature ends its turn with the Slowed condition, it gains a Contamination level. A creature within 5 feet can take an action to clean away the goop, ending the Slowed condition.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation

trait.name: Haze Dependence

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Slobber
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 20 (8d4) Acid damage.

action.name: Creep
action.text: The anomollusk moves up to its Speed, and can enter the spaces of Large or smaller creatures as it does. Each creature whose space it enters is subjected once to the following effect. Strength Saving Throw: DC 17. Success: The target is pushed 5 feet away from the anomollusk into a space of its choice. If the target chooses not to move, it suffers the effects of a failure. Failure: The target has the Prone condition and is subjected to Snail Trail.

reaction.name: Shell Reflection
reaction.text: Trigger: The anomollusk takes damage from a spell or magical attack. Response: The attacker takes Radiant damage equal to the triggering damage and causes an Arcane Anomaly.

monster.description:
A colossal snail as wide as a city street with a shell the size of a small house glides slowly into view. Its shell has a kaleidoscopic fractal shimmer, projecting hues of unknown colors that swirl in incomprehensible patterns. As it moves, its shell seems to refract light in ways that seem nonsensical or wrong. You must strain your eyes to look at it wriggle towards you. Its bulbous head ends in two long antennae each holding a small octarine eye. Slimy mucus drips off its flesh, leaving sizzling trails and corroding anything it touches.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Animal Handling or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study an Anomollusk, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Powerfully Protected. You learn its Resistances as well as its Shell Reflection Reaction. (15+) Dangerous Slime. You are aware of its Snail Trail and Creep abilities. (20+) Slow and Simple Minded. You recognize its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Drawn to magic, Anomollusk's view spellcasters and those equipped with magic items as delicious morsels. It attacks by first using its Creep action before it tries to Slobber on them. If threatened, it tries to cover the enemy and its territory in acidic slime. If reduced to less than half Hit Points, it attempts to flee.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze, Acidic Bile, Mucus. Organs: Eyes, Guts, Glands. Hide: Shell, Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 26 (Third Party)

monster.name: Apex
monster.skill: Acrobatics +10, Athletics +10, Intimidation +10, Medicine +10, Nature +10, Perception +10

trait.text: The Apex regains 20 Hit Points at the start of its turn. If the Apex takes Necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The Apex dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Standing Leap

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 10 ft. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Lightning Bolt (Bonus Action)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 120-foot long, 5-foot wide Line. Failure: 22 (4d10) Lightning damage, and the target has the Shocked condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Fire Blast (Bonus Action)
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +10, range 120 ft. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) Fire damage, and the target and each creature within 10 feet of it is subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18. Failure: The target has the Burning condition (4d8 Fire).

action.name: Cold Snap (Bonus Action)
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature the Apex can see within 120 feet. Failure: 45 (10d8) Cold damage, and the target has the Frozen condition (DC 18). Success: Half damage only.

reaction.name: Rapid Adaptation
reaction.text: Trigger: The Apex takes damage that isn't Necrotic or Psychic. Response: The Apex gains Immunity to that damage type until it is reduced to 0 Hit Points or finishes a Short or Long Rest.

monster.description:
A perfect physical form of humanity stands before you, its flawlessly formed and muscle-bound flesh is tinted in a golden hue while its veins bulge and glow with octarine light. Their eyes emit cascades of light and their voice is a booming chorus. As swirls of fire, ice, and electricity crackle around them, they pulse with unbound energy.
Perfect Transmogrification. Amongst Mutagenists, the quest for genetic perfection can become an all-consuming obsession. Those who seek to achieve this so-called superior state refer to it as the "Apex" and describe the transformation as creating the ultimate humanoid specimen. Through years of study and trials, Mutagenists have perfected their Transmogrifying Elixir to harness the ultimate power of mortal potential. This formula allows them to amplify their natural capabilities to the peak physical form while maintaining their unbound intellect. There is no telling how many long years a Mutagenist has spent in their lab, and how many unwilling test subjects had to suffer the fates of their imperfect formulae before they arrived at the ultimate conclusion of their research. This is the pinnacle of their scientific study, the perfected Transmogrifying Elixir: the Apex Formula.
Permanent Transformation.The process renders the Mutagenist permanently altered. Energy courses through their veins, their strength and agility extended to the very limits of human capabilities. Their form is able to shift and adapt to incoming threats, and they are able to perceive events around them with great precision. Their mind, although it remains intellectually intact by the process, is inherently and irrevocably shattered. No Mutagenist who takes the Apex Formula could ever perceive or admit to the fracturing of their mind. Regardless of their vast intelligence, a sickening madness takes hold of their psyche; one that plunges the apothecary-turned-Apex creature into a hostile, madness-filled rage. They still hold onto the threads of their vast scientific mind, using that as a justification for their actions, unaware of the deranged mental state they now reside within.
The Folly of Perfection. Even Mutagenists who achieve the Apex state have a gnawing question in the back of their minds: is it truly enough? Could they become even more? Their seemingly perfect form is not without subtle flaws, broken psyche, and weaknesses. Many Mutagenists can never truly be satisfied with their results, and even the Apex Formula can never fulfill the unattainable desire for absolute perfection. It is this obsession that has led many Mutagenists to lunacy in the face of their achievements. For even an Apex may spend eternity bound to their workshop, kidnapping unwilling subjects to continue to test and experiment, seeking a perfection that will never truly be achieved.
Roleplaying Traits h Personality Trait. I am humanity perfected! All beings are beneath me, for I am the apex of physical existence. All should cower in my glory! h Bond. Science has granted us this gift! This research is the most valuable scientific discovery in the world and must be protected! h Ideal. Do not try and stop me, for I am offering perfection to all of humanity. Can't you see? The Apex Form will cure the world of all sickness, all flaws, all weakness! h Flaw. There cannot be a weakness in my design. If there is, I will solve it — I just need more time!
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Medicine, Survival, or Arcana gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study the Apex. , learning the following based on the result: (15+) Adapts to Threats. You recognize the Apex's Rapid Adaptation Reaction and Regeneration trait. (20+) Harness the Elements. You are aware of its Bonus Action attacks. (25+) Perfect Form but Fragile Mind. You know the Apex's weakness to Necrotic and Psychic damage.
Combat Tactics The Apex will often be accompanied by several abominations of its own creation. Lab assistants, failed experiments, and Wretched Patients are often by its side. An Apex begins combat by unleashing one of its Bonus Action attacks. It quickly analyzes the battlefield, looking for the most optimal use of its energy. It observes the arrangement of its enemies and decides if it is best to use its lightning, fire, or cold attack based on what will deliver the most damage to the most targets. It then uses its speed to move close to a target to smash it with its Slam attacks. The Apex prefers to target Frozen enemies with its Slams. The Apex is unwilling to see its own flaws, but it is not stupid. If reduced below 60 Hit Points, it unleashes a final attack and attempts to distance itself from its enemies, hoping to escape and recuperate.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Elemental Fluid. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts. Bones: Skull, Spine. Hide: Skin. Dust: Elemental Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 194 -195 (Third Party)

Tattered purple robes hang off the ethereal skeleton drifting silently through the air. Occasionally, they collaborate with other undead, such as Haze Husks and Haze Wights, commanding them like apprentices or minions.

monster.name: Ascendant Vladimir von Drakken (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 125 (10d10 + 70) + 125 (10d10 + 70) per player character.

trait.name: Aura of Dread
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Vladimir von Drakken takes 21 (6d6) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Daywalker

trait.name: Regeneration

trait.name: Rejuvenation

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken always takes his turn on Initiative count 20. On his turn, Vladimir von Drakken can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or Bonus Action on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Vladimir von Drakken takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Bloodmourne
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +15, reach 5 ft. Hit: 35 (6d8 + 8) Force damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition (4d4).

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +15, reach 5 ft. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 23).

action.name: Bite (1/round)
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 23, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 70 (20d6) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Weakened condition (DC 22 Constitution save ends). Vladimir von Drakken regains Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. A Humanoid killed by this damage rises on its next turn as a Vampire Spawn under Vladimir von Drakken's control.

action.name: Soul Rending (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 23, each creature in a 60-foot Cone. Failure: 54 (12d8) Necrotic damage. Failure by 5 or More: Double damage. Success: Half damage.

action.name: Terrifying Glare
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 23, one creature Vladimir von Drakken can see within 120 feet. Failure: 25 (6d6 + 4) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. Failure by 5 or More: While Frightened, the target has the Paralyzed condition.

action.name: Wing Blast (1/round)
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 23, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from Vladimir von Drakken. Failure: 14 (4d6) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from Vladimir von Drakken and has the Prone condition. Failure or Success: Before or after using this Epic Action, Vladimir von Drakken can move up to half his Fly Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

action.name: Aerial Maneuver (1/round)
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken moves up to his Fly Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. He can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

reaction.name: Blood Rage (1/Day)
reaction.text: Trigger: Vladimir von Drakken becomes Bloodied. He can use this Reaction even if he has the Incapacitated condition or is otherwise unable to take Reactions. Response: All conditions and spells on Vladimir von Drakken end unless he chooses to be affected by them, and he can move up to his Fly Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and ignoring Difficult Terrain. Vladimir von Drakken recharges and immediately uses Soul Rending.

monster.description:
"None without this blood within may strike you down, and by this blood you shall not die." — Prophecy uttered during the Sanguine Rite
Covered in the gore exploded from his regal form, Vladimir von Drakken has become a hulking monstrosity. Now twelve feet tall, his upper frame is hunched over, and his arms support him like a gorilla. Spiked bones and frilled fins emerge from his arms and his clawed hands are large enough to crush skulls. Bladed scythes and spikes sprout from great batlike wings. The remains of his armor and cloak hang over his swelling new form. Bony protrusions jut from his head like a demonic crown. His once-imperial countenance is gone, replaced by a beastly face, a cross between wolf, bat, and dragon. Trickling blood and sweat, he breathes heavily between grunts, growls, and roars, barely uttering a sentence without howling.
In his Ascendant form, Vladimir von Drakken is truly a monster. Once he ascends to this form, he savagely attacks anyone he sees, including his own underlings.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. Vladimir speaks with vile overconfidence, a sinister smirk, and a demeanor of a creature who believes himself a god, he does not tolerate others treating him as any less than a king of kings. • Bond. Vladimir will stop at nothing to conquer the continent and reclaim his throne in Drakkenheim. He made it, and it is his to rule, any other who attempts to sit upon it is an imposter. • Ideal. "This realm belongs to the dead, and the dead shall keep it. Any who stand in the way of my reign will join my legions by choice, or by force." • Flaw. Vladimir believes himself entirely indestructible and is blind to the loopholes within the rites that created him. Nevertheless, he is hesitant to trust anyone. He refuses to let anyone get close and assumes everyone is plotting against him.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Religion gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine Vladimir von Drakken, learning the following based on the result: (15+) Deadly Foe. You know of the creature's Resistances and Immunities. (20+) Renowned Swordsman. You are aware of his Bloodmourne and Bite attacks. (25+) Nearly Undefeatable. You recognize his Reborn or Ascendent Transformation trait.
Combat Tactics Vladimir von Drakken is presented here in three forms. As the Ascendent Vampire grows in power he transforms into a new form until he returns to his full strength. If he is successfully resurrected with the Sanguine Rite, Vladimir von Drakken first begins in his Crypt-Starved form. He remains in this form until he consumes the blood of a living descendant of House von Drakken, which enables him to turn into his Reborn form. If reduced to 0 Hit Points in his Reborn form, Vladimir von Drakken unleashes his Ascendant form. In his Crypt-Starved form, Vladimir von Drakken is a craven and desperate combatant. He primarily aims to drink as much blood as possible using his Bite to transform into his Reborn form. He makes use of Shadow Step and Terrifying Glare to reposition himself and hold foes at bay. Once he regains his Reborn form, Vladimir von Drakken is nearly unstoppable. He wades into melee with Bloodmourne, demonstrating his martial superiority by using his manoeuvres. He uses his Claws and Bite as finishing moves and uses Dominate to bend his foes to his will. When surrounded, he uses Wing Blast to reposition. Assuming his Ascendant form, Vladimir von Drakken becomes an engine of bloodlust and destruction, fueled by primal rage and undead power. In this form, he rips foes apart with melee attacks and flays their spirits whenever his Soul Rend becomes available.
Slaying Vladimir von Drakken Vladimir cannot be fully destroyed unless he is wholly unmade at the place he was first transformed. Wholly destroying Vladimir von Drakken is difficult. Once he is defeated in combat, with the final blow struck by one who shares his blood, his heart must be cut out, and placed upon the altar within the Standing Stones in in the Brachenwald where he was transformed into a vampire.Under a full moon at midnight, a wooden stake made from a branch from Elenthas the Evertree must be driven through the heart by one of his blood descendants. Then, the heart must be left there until sunrise where it is destroyed by first light. Vladimir von Drakken's minions do not stand idly whilst this happens, and launch a massive assault upon the grove with the desperate aim of retrieving his heart before it is destroyed by the sun.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 264 -265 (Third Party)

monster.description:
Two insectoid legs hold up the beetle-like creature, rhythmically clacking as it skitters about. Two clawed arms scrabble beneath blade-like limbs as gnashing mandibles chitter under its beady eyes. A massive pincer-like horn protrudes from its helmet-shaped head and a tough blueish-silver shell protects delicate wings hidden beneath.

You know its strongest and weakest saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Beetle Knight is surprisingly agile, rarely standing still in battle. They charge during the first round, flinging enemies aside or attempting to grapple. If possible, they back up to charge again but will otherwise defend with their arm blades. They attempt to flee losing battles where their Hit Points fall below half their maximum.
