action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +15, reach 10 ft. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) Piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 23). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition and Bigger Linda can't Bite another target.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +15, reach 15 ft. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed 20 feet away from Bigger Linda and has the Prone condition.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +15, reach 5 ft. Hit: 25 (3d10 + 9) Bludgeoning damage. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 23. Failure: The target has the Staggered condition (save ends).

action.name: Breathe Deep
action.text: Bigger Linda's Breath Weapon recharges. Bigger Linda can only take this Epic Action as the first Epic Action she uses this round. After using this Epic Action, Bigger Linda can't take her Bite Epic Action until the start of the next round.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Special Recharge)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 22, each creature in a 60-foot long, 5-foot wide Line. Failure: 31 (7d8) Necrotic damage plus 31 (7d8) Force damage, and the target gains a Contamination level. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Trampling Rampage (Recharges When Bloodied)
action.text: Bigger Linda moves up to her Speed in a straight line, moving through the space of Large or smaller creatures in her path. She makes one Stomp attack against each creature she moves through.

action.name: Teleport (1/round)
action.text: Bigger Linger teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see within the Deep Haze.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: Bigger Linda chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on her. Bigger Linda can use this Epic Action even if she would otherwise be unable to take actions, her actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters her game statistics.

monster.description:
Thundering through the streets of Drakkenheim with a crash, the infamous pet of the Queen of Thieves has mutated and enlarged to unfathomable proportions. The Haze swirls around it, and octarine energy pulses in its sunken eye sockets. The broken hafts of weapons and old arrows are embedded into its scales, stuck deeply between its regenerated flesh. Its spined back is illuminated by webs of glowing octarine veins; its wide snout is filled with jagged teeth. As it opens its maw wide, the building contaminated energy at the back of its throat begins to glow.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 31 (Third Party)

monster.name: Blackjack Mel
monster.skill: Deception +7, Insight +4, Persuasion +7, Perception +2, Sleight of Hand +7, Stealth +7

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If Blackjack Mel is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if he fails, provided he doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

action.name: Knife
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage.

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: Blackjack Mel takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature Blackjack Mel can see deals damage to him with an attack. Response: Blackjack Mel halves the damage he takes from that attack.

monster.description:
A short and scrawny man in his late thirties stands before you with a funny-looking but clean-shaven mug and greasy slicked-back hair. He wears a black padded jacket and buckled slacks that appear distinguished at first glance but are actually quite shabby and worn.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. I can always make a deal with the right angle, I just gotta pitch it the right way. I don't give up when the mark doesn't take the bait, just try something new! • Ideal. We're all in this for ourselves. You scratch my back, I'll scratch yours. • Bond. Listen, I got some close connections with some powerful people. You wanna meet the Queen of Thieves? Stick with me. We'll go places together. Just uh, watch out you don't piss anyone off, okay? • Flaw. I'm a compulsive liar, so what? Yeah, sometimes even I get confused by my own lies, but the truth can always do with a little exaggeration, it makes life more interesting!
Combat Tactics Blackjack Mel is a coward, a swindler, and a thief. He is often surrounded by Thugs and Assassins who protect him; Mel rarely draws a blade. His overconfidence relies on his company, and he will often only take a stab at someone if they are held down. Mel's first line of defense is his mouth. He will double-cross, backstab, swindle, and con even his allies to ensure his own survival. He knows a lot of information about a lot of things and will use his well of secrets to bargain for his safety. He is also clever and will usually only divulge half of a fact to save his life, ensuring the other half will be granted once his safety is ensured. He knows very well that information is what keeps him alive, and he isn't about to use up that usefulness. Mel flees without question at any opportunity if he feels threatened, and often keeps a Potion of Invisibility on his person for just such instances.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 351 (Third Party)

monster.name: Bloated Dreg

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The dreg can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Acid Spray (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 11, each creature in a 15-foot Cone. Failure: 5 (2d4) Acid damage and is Burning (2d4 Acid).

monster.description:
A gurgling moan emerges from the dark as the slopping footsteps of a bloated form emerges. Its rippling, sagging flesh is wet and dripping. Its rotund face and soggy skin are covered in boils, blisters, and leaking sores. Wet, acidic saliva dribbles down its chin, leaving trails of burned flesh. The Dreg's one arm is a mass of writhing slick tentacles. As its mouth opens, a low gurgling sound slowly builds.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Bloated Dreg, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Corrupted by Contaminated Water. You know the creature is an Aberration with a Swim speed, and it can breathe underwater. (10+) Slow and Polluted. You recognize the Bloated Dreg's Acid Spray attack. (15+) Mockery of Humanity. You are aware of the Bloated Dreg's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Bloated Dreg shuffles aimlessly through Drakkenheim, stopping to rest in places where contaminated water has built up, or in pools of delerium sludge. It produces large amounts of acidic bile in its guts that it expels when threatened. A Bloated Dreg will retreat to its watery home when threatened, trying to hide amongst the contaminated liquids.
Harvestable Components (Common) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Acidic Bile. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 93 (Third Party)

monster.name: Bloated Hive

trait.name: Insect Swarm
trait.text: The bloated hive emits a 10-foot Emanation of buzzing insects. A creature that starts its turn in the Emanation takes 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Disrupt the Hive
trait.text: When the bloated hive dies, it immediately spawns a Swarm of Contaminated Insects in its space.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Bloated Hive makes two attacks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Slashing damage.

action.name: Spawn Swarm (recharge 5–6)
action.text: The bloated hive creates a Swarm of Contaminated Insects, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet. The swarm takes its turn immediately after the bloated hive.

action.name: Distracting Swarm (Bonus Action)
action.text: The bloated hive causes its Insect Swarm to fly in the face of a creature within 5 feet of it. The target can't take Reactions until the end of the bloated hive's turn.

monster.description:
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Bloated Hive, recognizing the following based on their result: (5+) Sightless Awareness. You know the creature's Immunities and senses. (10+) Endless insects! You are aware of the creature's Spawn Swarm action and Disrupt the Hive trait. (15+) Frail. You recognize the Bloated Hive's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Bloated Hive is usually a solitary creature that spends its time cowering in dark corners living out its cursed life as nothing more than a conduit for its colony. In combat, they focus entirely on keeping their distance from threats and spawning swarms of insects to defend themselves. If cornered, the Bloated Hive uses its Claws and Distracting Swarm before moving back into the shadows and attempting to escape and find a new nest. Larger packs of Bloated Hives are much braver and more violent, and actively hunt and pursue targets until their numbers are less than their prey. Places where large colonies gather are dangerous. The Bloated Hives work in unison to protect their nests. Only if they become outnumbered do they flee.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Mucus, Sap. Organs: Guts, Glands, Flesh. Bones: Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Claws. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 32 -33 (Third Party)

monster.name: Blood Leech

trait.name: Aquatic Camouflage
trait.text: The leech has Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in aquatic terrain.

trait.name: Blood Bags
trait.text: The leech has three blood bags in its body. When encountered,roll 1d3 to determine how many blood bags are filled with blood. The rest are empty.

action.name: Attach
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach 0 ft. Hit: The leech attaches to the target. While attached, the leech doesn't attack, and moves with the target, using none of the leech's movement. The leech can detach itself using 5 feet of movement, and detaches immediately if its blood bags are filled or if the target dies. A creature within 5 feet can take an action to detach the leech with a successful DC 13 Wisdom (Medicine) check. Failure: The leech is still detached, but the target has the Bleeding condition (2d4). Failure by 5 or More: The leech isn't detached and the target takes 8 (2d4 + 3) Piercing damage.

action.name: Blood Drain (Bonus Action)
action.text: The leech can use this Bonus Action only when it is attached to a creature. The attached creature loses 10 (3d6) Hit Points due to blood loss, and the blood leech fills one of its empty blood bags with some of the target's blood.

action.name: Blood Transfusion (Bonus Action)
action.text: The leech can use this Bonus Action only when it is attached to a creature and has at least one filled blood bag. The attached creature regains 10 (3d6) Hit Points, and the leech empties one of its filled blood bags.

monster.description:
The black, plump wriggling form of the leech squirms and crawls. Its oily, slick skin is wet and slippery. It lets out a high-pitched screech as it lunges towards its prey.
Although the practice of draining a patient's blood to draw out illness and disease is long discredited, many apothecaries understand the value of transfusing blood during surgical procedures. However, storing the blood long term can be a problem. Apothecaries have solved by modifying normal leeches with occult science, transforming the creatures into living blood bags. While these bloodletting techniques are of dubious therapeutic value to patients, they make an effective method for collecting samples from less-than-willing subjects. Though often benign in nature, these bloated leeches can be turned to violent purpose by an apothecary willing to use the creatures in such a manner. During combat, an apothecary may dispatch the leeches against their foes, then call the creatures back to themselves to heal using their foe's blood.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a leech, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Quick Swimmers. You know the leech's Swim speed and senses. (15+) Blood Transfer. You know of the Blood Leech's Blood Drain and Blood Infusion.
Combat Tactics Leeches attempt to get close to a target to Bite and Attach to them. They do not retreat, as they are driven by their basic need to feed on the blood of others and nothing else.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Goopy Ooze, Mucus. Organs: Brain, Guts. Natural Weapons: Mandibles. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 204 -205 (Third Party)

monster.name: Body Snatcher
monster.languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Clinging Shadows
trait.text: A creature in Dim Light or Darkness has Disadvantage on ability checks to escape the body snatcher's grapple. Each time a creature attempts to escape the body snatcher's grapple while it is in Dim Light or Darkness, the creature takes 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage. If this Necrotic damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target is stabilized but has the Paralyzed condition for 1 hour, even if it regains Hit Points.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
trait.text: The body snatcher takes 10 (3d6) Radiant damage if it ends its turn in sunlight, and has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks while in sunlight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The body snatcher makes four Grabbing Hands attacks.

action.name: Grabbing Hands
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the body snatcher can't use this hand against another target. The body snatcher has four hands, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Shadow Teleport (Bonus Action)
action.text: The body snatcher teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see that is in Dim Light or Darkness. It can bring any Medium or smaller creature it is grappling, teleporting that creature to an unoccupied space it can see within 5 feet of its destination that is also in Dim Light or Darkness. An unwilling creature can make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw to resist being teleported. On a successful save, neither the creature nor the body snatcher teleport.

monster.description:
This patchwork monster of stitched-together corpses oozes black ichor from its seams. The figure is a hulking form, about 7 feet tall with broad shoulders and a hunched back. Its head seems small compared to its body, with pale white eyes highlighting sunken dark sockets. A lipless mouth forces the creature into a constant menacing grimace. Draped in a thick black trench coat and wide brimmed hat while smelling of sulfur and brimstone, the unsettling humming and mumbling of the creature echoes in the ears of those it is about to grab. The most unsettling feature is the creature's four arms, which end in massive, oversized hands, each with eight long, spindly fingers. The creature shifts from shadow to shadow effortlessly, in a haunting ghost-like fashion unusual for its size.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Body Snatcher, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Emotionless Undead. You know the Body Snatcher's condition Immunities. (15+) Shadowy Energy. You are aware of its Clinging Shadows trait. (20+) In the Dark of Night. You recognize the Body Snatcher's Sunlight Weakness trait.
Combat Tactics The Body Snatcher sticks to dimly lit areas or places of complete darkness. It teleports up to a creature and attempts to grapple it, teleporting away as soon as it has one or two targets in its hands. Often the Body Snatcher will emerge from tunnels or secret entrances to its lair. They do not travel far from the labs they were created in and often have easy points of escape to disappear once they have a victim in hand.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Undead. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts. Bones: Skull, Spine. Hair: Stitches, Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Undead Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 196 (Third Party)

monster.name: Bojack

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The bojack can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the bojack remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal animal corpse.

trait.name: Sudden Death
trait.text: Creatures that haven't yet taken a turn in combat are Helpless against attacks made by the bojack.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bojack makes two attacks, using Impaling Limbs or Corrosive Mucus in any combination.

action.name: Impaling Limbs
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Piercing damage and the target is Bleeding (2d6). While Bleeding in this way, the target is also Slowed.

action.name: Corrosive Mucus
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) Acid damage and the target is Burning (2d4 Acid). While Burning in this way, the target's AC becomes 10 + its Dexterity modifier.

action.name: Predatory Cunning (Bonus Action)
action.text: The bojack takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

monster.description:
This creature, which appears to be a dead horse flopped on its back, convulses and its stomach suddenly splits open, exposing its intestines and organs. Long, spindly, arachnid-like legs violently sprout from its torso as its stomach opens into a maw filled with sharp jagged teeth formed from the splayed rib cage of the beast. The horse legs limply hang in the air, as the creature skitters towards you with intense speed, intestines flapping around its maw like a sickly tongue. The head of the horse dangles lifelessly, but its mouth still gnashes and salivates acidic bile.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Bojack, learn the following based on their result: (10+) Parasitic Mutation. You recognize the BoJack's Immunities and senses. (15+) Acidic Ambusher. You're aware of the creature's Corrosive Mucus and Impaling Limbs attacks. (20+) Fast and Cunning. You know the Bojack's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Bojack is an ambush skirmisher. It waits for the opportune moment to strike, attempting to surprise as many targets as possible. After it surprises its prey, it attacks with its Impaling Limbs or Corrosive Mucus and uses its Predatory Cunning to move out of melee range. The Bojack can climb walls and will try and skitter up buildings or behind walls, springing back out to attack before escaping again. If brought below 20 Hit Points, the BoJack attempts to Dash away and Hide.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Acidic Bile, Mucus. Organs: Heart, Guts, Glands. Bones: Spine. Natural Weapons: Blades. Hair: Fur, Hair. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 34 -35 (Third Party)

monster.name: Cacophonous Chimera (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 54 (4d12 + 28) plus 54 (4d12 + 28) per player character.

trait.name: Cacophonous Chorus
trait.text: The cacophonous chimera creates a 30-foot Emanation of noise. A creature that starts its turn in the Emanation that can hear it takes 10 (3d6) Thunder damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
trait.text: The cacophonous chimera has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The cacophonous chimera always takes its turn on Initiative count 20. On its turn, the cacophonous chimera can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the cacophonous chimera takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Claws and Talons
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) Slashing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it has the Prone condition.

action.name: Contaminated Bite (1/round)
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17. Failure: The target gains a Contamination level.

action.name: Lamprey Tail
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 30 ft. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) Piercing damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition (2d4).

action.name: Aerial Maneuver (1/round)
action.text: The cacophonous chimera flies up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

action.name: Cacophony (1/round)
action.text: The cacophonous chimera's three heads sing a discordant song. The effect of the song varies based on which of the chimera's head is taking the lead. Each time the cacophonous chimera uses this Epic Action, it can't use the same effect it chose last round. Bewildering Chitter (Ratling). Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 300-foot Emanation originating from the chimera that can hear it. Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Bewildered condition (save ends). Chilling Howl (Garmyr). Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 300-foot Emanation originating from the cacophonous chimera that can hear it. Failure: 10 (3d6) Cold damage, and the target has the Immobilized condition (save ends). Staggering Screech (Harpy). Charisma Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 300-foot Emanation originating from the cacophonous chimera that can hear it. Failure: 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Staggered condition (save ends).

action.name: Wing Blast
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature within 15 feet of the cacophonous chimera. Failure: 13 (2d6 + 6) Thunder damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the chimera. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: The cacophonous chimera chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The cacophonous chimera can use this Epic Action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

reaction.name: Crescendo of Chaos (1/Day)
reaction.text: Trigger: The cacophonous chimera becomes Bloodied. It can take this Reaction even if it has the Incapacitated condition or is otherwise unable to take Reactions. Response: All conditions and spells on the cacophonous chimera immediately end unless it chooses to be affected by them, and it can move up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and ignoring Difficult Terrain. It then unleashes a blast of thunderous power. Creatures within 300 feet of it who can hear it are subjected to the following effect. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 17. Failure: 17 (5d6) Thunder damage plus 17 (5d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Prone condition and can't stand until the end of its next turn.

monster.description:
The Cacophonous Chimera's three heads include a chittering rat, a screeching harpy, and a howling garmyr, which together perform a madness-inducing chorus as they slaughter their prey. Its forelimbs are clawed rat-like paws, its rear legs are avian talons, and the beast's colossal furry body is borne upon massive wings of blood-red feathers with a slithering lamprey eel for a tail.
Roleplaying Traits The following traits can be used to inspire roleplaying the Cacophonous Chimera: • Personality Trait: "Just ONCE can we chat with someone a little before we eat them? RARGH! STOP TALKING! RIP AND TEAR! NO! NO! NO! Our stomach is FOUR TIMES bigger than it used to be! I'm STARVING!" • Bond: "We're fused together. Although each of us wants to be separated, in truth we're afraid of what would happen if we were ever torn apart." • Ideal: "I make such wonderful music! Each howl, shriek, and chitter resonates to form a deadly orchestra. I can't stand silence!" • Flaw: "We're constantly arguing. Our internal strife often distracts us from opportunities or leads us into traps, as we can't agree even on the simplest decisions."
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they Study a Cacophonous Chimera, learning the following based on their result: (15+) Freakish Fusion. You're aware of the chimera's Epic Resistance Epic Action. (20+) Fighting for Control. You recognize the chimera's Cacophony Epic Action, noting that if the creature could be silenced, it would be far less formidable. (25+) Powerful but Distracted. You understand its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Desperate to eat and consume, the Cacophonous Chimera viciously attacks prey on sight despite the desires of its harpy head to engage in a little conversation first. The Cacophonous Chimera is not a very subtle hunter. Its prey can hear it coming by the sound of its droning cacophony from at least a city block away, which may give them opportunity to prepare, hide, or flee. The range of its Cacophony can affect creatures before they can see the chimera itself. By the time the chimera arrives, its prey may be shaken and immobilized by the sound. Depending on how ravenous and furious it is, the chimera closes with its prey and tears them apart using its Claws, Bite, and Tail. Against a target that shows resilience to its cacophony or who retaliates with formidable attacks of their own, the chimera keeps a middle distance, trying to keep out of melee range while leaving its foes in its Cacophonous Chorus aura. However, its ravenous Garmyr head and Ratling head can often get in the way of the better judgment here, prompting the chimera to engage in melee even when it would not be advantageous. Furthermore, the three creatures are generally too busy arguing or overconfident to think twice about the actual danger and stakes they might be facing, and so may need to be grievously wounded before fleeing is an option.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws. Hair: Fur, Hair, Feathers. Hide: Skin, Webbed Membrane.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 36 -37 (Third Party)

monster.name: Cerebrograft
monster.languages: The languages of its creator; telepathy 30 ft.

trait.name: Dual Minds
trait.text: The cerebrograft has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Frightened, Stunned, and Unconscious conditions.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cerebrograft makes two Slam attacks and uses Telekinetic Grip.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Telekinetic Grip
action.text: The cerebrograft reaches out with its mind to hold one creature or object it can see within 120 feet of it in its psychic grasp. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Strength Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target is moved up to 30 feet in any direction and has the Restrained condition until the start of the cerebrograft's next turn or until the cerebrograft has the Incapacitated condition. If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The cerebrograft can also exert fine control on objects with its telekinesis, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

action.name: Psychic Crush (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the cerebrograft. Failure: 22 (4d10) Psychic damage, and the target has the Dazed condition (save ends). Failure by 5 or More: The target instead has the Stunned condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only.

monster.description:
Given the strange features of this massive, muscled, eight-foot-tall figure, it is difficult to say if it was once human or a troll. Its bruised skin stretches and rips over barely contained muscles. It is pin-headed, with an emotionless face, glassy-eyes, and a slack-jawed maw. Most disturbingly, its ribcage is splayed open, revealing guts and viscera along with a smaller, vestigial creature with wrinkled flesh and a mewling mouth. It holds its sticklike arms and curled fingers close, and its neck can barely hold its massive head. Thin translucent skin covers its huge brain, the blood vessels within softly glowing. Raising its tiny hands to its temples, its eyes bulge and its face contorts into a twisted expression.
Improved Lackeys. A Cerebrograft is often the "reward" granted to a pair of loyal lab assistants, a means of "removing deficiencies" by combining their bodies and minds, frequently named a portmanteau of its constituent beings.
Dominant Personality. Although intended to be a symbiosis of two minds, typically, the implanted creature subsumes the psyche of its host, fully controlling the new form. However, sometimes, the two beings form a constituent mind combining elements of the originals, or even a bicameral mind where the original two debate internally over what action to take.
Delicate Work. Thanks to their psionic abilities, Cerebrografts are well suited to controlling other test subjects. Apothecaries find their precise telekinetic powers especially useful in surgical procedures and laboratory experiments.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Cerebrograft, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Occult Fleshmending. You uncover the Cerebrograft's Dual Minds trait. (15+) Powerful Psionics. You recognize its Telekinetic Grip and Psychic Crush. (20+) Powerful, Clumsy, and Slow. You learn the Cerebrograft's ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Despite its physical and psionic might, Cerebrografts prefers fighting alongside allies of its apothecary master. When confronted with multiple foes, it tries to overwhelm their minds using Psychic Crush to escape and find reinforcements. A Cerebrograft uses its Telekinetic Grip to hold its enemies, unruly test subjects, and wild experiments at bay. It typically focuses on one target, allowing allies to pummel the Restrained foe. If it can, it uses the environment to its advantage, moving foes to restrain them such as into mancles, cages, or surgery tables.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts. Bones: Skull, Spine. Hair: Stitches. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 197 (Third Party)

monster.name: Chemist

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Studded Leather.

trait.name: Critical Condition
trait.text: A creature that rolls a natural 1 on a saving throw against the chemist's attacks or effects takes maximum damage from the attack or effect.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The chemist makes one Caustic Grip attack and uses either Chemical Spray or Explosive Concoction, if available.

action.name: Caustic Grip
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 24 (8d4 + 4) Acid damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 17). Until the grapple ends, the target has the Restrained condition and the chemist can't use Caustic Grip against another target. At the end of each of its turns, the target takes 24 (8d4 + 4) Acid damage.

action.name: Chemical Spray
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: 28 (8d6) Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (the chemist's choice). Success: Half damage.
action.attack: Acid, Cold, Fire, Or Lightning Damage||8d6

action.name: Explosive Concoction (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 20-foot radius Sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of the chemist. Failure: 45 (10d8) Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (the chemist's choice), and the target has the Burning condition (4d6, same damage type). Success: Half damage only.
action.attack: Acid, Cold, Fire, Or Lightning Damage||10d8

action.name: Acid Rain (1/Day)
action.text: The chemist conjures a storm of acid rain in a 20-foot radius, 20-foot tall Cylinder centered on a point it can see within 120 feet. Exposed flames in the area are doused. Chemical pools accumulate in the area and emit thick fumes, rendering it Difficult Terrain and Lightly Obscured. The storm and the pools evaporate after 1 minute. A creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there is subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17. Failure: 30 (12d4) Acid damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Emergency Dose (Bonus Action)
action.text: The chemist administers a restorative poultice to itself or a creature it can see within 5 feet that isn't a Construct or Undead. The target regains 35 (10d6) Hit Points. Once a creature benefits from Emergency Dose, it can't do so again until it finishes a Short or Long Rest.

monster.description:
The figure is garbed in large safety goggles, an acid-burned thick lab apron, white chemical-stained lab coat, and rubber gloves. The skin on their face is the only visible flesh on them, scarred by bubbling chemical burns.
Chemist Minions. Although Chemists often do not dabble in creating creatures, any apothecary can make use of minions. Simple elementals and oozes can be found in a Chemist's lab. Tankers work as a good lab assistant for administering large amounts of chemical formulae for the scientist, while Living Biohazards are often the failed early experiments of many Chemists. A Chemystral is the ultimate pride and joy of many chemists.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. I revel in the chaos and destruction that my concoctions cause, watching the flames and corrosion with maniacal laughter and a crazed gleam in my eyes. • Ideal. Creativity is born from chaos; the most ground breaking discoveries require pushing boundaries, no matter the dangers involved. • Bond. I am obsessed with avenging my mentor, who was persecuted by those who feared our knowledge and power. • Flaw. My obsession with perfecting destructive formulae often leads me to take careless risks, sabotaging my own work and safety. I've burned down my own workshop more times than I can remember, and I'll do it again.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Chemist, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Resistance from Exposure. You know of the Chemist's damage Resistances and Immunities. (15+) Masters of Compounds. You learn the Chemist's Critical Condition trait and Explosive Compound action. (20+) Mental, not Physical, Prowess. You are aware of the Chemist's AC and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Chemists opt to start things off with a bang, unleashing their Explosive Concoction on the first round, especially against a grouped together party. They use Acid Rain to create a dangerous zone between them and their enemies and default to unleashing their Chemical Spray on enemies stuck in the difficult area. If a creature closes the distance on the Chemist, they use their Caustic Grip. If they find themselves surrounded or outnumbered in close quarters, they attempt to escape.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 183 (Third Party)

monster.name: Chemystral
monster.resist: acid, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone

trait.name: Amorphous Form
trait.text: The chemystral can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

trait.name: Cold Vulnerability
trait.text: If the chemystral takes Cold damage, it becomes Frozen (DC 15). While it has the Frozen condition, it loses its Immunities to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage and its Resistance to Force damage, and it gains Vulnerability to Thunder damage. In addition to the normal means, the Frozen condition ends if the chemystral takes 20 points of Force, Piercing, Thunder, or Slashing damage.

trait.name: Elemental Reaction
trait.text: If the Chemystral takes Acid, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Necrotic damage, it takes on elemental properties which change the damage type of its Chemical Spray and Engulf actions to match that damage type. In addition, it causes an additional effect when it hits with its Chemical Spray attack: • Acid. On a hit, the target has the Burning condition (4d6 Acid). • Fire. On a hit, the target has the Burning condition (4d6 Fire). • Lightning. On a hit, the target has the Shocked condition until the end of its next turn. • Poison. On a hit, the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. • Necrotic. On a hit, the chemystral regains Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The chemystral regains 25 Hit Points at the start of its turn. If the chemystral takes Cold or Thunder damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The chemystral dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Sonic Neutralization
trait.text: When the chemystral takes Thunder damage, it loses any active benefit from its Elemental Reaction trait.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The chemystral makes two Chemical Spray attacks and uses Engulf.

action.name: Chemical Spray
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 35 (10d6) Acid damage.

action.name: Engulf
action.text: The chemystral moves up to its Speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the chemystral enters a creature's space, the creature is subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17. Success: The creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the chemystral. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw. Failure: The chemystral enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 35 (10d6) Acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, has the Restrained condition, and takes 35 (10d6) Acid damage at the start of each of the chemystral's turns. The engulfed creature has Total Cover from effects outside the chemystral. When the chemystral moves, the engulfed creature moves with it. The chemystral can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time. An engulfed creature can take an action to escape with a successful DC 17 Strength check, entering a space of its choice within 5 feet of the ooze.

monster.description:
This massive, undulating chemical ooze shimmers in hues of blue, green, pink, and purple. Its large amorphous form throbs and wobbles as it alters its composition constantly to adapt to its surrounding environments. Everything the blob touches dissolves quickly within its form. The distinct smell of bile and stomach acid surround it.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Chemystral, learning the following based on the result: (15+) Living Chemical Reaction. You know the Chemystral's Resistances and Immunities. (20+) Elemental Adaption. You uncover the Chemystral's Elemental Reaction trait. (25+) Weakness to Cold. You recognize the Chemystral's Cold Vulnerability trait.
Combat Tactics The Chemystral attempts to Engulf as many victims as it can. It cares little about taking elemental damage and only thinks to retreat if it is consistently taking Cold damage.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Ooze. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze, Elemental Fluid. Organs: Glands.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 198 (Third Party)

trait.text: When the dreg hits a creature with an Opportunity Attack, that creature's Speed becomes 0 until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation

trait.name: Haze Dependence

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dreg makes two Bone Blade attacks.

action.name: Bone Blade
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Force damage, and the target has Disadvantage on attack rolls against any creature other than the dreg until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Sentinel Strike
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature within 5 feet of the dreg takes the Disengage action or makes a melee attack roll against a target other than the dreg. Response: The dreg makes an Opportunity Attack against that creature.

monster.description:
The body and face of this mutated wretch is covered in thick, knobby bone plates that have torn violently through their flesh. The exposed ribs of their chest have fused together into a single plate, forming an armor-like appearance. Past their elbow, the muscle and sinew of their forelimbs hangs limply from their protruding exposed bones, which have been reshaped into long, serrated bone-blades caked with gore.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Chitinous Dreg, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Protective Plates. You recognize the Dreg's AC. (10+) Pinning Blades. You learn of the creature's Bone Blade attack and No Escape trait. (15+) Sturdy Foe. You are aware of the Chitinous Dreg's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Chitinous Dregs often charge into the front lines of combat. It positions itself between other Dregs and their foes almost as if it was defending its allies. Chitinous Dregs attempt to draw the combat towards itself at all times, using its Bone Blades to keep the focus on it, and its Sentinel Strike Reaction and No Escape trait to ensure creatures facing it cannot get away. The Chitinous Dreg is a warrior and rarely retreats: it is too enraged with a protective bloodlust when thrust into battle to worry about its own wellbeing.

Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 94 (Third Party)

action.name: Chitter (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature within 120 feet of the chitter that can hear it. Failure: The target has the Dazed condition until the end of the chitter's next turn.

action.name: Aggressive (Bonus Action)
action.text: The chitter moves up to its Speed toward a Hostile creature it can see. If it ends this movement adjacent to the creature, it gains Advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the end of its turn.

reaction.name: Slow Fall
reaction.text: Trigger: The chitter takes falling damage and doesn't have the Incapacitated condition. Response: The triggering damage is reduced to 0.

monster.description:
Scampering up the wall is a creature the size of a hound. It resembles a mostly hairless squirrel save for its bushy tail and patchy tufts of mottled fur. Its eyes are glassy and milk white, and its mouth seems almost human, sporting huge, pearly white teeth that grin maniacally. It frantically clambers upward, while chittering a maddening chorus with its clacking teeth.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Animal Handling gain Advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks to Study a Chitter, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Wall Crawling. You are aware of its climb speed, its Running Leap trait, and its Slow Fall feature. (10+) Madding Noise. You know of its Chitter attack action. (15+) Simple Minded. You recognize its mental ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Chitters often attack in a small group. Usually two to three that form a family will stick together. The mutated squirrels have been known to be quite territorial and hostile, even to other Chitter families who try to infringe on their territory. Chitters are excellent climbers, capable of falling a great distance without fear of hurting themselves. It is not uncommon for Chitters to be found in tall buildings, or up on the top floor of ruined houses, or hard-to-reach rooftops or attics. Chitters charge their enemies and leap at them, attempting to disable them with their chittering, and relying on their Claws and Bite. Chitters protect their homes with determined ferocity, but if reduced to less than a third of their Hit Points, they leap and clamber away.

monster.name: Congregation
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Dispersal
trait.text: When the congregation is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it leaves behind 2d4 Pilgrims in its place.

trait.name: Mob
trait.text: The congregation can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the congregation can move through any opening large enough for a Medium Humanoid. The congregation can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The congregation makes one attack against each creature in its space.

action.name: Torches
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 0 ft. Hit: The target has the Burning condition (4d6 Fire).

action.name: Pitchforks
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 0 ft. Hit: 28 (8d6) Piercing damage, or 14 (4d6) Piercing damage if the congregation has the Bloodied condition. The target has the Prone condition.

action.name: Trample (Bonus Action)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature in the congregation's space that has the Prone condition. Failure: 17 (2d10 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. Success: Half damage.

monster.description:
A crowd of pilgrims brandish clubs, torches, and pitchforks. They begin to muster up courage, spouting out passages from the writings of the Falling Fire, calling out the blasphemous to be brought low by the fires to cleanse them of their sins.
Falling Fire Combat Tactics Falling Fire pilgrims give up their possessions and wealth and often carry very little on them. For the most part, common Falling Fire devotees are not equipped to fight. Most members try to avoid combat. Preferring a peaceful approach, they are more reactionary in their tactics and hope most situations do not come to bloodshed. However, Drakkenheim is a dangerous city, and monsters and bandits have attempted to thwart the efforts of the devout worshippers often. Pilgrims have been known to take up clubs, daggers, and any mundane weapons they can find to defend themselves, and often groups of traveling pilgrims are accompanied by armored zealots and spellcasting divine leaders who are ready to protect their flock.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 342 -345 (Third Party)

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The crater wurm makes a Bite attack, then makes Bite attacks against each creature adjacent to the first target.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach 10 ft. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) Piercing damage, and if it is Large or smaller, the target is subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 22. Failure: The target is swallowed by the wurm. The target has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, has Total Cover against effects originating from outside the wurm, and takes 36 (8d8) Necrotic damage at the start of each of the wurm's turns. A creature that takes this Necrotic damage must also succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or gain one Contamination level. If the wurm takes 30+ damage on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which land in spaces within 10 feet of the wurm with the Prone condition. If the wurm dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting with the Prone condition.

action.name: Breach
action.text: The wurm moves up to its Speed, entering the spaces of Large or smaller creatures. Each creature whose space it enters is subjected once to the following effect. At the end of its movement, the wurm can make one Bite attack against a Prone creature as a Bonus Action. Strength Saving Throw: DC 22. Success: The target is pushed 5 feet away from the wurm into a space of its choice. If the target chooses not to move, it suffers the effects of a failure. Failure: 35 (10d6) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the wurm and has the Prone condition.

monster.description:
The earth trembles, vibrating pebbles and dust. A deep rumble wells from below. Suddenly, stone cracks, extruding a titanic wurm. It rears its massive head, opening a petal-like mouth filled with long jagged crystalline teeth all pointed into its throat. Its body is covered in muddy purple plates with octarine spines jutting from between. Its hot breath sends octarine slime flying as it dives toward you.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they Study a Crater Wurm, learning the following based on their result: (15+) Subterranean Threat. You know it has Tremorsense and that it creates tunnels when digging through rock. (20+) Earth Shaker. You're aware of the Crater Wurms' Breach and Bite attacks. (25+) Blunderous Brute. You recognize the Crater Wurms' strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Crater Wurms disregard other creatures, viewing them as only morsels to consume. All are as the dust of the earth to it—simply food. These wurms understand that creatures they devour often try to flee. Their favored tactic is to remain buried until their Tremorsense detects movement. They then surface with its Breach action, making Bite attacks, swallowing nearby Prone creatures. They dive beneath the ground once at least one creature is swallowed, or if reduced to half its Hit Point maximum.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Heart, Guts. Natural Weapons: Teeth,Needles. Hide: Plates.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 39 (Third Party)

monster.name: Crimson Countess (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 39 (6d8+12) plus 39 (6d8+12) per player character.

trait.name: Aura of Storms
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Crimson Countess takes 10 (3d6) Lightning damage.

trait.name: Pluck
trait.text: The Crimson Countess doesn't need to spend extra movement to drag a Medium or smaller creature Grappled by it.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The Crimson Countess always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, the Crimson Countess can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Crimson Countess takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Grasping Talons
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) Piercing damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 15).

action.name: Lightning Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Lightning damage.

action.name: Aerial Acrobat
action.text: The Crimson Countess flies up to her Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

action.name: Frightful Screech (1/round)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature within 120 feet of the Crimson Countess that can hear them. Failure: 14 (4d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition (save ends). While Frightened, the target must take the Dash action and move away from the Crimson Countess by the safest available route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move.

action.name: Lightning Strike (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 60-foot long, 5-foot wide Line. Failure: 36 (8d8) Lightning damage, and the target has the Shocked condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: The Crimson Countess chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on them. The Crimson Countess can use this action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

monster.description:
The Crimson Countess is a powerful queen of harpies. Her red-feathered wings and deep crimson hair set her apart from the many harpy followers she commands. She is clad is black and gold armor and carries with her a spear that crackles with magical energies. Her hands and feet are black talons with sharp claws. The Crimson Countess is a cunning hunter and territorial to the Clock Tower. She has staked her claim over the center of the city, and hunts the various monsters and misguided faction agents who come close.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine Crimson Countess, learning the following based on the result: (5+) Arcane Resistance. You know of the creature's Immunities. (10+) Dangerous Talons. You recognize the creature's Pluck trait. (15+) Bold and Nimble. You are aware of the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics The Countess only leaves her clock tower to join in on hunts with her valkyries, but otherwise she prefers the defendable position at the tower's highest floor. From here any adventurer who makes it past her soldiers and into her lair can easily be grabbed and thrown off the open balconies, falling to their death. She is overconfident and will do anything to protect her advantageous position in the city. She only flees if all her minions are dead and she is below 25 Hit Points. If she flees, she will attempt to gather more soldiers and return to reclaim the clock tower at a later date.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Guts. Bones: Skull. Natural Weapons: Claws. Hair: Feathers. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 169 (Third Party)

trait.name: Gear

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Slashing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 15).

action.name: Crimson Axe
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. or range 30/90 ft. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 4) Force damage, and the target suffers one of the following effects of the vampire's choice. Hit or Miss: After being thrown, the axe returns to the vampire's hand. • Crackling Smite. Strength Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 10 (3d6) Thunder damage, and the target has the Shocked condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only. • Unholy Smite. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage, and the target can't regain Hit Points until the end of the vampire's next turn. Success: Half damage only. • Wrathful Smite. Wisdom saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 14 (3d6 + 4) Necrotic damage, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Charge (Bonus Action)
action.text: The vampire moves up to its Speed toward a Hostile creature it can see. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of the creature, it has Advantage on the next attack roll it makes against that creature before the end of its turn.

reaction.name: Unbridled Fury
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature hits the vampire with an attack. Response: The vampire makes a Crimson Axe attack against the attacker.

monster.description:
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or martial melee weapons gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine a Crimson Knight, learning the following based on the result. (10+) Elite Spawn. You know the Crimson Knight's damage Resistances. (15+) Unholy Magic. You recognize the Crimson Knight can unleash a variety of powerful smites. (20+) Weaknesses. You are aware the vampire's regeneration is temporarily halted by Radiant damage, and its Vampire Weaknesses.
Combat Tactics Crimson Knights form units with other minions and thralls of their vampire masters. Several Crimson Knights may form an elite guard, or one might be attached to lead a contingent of vampire thralls. In battle, Crimson Knights seek out the most formidable melee combatants to meet head on, disarming them with Crackling Smite. They make use of Unholy Smite to prevent their target from healing, and terrorize them using Wrathful Smite. A Crimson Knight will give their undead existence to defend their master and hold fast even as they are cut down. If they encounter a foe capable of dealing Radiant damage, they make them the target of their attacks to ensure they can continue to regenerate.

trait.name: Epic Foe

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken always takes his turn on Initiative count 20. On his turn, Vladimir von Drakken can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or Bonus Action on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Vladimir von Drakken takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Bloodmourne
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 5 ft. Hit: 26 (6d6 + 5) Force damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition (4d4).

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 5 ft. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 18).

action.name: Bite (1/round)
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 40 (10d6 + 5) Necrotic damage. The target's Hit Point Maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and Vladimir von Drakken regains Hit Points equal to that amount. A Humanoid killed by this effect and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a Vampire Spawn under Vladimir von Drakken's control.

action.name: Terrifying Glare
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature Vladimir von Drakken can see within 120 feet. Failure: 21 (6d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. Failure by 5 or More: While Frightened, the target has the Paralyzed condition.

action.name: Shadow Step (1/round)
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet that is in Dim Light or Darkness. He has Advantage on the next melee attack he makes before the end of this round.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. He can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

monster.description:
"None without this blood within may strike you down, and by this blood you shall not die." — Prophecy uttered during the Sanguine Rite
Before you stands an emaciated undead man. He looks downward, with sallow red-glowing eyes hidden behind a mass of long, matted black hair. His nose is rotted and gone, his flesh cracked and decayed, and his bent pose a far cry from the imperial majesty he possessed and lost so long ago. He is swathed only in an ancient burial shroud and wrappings worn like a robe. Across his neck, a prominent and wretched scar marks how his head was sewn back upon his shoulders. He drags an ancient obsidian greatsword behind him, holding the weapon by its blade as a thin trickle of blood seeps from his fingers. From his back emerge the broken stumps of clipped wings, now little more than useless limbs of tattered gore. Yet, there is a quiet, primal power thrumming within his form.
When returned to unlife via the Sanguine Rite, Vladimir von Drakken first manifests in this form. He remains in this form until he has fed on enough individuals of sufficient power, upon which he assumes his Reborn form. Although he cannot be permanently destroyed in this form, Vladimir von Drakken is greatly weakened in this state and desires nothing more than returning to his full power.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. Vladimir speaks with vile overconfidence, a sinister smirk, and a demeanor of a creature who believes himself a god, he does not tolerate others treating him as any less than a king of kings. • Bond. Vladimir will stop at nothing to conquer the continent and reclaim his throne in Drakkenheim. He made it, and it is his to rule, any other who attempts to sit upon it is an imposter. • Ideal. "This realm belongs to the dead, and the dead shall keep it. Any who stand in the way of my reign will join my legions by choice, or by force." • Flaw. Vladimir believes himself entirely indestructible and is blind to the loopholes within the rites that created him. Nevertheless, he is hesitant to trust anyone. He refuses to let anyone get close and assumes everyone is plotting against him.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Religion gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine Vladimir von Drakken, learning the following based on the result: (15+) Deadly Foe. You know of the creature's Resistances and Immunities. (20+) Renowned Swordsman. You are aware of his Bloodmourne and Bite attacks. (25+) Nearly Undefeatable. You recognize his Reborn or Ascendent Transformation trait.
Combat Tactics Vladimir von Drakken is presented here in three forms. As the Ascendent Vampire grows in power he transforms into a new form until he returns to his full strength. If he is successfully resurrected with the Sanguine Rite, Vladimir von Drakken first begins in his Crypt-Starved form. He remains in this form until he consumes the blood of a living descendant of House von Drakken, which enables him to turn into his Reborn form. If reduced to 0 Hit Points in his Reborn form, Vladimir von Drakken unleashes his Ascendant form. In his Crypt-Starved form, Vladimir von Drakken is a craven and desperate combatant. He primarily aims to drink as much blood as possible using his Bite to transform into his Reborn form. He makes use of Shadow Step and Terrifying Glare to reposition himself and hold foes at bay. Once he regains his Reborn form, Vladimir von Drakken is nearly unstoppable. He wades into melee with Bloodmourne, demonstrating his martial superiority by using his manoeuvres. He uses his Claws and Bite as finishing moves and uses Dominate to bend his foes to his will. When surrounded, he uses Wing Blast to reposition. Assuming his Ascendant form, Vladimir von Drakken becomes an engine of bloodlust and destruction, fueled by primal rage and undead power. In this form, he rips foes apart with melee attacks and flays their spirits whenever his Soul Rend becomes available.
Slaying Vladimir von Drakken Vladimir cannot be fully destroyed unless he is wholly unmade at the place he was first transformed. Wholly destroying Vladimir von Drakken is difficult. Once he is defeated in combat, with the final blow struck by one who shares his blood, his heart must be cut out, and placed upon the altar within the Standing Stones in in the Brachenwald where he was transformed into a vampire.Under a full moon at midnight, a wooden stake made from a branch from Elenthas the Evertree must be driven through the heart by one of his blood descendants. Then, the heart must be left there until sunrise where it is destroyed by first light. Vladimir von Drakken's minions do not stand idly whilst this happens, and launch a massive assault upon the grove with the desperate aim of retrieving his heart before it is destroyed by the sun.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 260 -261 (Third Party)

monster.description:
The creature's jagged features make them appear to be made from shattered glass. Their flesh is a fractal arrangement of polygonal angles of shimmering crystal. Throughout their body, sharp jutting shards extend and retract as they move towards you, their body pulling in and refracting light at odd angles and with an increased intensity.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Crystalline Dreg, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Light Absorption. You recognize the creature has Resistance to Radiant damage. (10+) Reflecting Attacks. You learn of the Dreg's Refracted Beam attack. (15+) Prone to Shattering. You understand the creature's Vulnerability to Bludgeoning damage.
Combat Tactics The Crystalline Dreg is quite literally a glass cannon. It prefers to stay behind other Dregs, blasting its foes with its beam attacks and absorbing any elemental damage to alter its attacks. If an enemy who can deal Bludgeoning damage is present, the Crystalline Dreg will flee from that creature and attempt to kill them from a distance, knowing it is their biggest threat. The Dreg tends to focus on enemies approaching with melee weapons over anyone using elemental damage. If the front line of Dregs that the Crystalline Dreg often uses as shield is gone, or if the Crystalline Dregs are outnumbered and threatened with melee combat, they attempt to flee.

monster.description:
Tall and lithe, this Haze Hulk's body is uniquely marked by taut muscles and pronounced blood vessels beneath its semi-translucent skin, which shows occasional fissures from the intense eldritch power contained within. Its elongated face is dominated by a single, malevolent cyclopean eye that glows like a lantern in the dark of the ruins.

You learn of its Wink Bonus Action. (15+) Burning Eye. You're aware of the Hulk's Eye Laser attack. (20+) Strong and Tough. You recognize the Hulk's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Cyclopean Hulk is often a brutish protector for other Dregs. It uses its Eye Laser to disintegrate enemies into a fine delerium dust. The Cyclopean Hulk focuses its power on blasting enemies from afar or slamming them into the ground if they get close. It will then Wink out of existence, reappearing every few seconds to deliver a devastating blast from its eye before vanishing again. Cyclopean Hulks usually fight to the end, and rarely flee.

action.text: The vampire casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17, +9 to spell attacks): At Will: Guidance, Thaumaturgy 2/Day Each: Bane, Darkness, Disguise Self 1/Day Each: Dispel Magic, Spirit Guardians

reaction.name: Blood Rebuke
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature the vampire can see within 60 feet of it deals damage to it. Response—Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17. Failure: 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition (4d4). Success: Half damage only.

monster.spells: guidance, thaumaturgy, bane, darkness, disguise self, dispel magic, spirit guardians
monster.description:
Dressed in robes of black and red that stand as a mockery to the garb often worn by members of the Sacred Flame, and clutching an ornate golden staff with a crimson orb in one hand, and a shimmering spectral maul in the other, these Dark Confessors call forth unholy curses and spirits from the abyss to bend to their will. Their pale skin, sunken black eyes, and sharp fangs stand as a grim reminder that even the holy can succumb to the whims of vampiric lords.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Religion or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine a Dark Confessor, learning the following based on the result. (5+) Unnatural Resistance. You recognize the Dark Confessor's damage Resistances. (10+) Deadly Response. You are aware of the Dark Confessor's Bloody Rebuke Reaction. (15+) Weaknesses. You are aware the vampire's Regeneration is temporarily halted by Radiant damage, and its Vampire Weaknesses.
Combat Tactics In the first round of combat, the Dark Confessor casts Spirit Guardians. It uses its Claws to attack anyone who comes within its melee reach. The Dark Confessor then proceeds to attack with its Spiritual Maul. If there are enemies grouped close to one another, the Dark Confessor uses Unholy Light on them. The Dark Confessor flees if it is below 50 Hit Points or takes steady Radiant damage.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Undead. Fluid: Monster Blood. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Undead Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 240 -241 (Third Party)

monster.name: Dark Growth

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The dark growth can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The dark growth regains 10 Hit Points at the start of its turn. If the Dark Growth takes Fire or Radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the dark growth's next turn. The dark growth dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dark growth makes three attacks: two with its Entangling Vines and one with its Infection Spores.

action.name: Entangling Vines
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 30 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Piercing damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 15) and the target has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

action.name: Infection Spores
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range 60 ft. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: The target is infected with a disease called Dark Decay. Instead of acting normally on its turn, the target must move toward the closest creature that isn't infected with Dark Decay and make one melee attack against it. If the attack hits, the target of that attack must also make a saving throw against Dark Decay. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save. Subsequent Failures: The target gains one Contamination level. Third Success: The disease ends. An infected creature that dies or undergoes a Monstrous Transformation becomes a Dark Growth Shambler. A Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic that removes diseases ends Dark Decay, as does any magic that removes Contamination levels.

monster.description:
The remains of a corpse is splayed across a ruined wall. A chaotic mass of jet-black brambles and vines pours from its torso, clinging to the nearby stonework. Branches have burst from its form, and its neck erupts into another mass of plant matter. The skull is severed from the body with its jaw unhinged and hanging in a horrible expression, stuck in place by the writhing vines. Throughout this Dark Growth, flowers bloom in iridescent neon hues and the smell of sweet pollen and decaying flesh fills the air. You hear gentle whispers from a distant voice, distinctly familiar and beckoning.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks to Study a Dark Growth, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Contaminated and Thriving. You are aware of the Dark Growth's Resistances and Immunities. (10+) Deadly Spores. You recognize the creature's Infection Spores action. (15+) Kill it with fire! You know the creature's Vulnerability to Fire, and its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics A Dark Growth is a simple-minded plant. It uses Mimicry to lure passing creatures towards it, often mimicking the sounds of children or people in need. It entangles and infests any target near it, infecting it with its spores. The creature is a stationary plant and does not flee.

Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 40 -41 (Third Party)

action.name: Infectious Bite

Instead of acting normally on its turn, the target must move toward the closest creature that isn't infected with Dark Decay and make one melee attack against it. reaction.text: Trigger: The dark growth shambler drops to 0 Hit Points and it hasn't taken Fire damage this round. Response: The dark growth shambler creates a Dark Growth in its space.

monster.description:
Staggering from the shadows is a gaunt humanoid with pale flesh and a hunched form. Vines and branches protrude from its gaping mouth and push through its flesh throughout its body. Flowers emerge from these growths, blooming in iridescent neon hues. A smell of sweet sugar and decaying flesh fills the air, and whispers begin to emerge from it even though the creature's mouth doesn't move.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 41 (Third Party)

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Net, Spear.
