action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage if wielded with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +3 to hit, range 5/15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The target has the Restrained condition. A creature can take an action to free itself or another creature in a net with a successful DC 10 Strength check. Dealing 5 Slashing damage to the net (AC 10) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net

monster.description:
Emerging from the contaminated waters is a humanoid figure with disturbing piscine mutations. Their body is covered in glittering scales of sea green, midnight purple, and deep blue. Their monstrous face has two large, bulbous eyes and a gaping, fishlike mouth filled with oddly-shaped teeth—a mixture of humanoid, shark, and other aquatic animals. Spindly, fleshy whiskers surround their fish lips. They have webbed feet and hands, and thin fins jut from their arms, legs, and face. They wear little more than ragged clothing and scraps of leather armor, and carry a brace of javelins, a spear, and a fishing net.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when Studying a Deep Dreg Warrior, learning the following based on the result: (5+) Amphibious Mutant. You know the creature is a capable swimmer and is immune to Contamination. (10+) Foe Catcher. You are aware of the Deep Dreg Warrior's Net attack and Catch of the Day trait. (15+) Strong and Tough. You learn the creature's strongest and weakest saving throws.
Combat Tactics Deep Dreg Warriors attack from the water, throwing their spears and diving back under the surface as added protection against ranged retaliation. When they engage in melee, the warriors use their Net to restrain their foes, and make melee attacks (with the bonus damage from Catch of the Day) to knock them Unconscious. Deep Dregs Warriors flee whenever they are outnumbered or if they are reduced below half their maximum Hit Points. They swim to safety rather than die fighting, and prefer to fall back and retaliate after gathering reinforcements.
Harvestable Components (Common) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Mucus. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts. Bones: Skull. Hide: Scales. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 155 (Third Party)

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

action.name: Harpoon
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Strength Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: The target is pulled up to 20 feet toward the deep knight.

action.name: Shield Bash (Bonus Action)
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Strength Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: The target has the Prone condition.

monster.description:
Towering over the other Deep Dregs is a muscle-bound warrior with a head shaped like a hammerhead shark. They carry a colossal shield made from the opalescent shell of some mollusc, and their gnarled hide is covered in algae and barnacles. A thick chain is wrapped around their wrists, attached to the massive, spiked harpoon they carry.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Deep Knight. They learn the following information based on their check result. (5+) Amphibious Mutant. You know the creature is a capable swimmer and is immune to Contamination. (10+) Foe Catcher. You are aware of the Deep Knight's Harpoon attack and Unwavering Sentinel trait. (15+) Strong and Tough. You learn the creature's strongest and weakest saving throws are similar to that of a normal human.
Combat Tactics The Deep Knight is the forward assault of the Deep Dregs and uses their seashell shields to deflect attacks and their harpoons to pull enemies into close range before biting them with their shark teeth. The Deep Knight will defend the other Deep Dregs to the death. If it is the last one standing it will attempt to flee, but as long as there are allies to protect, it will stay and fight.

action.name: Discordant Song (recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature of the deep siren's choice in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the deep siren. Failure: 21 (6d6) Psychic damage, and the target must roll 1d6 and subtract the result from each D20 Test it makes. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. It automatically succeeds after 1 minute.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
action.text: The deep siren covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and shape. The illusion ends if the siren takes a Bonus Action to end it or if she dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the siren could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching them would feel their fishy flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the siren is disguised.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The deep siren casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to spell attacks): 2/Day Each: Fog Cloud, Lightning Bolt 1/Day Each: Conjure Elemental (water only), Control Water

action.name: Misty Step (Bonus Action)
action.text: The deep siren magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet.

monster.spells: fog cloud, lightning bolt, conjure elemental, control water
monster.description:
This wretched, mutated crone has sea-green hair and blue-gray flesh, and is garbed in a gown of algae and kelp. They carry pouches filled with occult reagents, and vials filled with a strange octarine goo. Despite their appearance, as they speak their words are no less honeyed and sweet.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage of Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Deep Siren. They learn the following information based on their check result. (5+) Amphibious Mutant. You know the creature is a capable swimmer and is immune to Contamination. (10+) Illusive Opponent. You are aware of the creature's Misty Step action. (15+) Nimble and Enchanting. You learn the Deep Siren's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Deep Sirens are the generals and confidants to the Duchess and often serve as the eyes and ears of their mistress. They use their Illusory Appearance to walk among humanoids and observe them, planning and plotting the attacks of the Deep Dregs. Once it has gathered information, a Deep Siren returns to the Duchess, and is often sent with the Deep Dregs to storm beaches, infiltrate sewers, or take over cities on stormy nights. The siren doesn't like being in close combat, and always at- tempts to use Misty Step to move to a more beneficial position, then unleash Storm Lash or spellcasting upon their foes. They flee if surrounded, if outnumbered, or if they feel the battle is not going in their favor.

trait.name: Delerium Healing

trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.text: The dragon makes one Bite attack and uses Contaminated Rend twice.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Force damage.

action.name: Contaminated Rend
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature within 5 feet of the dragon. Failure: 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level.

action.name: Octarine Breath (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage plus 10 (3d6) Psychic damage plus 10 (3d6) Radiant damage. Success: Half damage.

action.name: Dimension Hop (Bonus Action)
action.text: The dragon teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet.

monster.description:
This unearthly dragon is a crystalline horror, its body formed from angular gem-like scales pulsing with octarine light. Its form is raw delerium. Each scale is a gleaming crystal refracting light into eerie hues of purple, yellow, and green, with an unnatural sharpness that feels both fragile and impossibly durable. The dragon's wings are translucent and webbed with glowing crystal veins that shimmer, casting kaleidoscopic patterns as it moves. Each beat causes the air to hum, vibrating with a chaotic energy that overwhelms and distorts the senses. Each step the dragon takes leaves delicate motes of crystal growing into jagged formations, tainting the landscape. Its eyes are like multifaceted gems, swirling with chaotic magic pooling within their depths. The beast's crystalline horns and talons are razor-sharp, gleaming like polished jewels, yet crackling with eldritch energy.
Playful and full of wonder, Delerium Dragon Wyrmlings do not stray far from where they hatch, as they still must contend with their multidimensional existence. A wyrmling usually does not yet fully understand their transtemporal senses, and experiences memories of their adulthood and future in dreams and visions.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Delerium Dragon, learning the following based on the result. (15+) Empowered by Eldritch Magic. You understand the dragon's Resistances and senses. (20+) Octarine Breath. You recognize the effects of the Delerium Dragon's breath weapon, as well as noting its Spellcasting capabilities. (25+) Few Weaknesses. You learn its highest and lowest saving throws.
Combat Tactics A Delerium Dragon views combat less as a violent encounter and more as a chance to change foes into a new form. It darts about using flight and teleportation, seldom remaining in the same place for more than a turn. Their movement makes it easy for the dragon to find the perfect place to catch many enemies with its breath weapon. Delerium Dragons love to spread contamination and cause arcane anomalies, and delight causing monstrous transformations with their contaminated attacks. Delerium Dragons use their Bite, Contaminated Rend, and Tail attacks to tear opponents apart in between uses of their breath weapon.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Glands, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Claws, Teeth. Hide: Scales, Webbed Membrane. Dust: Aberrant Dust. Delerium. In addition, characters can collect delerium crystals from its body. A wyrmling has 2d4 fragments.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 294 -295 (Third Party)

monster.description:
This wretched figure has been twisted and warped by eldritch contamination. Beneath their shredded and torn clothing, you can see all manner of sores, lesions, and bulging blood vessels upon their purple-gray flesh, and their limbs and joints bend at unnatural angles. Their facial features are unnaturally warped into a permanent expression of confused agony, and an octarine glow fills their sunken eyes. Small aberrant mutations appear across their bodies: crystalline bony protrusions and small tendrils bursting forth through their skin, a yellow eyeball blinking open upon their neck, and a disturbingly elongated tongue. As they catch sight of you, they moan painfully and lunge forward.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Delerium Dreg, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Humans Transformed. You know these Aberrations are immune to further delerium Contamination but otherwise have no special Resistances. (10+) Contaminating Claws. You recognize the dangers of the creature's Claw attack. (15+) Shambling Corruption. You understand the creature's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Delerium Dregs are desperate and confused combatants, incapable of any complex tactics beyond lunging towards their foes to attack by the most direct means. If they see a creature who is not contaminated, they will attack on sight. However, they will band together to form small herds, shuffling through ruins, or wandering the streets together. A wounded Delerium Dreg typically responds with fury and rage, attacking whatever damaged it last without regard to its personal wellbeing. In very rare cases, a wounded Dreg may attempt to flee, especially from a much more formidable combatant.

Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 92 (Third Party)

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The digipede makes one Bite attack and two Talons attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) Piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) Slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) Lightning damage. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: The target has the Shocked condition until the end of the digipede's next turn.

action.name: Eye Beam (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 60-foot long, 5-foot wide Line. Failure: 35 (10d6) Lightning damage, and the target has the Slowed condition. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Immobilized condition. Third Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition. Success: Half damage only.

monster.description:
Scuttling atop dozens of spindly legs, this grotesque creature resembles a mutated centipede grown to horrific proportions. A segmented body nearly thirty feet long undulates atop unnaturally bending limbs resembling emaciated human fingers. Elongated yellow fingernails crackle and scrape the ground menacingly as it moves. Dominating its fat, round head is a single, massive human-like eye that swivels frenetically with a disturbing, unyielding intensity. Its antenna sprouts above like an eyebrow, while tightly closed mandibles resemble bags under the eye. Its foremost finger-legs end in pincer-like talons thrumming with electricity.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Digipede, learning the following based on their result: (10+) Charged Form. You recognize the creature's Resistance to Lightning damage and that it has Tremorsense thanks to its large antenna. (15+) Sharp and Shocking. You are aware of the Digipede's Talons and Eye Beam actions. (20+) Insectile Predator. You learn the creature's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Despite its size, a Digipede will try to hide along rooftops, dark corners, narrow alleys, and any crevice which can accommodate it. It launches its Eye Beam from hiding to hinder its prey's escape, then rips into them with its Talons and Bite. The electric shocks from its attacks disrupt the ability of its prey to effectively fight back.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Elemental Fluid. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Guts. Natural Weapons: Claws. Hide: Carapace.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 42 (Third Party)

monster.name: Disembodied Psyche
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The psyche can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The psyche makes two Electroshock attacks. It can also use Hypnotize, if available.

action.name: Electroshock
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: 35 (10d6) Lightning damage. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target has the Dazed condition until the end of the psyche's next turn.

action.name: Hypnotize (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature of the psyche's choice in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the psyche. Failure: The target has the Incapacitated condition (save ends). While Incapacitated, the target has the Immobilized condition.

action.name: Mental Possession
action.text: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature the psyche can see within 5 feet. Success: The target is immune to this psyche's Mental Possession for 24 hours. Failure: The target is possessed by the psyche; the psyche disappears, and the target has the Incapacitated condition and loses control of its body. The psyche now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The psyche can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. The psyche's game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's Speed, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 Hit Points or the psyche leaves as a Bonus Action. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the possession on a success. When the possession ends, the psyche appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this psyche's Mental Possession for 24 hours.

action.name: Teleport (Bonus Action)
action.text: The psyche teleports to an unoccupied space within 60 feet.

monster.description:
This revolting creature resembles a large floating brain still attached to its nervous system. The abomination hovers slowly within a field of psychic energy. The loose spindly threads that dangle down from it form into arm-like appendages. A high-pitched thrumming emanates from it as it crackles and sparks with latent psychic powers.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Medicine or Arcana gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Disembodied Psyche, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Unnatural Immaterial Form. You are aware of the creature's damage and condition Immunities. (15+) Telepathic Energy. You recognize the creature's Hypnotize and Mental Possession actions. (20+) Incorporeal Mind You know the creature's AC, Hit Points, and Strength ability score.
Combat Tactics The Disembodied Psyche begins any combat by getting into a position where it can hit as many creatures as possible with its Hypnotize before attempting to mentally possess a target. If it is in a dangerous situation, such as being surrounded or cornered, it uses Teleport to move to a more advantageous position.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Undead. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Ectoplasm. Organs: Brain. Dust: Undead Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 199 (Third Party)

monster.name: Displacer Dreg

trait.name: Displacement
trait.text: Attack rolls against the dreg have Disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack roll, this trait does not apply until the end of its next turn. This trait does not apply while the dreg has the Incapacitated condition or has a Speed of 0.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Teleport (recharge 4–6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The dreg teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Before or after teleporting, the dreg can make one melee attack. If this attack hits, it deals an extra 10 (3d6) Psychic damage.

monster.description:
This mutated Dreg shudders violently as it appears to strobe through reality. An indistinct blur envelops their form as they move with a stunted, unnatural, and fragmented gait, as if moments of their reality are missing, causing them to appear to skip fractions of time within their unnaturally rhythmic movements.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Displacer Dreg, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Multiplanar Existence. You know of the Dreg's Displacement trait. (10+) Teleporting Attack. You learn of the Dreg's Talons attack and Teleport Bonus Action. (15+) Blurred Form. You recognize the Dreg's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Displacer Dreg is a difficult creature to pin down. It uses its Talons to fend off attackers while Teleporting itself to safety if it thinks it is in a losing situation or to gain a more advantageous position.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Claws. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 96 (Third Party)

monster.name: Dr. Everett Freed, Reanimator

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Studded Leather,

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Reanimator makes two Electric Jolt or Necrotic Blast attacks.

action.name: Electric Jolt
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 35 (10d6) Lightning damage, and the target has the Shocked condition until the end of the Reanimator's next turn.

action.name: Necrotic Blast
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +9, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 36 (8d8) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Weakened condition until the end of the Reanimator's next turn

action.name: Touch of Death (1/Day)
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 200 Poison damage. This damage ignores Resistance and Immunity to Poison damage and can't be reduced or prevented in any way. If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it automatically fails death saving throws until it finishes a Long Rest. A Heal or Greater Restoration spell ends this effect early.

action.name: Reanimate (recharge 5–6)
action.text: The Reanimator targets the corpse of one of its destroyed creations it can see within 30 feet. The target returns to life with 45 (10d8) Hit Points. The target has Resistance to all damage and Advantage on saving throws until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The Reanimator casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17, +9 to spell attacks): At Will: False Life, Gentle Repose 2/Day Each: Animate Dead, Death Ward, Hold Person, Lightning Bolt, Raise Dead

action.name: Creator's Command (Bonus Action)
action.text: The Reanimator chooses a creature it can see that was reanimated or created by it. The target can use its Reaction to make an attack with Advantage or move up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

reaction.name: Bodyguard
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature the Reanimator can see targets it with an attack or spell that targets only the reanimator. Response: The Reanimator chooses one of its creations within 10 feet and switches spaces with it. The creation becomes the target instead.

monster.spells: false life, gentle repose, animate dead, death ward, hold person, lightning bolt, raise dead
monster.description:
Dr. Everett Freed regards you with a stern frown. He is longfaced, bald-headed, and wears thick, circular glasses that magnify his focused gaze. Beneath his bleached-white surgical apron, he is dressed in a tailored dark jacket. The coat is deceptively normal: thick and heavy, it conceals numerous pockets stuffed with vials and unusual instruments. His hands, sheathed in slightly stained rubber gloves, tightly grip a black leather doctor's bag at his side. A faint scent of formaldehyde and burnt metal clings to him.
Reanimator Minions. It's possible Dr. Freed was the first to create many creatures. He is most well known as the first to create Reautomata. In the process of making his magnum opus, Freed built creatures such as the Body Snatcher, Cerebrograft, the Ripper, and the Stitcher. Freed's experiments did not stop there, and in many ways his practice ascended the body alone thanks to his collaborations with the Alienist Dr. Sina Rienks, eventually transforming himself into a Think Tank.
Mind Over Body. One of Freed's infamous gambits was to remove his brain from his own body, placing it into a body double. Eventually, Freed became a Think Tank, able to remotely control brainless bodies from his hidden sanctum.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. I am always calm and composed, especially when explaining the 'necessary' cruelty of my experiments. • Ideal. Progress demands sacrifice; the advancement of knowledge justifies all actions, no matter how gruesome. • Bond. I still possess the first successful reanimation I ever created: the preserved head of a beloved family member. It's both my proudest achievement and my darkest secret. • Flaw. I am obsessed with the perfection and infallibility of my creations, often dismissing any evidence of their defects, uncontrollable behavior, and horrific appearances. I never accept any failure as my fault
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Medicine or Survival gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study the Reanimator, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Protected by the Reanimated. You know of his Resistances, Immunities, and Bodyguard Reaction. (15+) Deadly Toxins. You are aware of his Touch of Death. (20+) Electrical Reinvigoration. You learn of his Reanimate action.
Combat Tactics Prior to combat, Freed casts False Life and Death Ward on himself, and perhaps any allies joining him in battle. He does not engage in combat without creations by his side. If Freed is caught alone, he doesn't fight; he flees. However, when supported by his loyal creations, he can be overconfident and brash, secure that his bodyguards will keep him safe from harm. Freed always remains within 10 feet of one or more creations so he can use his Bodyguard Reaction reliably. On his turn, Freed uses Electric Jolt and Necrotic Blast to hammer his foes, while directing a favored creation with Creator's Command. Should one of his minions be brought down, he uses Reanimate and immediately sends it back into the action with Creator's Command. Freed uses Touch of Death against a particularly loathsome foe, one who harries him with dangerous abilities, or who he especially wishes to slay. All the while, he threatens his enemies by telling them his plans for their body parts once he's killed them
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 188 -189 (Third Party)

monster.name: Drakkenheim Sewer Gator

trait.name: Contaminated Regeneration
trait.text: The sewer gator regains 10 Hit Points at the start of its turn as long as it is in contaminated water. The gator dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Amphibious Lunge
trait.text: If the sewer gator swims 20+ feet on its turn, it can long jump or high jump up to 60 feet. If it ends this jump within 5 feet of a creature, it has Advantage on its next Crushing Bite attack against that creature, and that attack deals an additional 40 (9d8) Piercing damage.

trait.name: Predatory Stealth
trait.text: The sewer gator has Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to Hide in water.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sewer gator makes two attacks. It can't make both a Crushing Bite attack and a Tail Strike attack against the same target.

action.name: Crushing Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 15 ft. Hit: 33 (4d12 + 7) Piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 19). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition and the sewer gator can't use Crushing Bite against another target.

action.name: Tail Strike
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 15 ft. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed 20 feet away from the sewer gator and has the Prone condition.

action.name: Death Roll
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 15 ft., one creature Grappled by the sewer gator. Hit: 33 (4d12 + 7) Piercing damage. Strength Saving Throw: DC 19. Failure: The target has the Dazed and Helpless conditions until it escapes the sewer gator's grapple.

reaction.name: Submerge
reaction.text: Trigger: The sewer gator takes damage while in water. Response: The sewer gator swims half its speed and takes the Hide action.

monster.description:
Surfacing from the rancid sewer waters is a terrible alligator nearly fifty feet long. A jagged ridge of delerium runs along its back, ending in a fell crown atop its head as pallid skin frames its octarine glowing eyes. A thick, purple tentacle-like tongue undulates out of its tooth-filled maw. Strong and sturdy legs support its scarred body, attesting to countless battles in the ruins.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Animal Handling gain Advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks to study a Drakkenheim Sewer Gator, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Fearless Aquatic Predator! You learn the Drakkenheim Sewer Gator's condition Immunities and Swim speed. (10+) Watch out for its bite! You are aware of the creature's Crushing Bite and Death Roll actions. (15+) Get it out of the water! You know of the creature's Contaminated Regeneration trait.
Combat Tactics The Drakkenheim Sewer Gator is primarily aquatic, haunting the sewer system or the Drann River. These monstrosities lunge from the waters to grab prey, dragging it beneath the surface. Once a target is in its jaws, the gator Death Rolls until its victim stops moving. It is a cunning hunter, knowing how to disappear below murky waters, but it can be provoked to chase its prey. Out of the water it is vulnerable and flees if reduced below half its Hit Points.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Ribs, Spine. Natural Weapons: Teeth. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 43 (Third Party)

monster.name: Druid of the Sanguine Rites

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Hide armor, shield.

trait.name: Blood Sacrifice
trait.text: A creature with the Restrained condition also has the Helpless condition against the vampire's attacks.

trait.name: Plasma Absorption
trait.text: Each time a creature takes damage from the Bleeding condition while within 30 feet of the vampire, the vampire regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The vampire regains 10 Hit Points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 Hit Point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes Radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The vampire makes three attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Draining Bite or Spellcasting.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Slashing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 15).

action.name: Bloodthorn Whip
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 30 ft. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 5) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition (4d4).

action.name: Draining Bite
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 14 (3d6 + 4) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Weakened condition (save ends).

action.name: Bloodroots (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the vampire. Failure: 21 (6d6) Piercing damage, and the target has the Restrained condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The vampire casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17, +9 to spell attacks): At Will: Druidcraft 2/Day Each: Dispel Magic, Dominate Beast, Entangle, Faerie Fire, Pass Without Trace, Spike Growth 1/Day Each: Antilife Shell, Contagion, Create Undead (as an action), Insect Plague, Mass Suggestion, Scrying

monster.description:
This ancient druid is adorned in skulls and bones hanging off its thick gray cloak. They carry a staff of bone drenched in animal blood, with dried blood painted on their face and clothes. Their features are skeletal in nature, their skin stretched tightly over them. They appear ancient, their eyes sunken and black, their teeth yellowed with age and neglect. The druid whispers in forgotten tongues as they perform blood sacrifices and draw on primal magics.
Study The Foe Characters proficient in Religion or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when taking the Study action to examine a Druid of the Sanguine Rite, learning the following based on the result. (10+) Unrelenting Unlife. You recognize the creature's Regeneration trait. (15+) Bloody Renewal. You learn of the creature's Bloodthorn Whip attack and Plasma Absorption trait (20+) Unnaturally Aware. You know their highest and lowest ability scores
Combat Tactics The druid of the blood rites uses dark magic to twist the lifeforce of other creatures. The druid uses its bloodthorn whip to inflict a series of open wounds upon its foes, and then feeds on their life- force by pulling it through their wounds using plasma absorption. When not directly engaged in combat, the druids attempt to charm a group of foes and convince them to partake in their blood rituals, using their life force as sacrifice to empower one of their own. If the druids are directly confronted with greater numbers, or their health is below half, they attempt to flee.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Undead. Fluid: Monster Blood. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws. Hair: Hair Hide: Skin. Dust: Undead Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 242 -243 (Third Party)

monster.name: Effulgent Cnidarian
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Altered Reality
trait.text: The cnidarian has the Invisible condition for creatures Charmed by it.

trait.name: Hallucinogenic Bioluminescence
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the cnidarian and can see it is subjected to the following effect unless the cnidarian chooses otherwise. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target has the Charmed condition (save ends). While Charmed, the target regards all other creatures as enemies except the cnidarian, whom it regards as an ally. Whenever the target makes an attack or casts a detrimental spell, it must choose its target at random from the creatures it can see within range. If a creature provokes an Opportunity Attack from the target, it must make the attack, if able. If the target ends its turn without taking an Attack or Magic action, it takes 14 (4d6) Psychic damage. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls against the cnidarian until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the cnidarian in the meantime, that creature must immediately make the saving throw.

trait.name: Neon Illumination
trait.text: The cnidarian sheds Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cnidarian makes two Tendrils attacks.

action.name: Tendrils
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 10 ft. Hit: 27 (6d8) Necrotic damage, or 48 Necrotic damage if the target is Charmed by the cnidarian.

reaction.name: Reflexive Flash
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature the cnidarian can see within 30 feet deals damage to it. Response—Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the cnidarian that can see it. Failure: 10 (3d6) Radiant damage and the target has the Blinded condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only.

monster.description:
A translucent bulbous mass floats through the air gently, throbbing neon colors radiating across its skin like a cosmic nebula or an eldritch borealis. A mass of thin strands dangle down from of the creature, pulsating with bioluminescent light. The tendrils move and glide about, gently groping and grabbing at objects as it passes by. The whole creature glows, illuminating the darkened city streets around it. A distant chorus of ethereal hums and tones fill the air.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study an Effulgent Cnidarian, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Aberrant Resistance. You recognize the monster's Immunities and Resistances. (10+) Hypnotic Color Change. You learn of the monster's Hallucinogenic Bioluminescence trait. (15+) Weak but Aware. You are aware of the monster's Strength and Dexterity ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Effulgent Cnidarians are not predatorial — they only want to bask in the glow of delerium crystals, feeding slowly on the arcane energies they emit. They are, however, protective of their food sources. If creatures venture into an area of heavy delerium crystallization, they are sure to find a few Cnidarians bobbing about. The Cnidarian prefers to use its Hallucinogenic Bioluminescence to dissuade threats from engaging it, instead hoping to cause its enemies to kill one another. The Cnidarians feed on creatures under its hypnosis, absorbing their essence through its tendrils. If attacked, it uses its Reflexive Flash and attempts to move away from its threats, often floating straight up as quickly as it can and out of the reach of danger. Cnidarians do not stay around to fight. If all targets have avoided its charm, and are actively attacking it, it abandons its food source to seek other safer areas.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze. Organs: Glands. Natural Weapons: Tentacles. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 44 -45 (Third Party)

monster.name: Eldrick Runeweaver (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 75 (10d8 + 30) + 75 (10d8 + 30) per player character.

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Robe of the Archmagi, Staff of Power

trait.name: Academy Rings (1/Day)
trait.text: Eldrick can cast a spell from Spellcasting without expending a use of it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Eldrick has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Warding Aura
trait.text: Eldrick projects a 30-foot Emanation of warding magic. The first time on each turn that a creature within the Emanation deals damage or casts a spell on Eldrick, that creature takes 14 (4d6) Force damage and is pushed 10 feet away from Eldrick.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: Eldrick always takes his turn on Initiative count 20. On his turn, Eldrick can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or Bonus Action on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Eldrick takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Prismatic Blast
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +15, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 6) Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (Eldrick's choice).

action.name: Teleport
action.text: Eldrick teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet.

action.name: Chain Lightning (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Eldrick casts Chain Lightning, using the spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

action.name: Dispel Magic (1/round)
action.text: Eldrick casts Dispel Magic, using the spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

action.name: Spellcasting (1/round)
action.text: Eldrick casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to spell attacks): At Will: Mage Armor (included above), Mage Hand, Sending 2/Day Each: Arcane Hand (Eldrick may use an Epic Action to control the hand once per round), Banishment, Dimension Door, Ice Storm, Lightning Bolt, Scrying, Wall of Force

action.name: Greater Spellcasting (1/round)
action.text: Eldrick casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to spell attacks): 1/Day Each: Forcecage, Globe of Invulnerability, Maze, Prismatic Spray, Prismatic Wall, Teleport

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: Eldrick chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. Eldrick can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

reaction.name: Counterspell
reaction.text: Eldrick casts Counterspell in response to that spell's trigger, using the spellcasting ability from Spellcasting.

monster.spells: chain lightning, dispel magic, mage armor, mage hand, sending, arcane hand, banishment, dimension door, ice storm, lightning bolt, scrying, wall of force, forcecage, globe of invulnerability, maze, prismatic spray, prismatic wall, teleport, counterspell
monster.description:
Eldrick Runeweaver is a towering and broad-shouldered black man in his mid-sixties. His amber eyes glow softly behind his circular glasses, and a square-cut graying black beard. Eldrick wears nine rings of silver, gold, and electrum: one on each finger except his left thumb. He wears flowing purple garb with golden embroidery and carries an obsidian staff tipped with a delerium crystal.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. I carefully calculate my every action, and I speak using a few well-chosen words. I'm a teacher at heart, so I often phrase my responses in the form of a pointed question. • Ideal. I will seek out more information whenever I encounter an unknown situation or problem. Through reason and logic, the facts always bear out the truth of the matter. • Bond. I hold a position of responsibility and authority within the Amethyst Academy, and it is my duty to protect the Academy's interests, carry out its agenda, and keep its many secrets. • Flaw. I care deeply for my students but tend to overlook their faults and failures. I've had several wayward apprentices over the years, and I've often had to cover up their mistakes.
Eldrick Runeweaver has a Cat familiar, travels with an Iron Golem bodyguard, and a Homunculus servant. He most often communicates via Sending, Telepathic Bond, and Project Image spells, or by sending his simulacrum instead. Eldrick has a clone kept in a distant stronghold with extra equipment should the unthinkable occur.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 341 (Third Party)

monster.name: Eldritch Cataclysm
monster.conditionImmune: burning, exhaustion, frozen, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, shocked, stunned

trait.name: Air Form
trait.text: The eldritch cataclysm can enter a Hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

trait.name: Cyclonic Storm
trait.text: The eldritch cataclysm emits a 120-foot Emanation of high winds that disperse gases and vapors and extinguish unprotected flames. Ranged attacks that pass through the area have Disadvantage. Objects that are not worn or carried are blown away 1d6 x 5 feet in a random direction. A creature that starts its turn in the Emanation is subjected to the following effect. Strength Saving Throw: DC 17 (flying creatures have Disadvantage). Failure: The target has the Slowed condition until the start of its next turn. Failure by 5 or More: The target is flung 1d6 × 5 feet in a random direction, landing with the Prone condition.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eldritch cataclysm uses Chain Lighting or Icy Bolt, then uses Meteor Strike or Quake.

action.name: Chain Lightning
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +12, range 120 ft. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 7) Lightning damage, the target has the Shocked condition until the end of the cataclysm's next turn, and the lightning leaps to another creature of the cataclysm's choice within 15 feet of the first target. The cataclysm makes a separate Chain Lightning attack against the target. The cataclysm can make any number of Chain Lightning attacks in this way, but a creature can be targeted only once each time the cataclysm takes this action.

action.name: Icy Bolt
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +12, range 120 ft. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 7) Cold damage. Hit or Miss: The target and each creature within 5 feet of it are subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17. Failure: 18 (4d8) Cold damage, and the target has the Frozen condition (DC 17).

action.name: Meteor Strike
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 15-foot radius, 40-foot tall Cylinder centered on a point the cataclysm can see within 120 feet. Failure: 18 (4d8) Fire damage plus 18 (4d8) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Quake
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the cataclysm. Failure: 28 (8d6) Thunder damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

monster.description:
A swirling vortex of dark clouds, debris, and icy shards moves in like an eldritch storm. Crackling octarine lightning fills the air, the ground rumbles and shakes with the might of the unnatural weather phenomenon, but this is no ordinary storm. Within the dark clouds appears a snarling face, its eyes and mouth like pools of octarine light. The creature is the weather itself, warped and infused by the Haze of Drakkenheim into an arcane and twisted form of life, filled with the uncaring and unbridled anger of a storm.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they Study an Eldritch Cataclysm, learning the following based on their result: (15+) Amalgamation of Energies. You learn the creature's Immunities, as well as its Air Form trait. (20+) An Octarine Storm. You recognize its Chain Lightning, Meteor Strike, Quake, and Icy Bolt actions. (25+) Exceedingly Resilient. You are aware of its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Eldritch Cataclysms rule the skies, and never willingly descend to the ground. Instead, it rains down lightning, meteors, and icy blasts from above. The temperamental nature of these elementals means they delight in attacking with a variety of elements, and seldom use the same action two rounds in a row. They enjoy using their Meteor Strike on targets they've Frozen with Icy Bolt, and delight in using their Cyclonic Storm to blow away weapons and equipment dropped by targets of their Chain Lightning. These enraged creatures revel in destruction but have little conception that anything could actually pose a threat to them. When confronted with a foe able to withstand their onslaught, they treat it as a personal affront, and furiously focus their subsequent attacks upon them occasionally to the exclusion of all else. Despite this single-minded strategy, an Eldritch Cataclysm can recognize when a creature is resistant or immune to its elemental attacks and tries to use only the most effective powers against its chosen target.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Elemental. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Elemental Fluid. Dust: Elemental Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 50 -51 (Third Party)

monster.name: Eldritch Crawler

trait.name: Insectoid Limbs
trait.text: The eldritch crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. It ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, one target within 5 ft. Failure: 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Contaminated Venom
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, one target within 40 feet. Failure: 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Void Walker (Bonus Action)
action.text: The eldritch crawler climbs through a tear in reality, traveling from the Material Plane to the Space Between Worlds or vice versa.

reaction.name: Fractured Reality
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature misses the eldritch crawler with an attack. Response: The eldritch crawler teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet, briefly leaving behind a fractured image of itself being hit by the attack.

monster.description:
Amidst a web of fractured realities and glimpsed timelines sits an arachnid creature with twisted features. Its elongated form writhes and shivers as it clambers across its broken glass mosaic of possibilities. Its fanged maw gnashes and chomps. Within its movements one can make out faint resounding reverberations of possible movements and reactions that did not occur, as if with every step the creature takes, an infinite ghost of possible movements it may have taken glimmer and fade.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine an Eldritch Crawler, learning the following based on the result. (5+) Uncontainable. You know the creature's Resistances and Immunities. (10+) Escape Reality. You are aware of the creature's Void Walker Bonus Action. (15+) Dull and Diffident. You recognize the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics The Eldritch Crawlers weave together fractured timelines, and slip in and out of the Space Between Worlds with ease. They create their own Thin Places and travel through them back and forth as needed. When under attack, Eldritch Crawlers bend and alter the realities they exist in to shift to one where they are more likely to survive. They teleport around the battlefield and vanish into the Space Between Worlds as they need to, using Void Walker and their Fractured Reality Reaction, only to re-emerge and attack their prey with Contaminated Venom.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze, Mucus, Venom. Organs: Eyes, Guts, Glands, Flesh. Natural Weapons: Mandibles, Needles. Hair: Hair. Hide: Carapace. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 310 (Third Party)

monster.name: Eldritch Dreg

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dreg makes two Psychic Blast attacks.

action.name: Psychic Blast
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) Psychic damage and the dreg pushes the target 10 feet straight away from itself.

action.name: Synaptic Shock (recharge 6)
action.text: The dreg unleashes a storm of psychic energy in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 60 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw or take 14 (4d6) Psychic damage and has the Dazed condition (save ends).

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The dreg casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At Will: Mage Armor (included in AC), Mage Hand, Levitate (self only)

action.name: Hazewarp Hex (Bonus Action)
action.text: The dreg chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and one of the following conditions: Addled, Clumsy, Enfeebled, or Sickened. Charisma Saving Throw: DC 13, the targeted creature. Failure: The target becomes cursed by the dreg for one minute or until the dreg dies or uses this ability again. While cursed in this manner, a creature becomes vulnerable to Psychic damage and gains the chosen condition (sane ends). Success: The target is immune to the dreg's Hazewarp Hex for 24 hours.

monster.spells: mage armor, mage hand, levitate
monster.description:
The scrawny, twig-thin creature shuffles out of the shadows, seeming unstable on its feet, and disproportionately weighted by its massive, throbbing cranium that pulses with octarine energy. Suddenly, the creature lifts off the ground and a shimmering field surrounds it. Its hollow eyes begin to glow with contaminated energy as it whips its head towards you, a pulsing psychic energy emanating from its gaze.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study an Eldritch Dreg, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Haze Bound. You know this Aberration has Truesight. (10+) Psychic Powers. You are aware of its Hazewarp Hex Bonus Action and Psychic Blast actions. (15+) Cunning Being. You learn the Eldritch Dreg's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics An Eldritch Dreg curses its chosen target with Hazewarp Hex, and then hammers it with its Psychic Blast. It uses Levitate to keep itself out of melee by hovering above the battlefield and it will unleash its Synaptic Shock if its enemies are close to one another. If brought to less than half its Hit Points, it attempts to flee.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Claws. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 97 (Third Party)

monster.name: Eldritch Trickster

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The trickster makes two Psychic Blade attacks.

action.name: Psychic Blade
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) Psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The trickster casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13, +5 to spell attacks): At Will: Detect Magic, Mage Armor (included above), Mage Hand, Minor Illusion, Prestidigitation 2/Day Each: Disguise Self, Invisibility, Major image, Mirror Image, Sleep, Suggestion 1/Day Each: Dominate Person, Gaseous Form, Hypnotic Pattern

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: The trickster takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

monster.spells: detect magic, mage armor, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, disguise self, invisibility, major image, mirror image, sleep, suggestion, dominate person, gaseous form, hypnotic pattern
monster.description:
Draped in black robes and carrying an obsidian wand, the Eldritch Trickster has a hood pulled up tight around its head as arcane power focuses into its hand, forming a blade of raw energy.
Queen's Men Combat Tactics Amongst the Queen's Men, different groups may be organized as infiltrators, thieves, saboteurs, and assassins, who work unseen until the moment they strike. In contrast, highway robbers and enforcers operate openly, trying to shakedown and intimidate their marks to give up any valuables without a fight. Regardless, members of the Queen's Men are seldom willing to stick around when a fight starts going against them, valuing their own lives first and foremost.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 349 -350 (Third Party)

monster.name: Eldritch Troll

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The troll regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes Force or Psychic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll makes two Claw attacks and one Bite attack. It can replace its Bite attack with Corrupting Blast if available.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) Piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) Necrotic damage, and the target is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target gains one level of Contamination.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Corrupting Blast (recharge 5–6)
action.text: The troll blasts a corrupting beam at a point it can see within 300 feet. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16, all creatures in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Failure: 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage and gains a level of Contamination. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Forced Mutation (Bonus Action)
action.text: The troll is so contaminated that it changes form constantly, growing new appendages or exploding out of its old skin into a new form. The troll may manifest one of the following mutations. The mutation stays in effect until a new one is chosen.

action.name: Grotesque Wings (Bonus Action)
action.text: The troll gains a Fly Speed equal to is Speed, but it falls if it ends its turn in the air.

action.name: Cyclopean Eye (Bonus Action)
action.text: Corrupting Blast now recharges on a 4–6, and the troll gains Truesight 30 ft.

action.name: Extra Arms (Bonus Action)
action.text: The troll can make two additional Claw attacks as part of the Multiattack action.

action.name: Spider Legs (Bonus Action)
action.text: The troll gains a Climb Speed equal to its Speed and can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Reflective Flesh (Bonus Action)
action.text: The troll has the Invisible condition until it makes an attack.

action.name: Crystalized Carapace (Bonus Action)
action.text: The troll's Armor Class becomes 20.

monster.description:
The mottled faded purple skin of this massive creature is accented by erupting delerium crystals along its spine, shoulders, and forearms. Its large, frog-like octarine eyes glare at you. Its skin writhes and crawls as new appendages burst forth from it, in a constant state of mutation.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study an Eldritch Troll, learning the following information based on the result: (5+) From Harsh Environments. You know the troll's Immunities. (10+) Hard to Kill. You learn of the troll's Regeneration trait. (15+) Special Weakness. You have insight into the troll's Vulnerabilities.
Combat Tactics Eldritch Trolls stalk the streets of the Inner City of Drakkenheim attempting to contaminate any creature they come across. They use Corrupting Blast to contaminate their foes, mutating to whatever best suits them in the battle, and then use their Claws and Bite. If an Eldritch Troll takes Psychic damage, it immediately flees and attempts to find a safe place to recuperate.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Giant. Fluid: Monster Blood, Elemental Fluid, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Elemental Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 276 -277 (Third Party)

monster.name: Entropic Flame
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Fire Form
trait.text: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

trait.name: Enduring Flame
trait.text: Flames within 10 feet of the elemental can't be extinguished, and the Burning condition can't end for creatures within 10 feet of the elemental.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The elemental sheds Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light in an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The elemental makes three Dancing Flame attacks.

action.name: Dancing Flame
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Fire damage, and the target has the Burning condition (3d6 Fire).

action.name: Flickerjump (Bonus Action)
action.text: The elemental teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet.

monster.description:
An elemental alight with purple-green flames illuminates the desolate streets ahead. Composed of cascading octarine fire, the elemental moves like wildfire spreading uncontrollably. Within the dancing flames is a scornful expression of rage. It crackles and blazes, the heat from its body distorting the air around it. The pungent smell of burning ozone and sulfur saturates the area, and flecks of cinder and ash whirl about, shedding from the creature as it glides menacingly toward you.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they Study an Entropic Flame, learning the following based on their result: (10+) Supernaturally Resilient. You are aware of the creature's Immunities. (15+) Inextinguishable Fires. You learn of the elemental's Dancing Flame action and Flickerjump Bonus Action, as well as its Enduring Flame trait. (20+) Swift and Senseless. You know the creature's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics An Entropic Flame is a haughty combatant driven by a burning desire to set the world on fire. It teleports from place to place using its Flickerjump, setting alight creatures and objects using its Dancing Flames. If possible, it tries to remain close to Burning targets to keep them on fire within its Enduring Flame aura. Within the smoking ruins of Drakkenheim, Entropic Flames love to set buildings, furniture, and other objects on fire. They quickly turn the battlefield into a roiling inferno, one which cannot be extinguished easily thanks to their presence.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Elemental. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor. Dust: Elemental Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 47 (Third Party)

monster.name: Entropic Watcher (Epic)
monster.languages: understands all languages but can't speak, Telepathy 120 ft.

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 73 (7d10 + 35) + 73 (7d10 + 35) per player character.

trait.name: Corrupting Aura
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the entropic watcher takes 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The entropic watcher has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Withering Gaze
trait.text: The entropic watcher's eye creates a 150-foot long, 10-foot wide Line of withering magic. At the start of each of its turns, the entropic watcher decides which way the line faces and whether the line is active. Creatures in the Line have Vulnerability to Necrotic damage and can't regain Hit Points.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The entropic watcher always takes its turn on Initiative count 20. On its turn, the entropic watcher can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the entropic watcher takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Tendrils
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 40 ft. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 18). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition. The entropic watcher has ten tendrils, each of which can grapple one creature.

action.name: Insanity Beam (1/round)
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +10, range 60 ft. Hit: 22 (4d10) Necrotic damage, and the beam leaps to another target. The entropic watcher makes another Insanity Beam attack against a new target within 30 feet of the first. A creature can be targeted by only one Insanity Beam per turn. For each additional creature the beam hits, its damage increases by 5 (1d10).

action.name: Dimensional Glide
action.text: The entropic watcher moves up to its Speed with out provoking Opportunity Attacks.

action.name: Shadow Crash (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 30-foot radius Sphere centered on a point the entropic watcher can see within 150 feet. Failure: 36 (8d8) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The Sphere's area is filled with magical Darkness for 1 minute or until the entropic watcher uses Shadow Crash again. A creature that ends its turn in the area takes 36 (8d8) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Contaminated Grasp
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature Grappled by the entropic watcher. Failure: 16 (3d10) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. Success: Half damage.

action.name: Force Barrier
action.text: The entropic watcher creates a shimmering octarine 10-foot-by-10-foot wall of force centered on a point within 150 feet. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the entropic watcher has the Incapacitated condition or dies. The wall appears in any orientation it chooses, and can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (the entropic watcher's choice). Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by Dispel Magic. A Disintegrate spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel through the wall.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: The entropic watcher chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The entropic watcher can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

monster.description:
This floating mass of wet flabby flesh drifts through the air, its many long spindly tendrils dangling down like an incomprehensible jellyfish. Appearing in strange hues of pale pinks, purples, and whites, its large single eye in the middle of its fleshy mass glows with octarine hues, weakening body and mind. The soft sound of thrumming and suckling follows it as it assaults minds with insane chattering in unknown languages.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine an Entropic Watcher, learning the following based on the result. (10+) Guarded Existence. You learn the creature's Resistances and Immunities. (15+) Imperiling Stare. You recognize the creature's Withering Gaze feature. (20+) Physically Resilient. You know the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics The Entropic Watcher is a keen hunter who, by its very gaze, can cause a creature to grow weak and leave it open for annihilation. The Entropic Watcher focuses its gaze upon its prey and unleashes its eye beams towards it, knowing that if it can hold its gaze, the creature will succumb to the watcher's blasts much easier. It will use its Force Barrier and Shadow Crash to force its victims into an optimal position for it to strike, and grab them with its tendrils, holding them readily in its Withering Gaze. If the Entropic Watcher is reduced to less than 50 Hit Points, it attempts to flee.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze, Mucus. Organs: Eyes, Guts, Glands, Flesh. Natural Weapons: Tentacles. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 302 -303 (Third Party)

monster.name: Executioner (Epic)
monster.languages: understands Common but doesn't speak it
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 250 (20d12 + 140) + 250 (20d12 + 140) per player character.

trait.name: Dimensional Anchor
trait.text: The Executioner can't be teleported or sent to another plane of existence unless it chooses to be.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The Executioner is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If the Executioner is destroyed, it reforms with all of its Hit Points 1 minute later unless a Wish spell is used to stop it. A Wish spell used in this manner is always stressful, and the caster must roll to determine whether or not they can cast the Wish spell ever again.

trait.name: Necrotic Vents
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Executioner takes 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Stoic
trait.text: The Executioner can't take Reactions.

trait.name: Bound to Slaughter
trait.text: If the Executioner begins its turn more than 100 feet away from Slaughterstone Square, it disappears into the Haze and reappears 1 minute later at the center of Slaughterstone Square.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The Executioner always takes its turn on Initiative count 20. On its turn, the Executioner can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Executioner takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Lumber Forward (1/round)
action.text: The Executioner moves up to its Speed.

action.name: Death Grip
