monster.name: Lord Commander Elias Drexel (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 85 (10d8 + 40) plus 85 (10d8 + 40) per player character.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: Elias always takes his turn on Initiative count 20. On his turn, Elias can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or Bonus Action on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Elias takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Lord Commander's Blade
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach 5 ft. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) Slashing damage, and Elias can apply one of the following martial masteries to the target: • Wound. The target has the Bleeding condition (4d4). • Topple. The target has the Prone condition. • Sap. The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of start of Elias's next turn

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +12, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) Piercing damage, and Elias can apply one of the following martial masteries to the target: • Push. If the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from Elias. • Slow. The target has the Slowed condition (DC 15 Constitution save ends).

action.name: Command
action.text: Elias chooses one ally he can see. If the ally can see and hear him, it can use its Reaction to make one weapon attack with Advantage. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage.

action.name: Flare (1/round)
action.text: Elias chooses a point he can see within 60 feet and fires a flare at it, signaling the Hooded Lantern's bombardment. Elias recharges his Artillery Strike. He can only use this Epic Action if it's the first Epic Action he has taken this round.

action.name: Artillery Strike (recharge Special)
action.text: Elias can only use this Epic Action if it's the last Epic Action he takes this round. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 20-foot radius Sphere centered on the point Elias chose with his Flare Epic Action. Failure: 18 (4d8) Piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) Fire damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: Elias chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. Elias can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

monster.description:
Elias Drexel is a man in his early fifties. He is stocky and imposing with a furrowed brow and a grim frown on his wide and angular face. His harsh features are framed with a thick moustache, side chops, and mane of long braided brown hair. He is garbed in chainmail armor with heavy leather gloves and boots, worn under a fur-lined dark green cloak and iron pauldrons. He wears a pinned brooch depicting the Seal of Drakkenheim, the symbol of his office as Lord Commander. A quiver, a longbow, and two longswords are strung on his back.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. I have great responsibilities and have no time for senseless humor. I never cease to worry about our struggling militia's desperate task to reclaim these monster infested ruins. I have no patience for anything or anyone who doesn't further the Hooded Lanterns objectives. • Ideal. Loyalty and trust are priceless. It must be carefully given, but staunchly held. There is nothing worse than betrayal and treason. • Bond. During the Civil War, I switched sides and killed several scions of House von Kessel who could have claimed the throne. I once believed it was for the right cause, but now I feel personally responsible for breaking the royal line. My mission in Drakkenheim is penance and redemption. • Flaw. I'm filled with rage and conflict because of my contradictory actions and beliefs, and I don't take defeat, setbacks, or even missteps lightly.
Combat Tactics. Elias Drexel typically leads several Hooded Lantern Veterans into battle, using his Command action to grant them additional attacks while calling in artillery strikes as often as possible. Drexel himself operates as a skirmisher, switching between melee and ranged attacks to control the flow of battle.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 365 (Third Party)

monster.description:
This albino Garmyr stands well over 12 feet tall, covered in yellowish-white mangy fur, bloodstained and scarred from countless battles and clad in a patchwork armor of leather, chain, and bladed plate. Mummified heads hang from his belt. A mane of bony spines and tufts of barbed hair jut from his head and run down his back to a long white tail braided with skulls and bone fragments. A snarling visage sports long, jagged fangs and smoldering red eyes. The Lord of the Feast holds an oversized longbow, stringed with thick sinew. A quiver on his back holds enormous arrows. Some bristle with barbed snares, others are connected to coils of chains around the beast's wrists, while others are tipped with delerium shards.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine the Lord of the Feast learning the following based on the result: (5+) Difficult to Kill. You know of the creature's Regeneration ability. (10+) Dangerous Archer. You recognize that he carries special arrows revealing his Poison Arrow, Ensnaring Arrow, and Harpoon Arrow attacks. (15+) Cunning Combatant. You learn their strongest and weakest saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Lord of the Feast stalks the Temple Ward of Drakkenheim with his war dogs, searching for glorious kills. He seeks out the most fearsome monsters, and loves picking fights with faction agents and adventurers. When a band of plucky heroes enters his territory, the Lord of the Feast tracks and hunts them until they leave the Inner City or he has their skulls. The Lord of the Feast uses a variety of arrows in combat: Poison Arrow to debilitate foes, Ensnaring Arrow to stop them fleeing, and Harpoon Arrow to pull them toward him to engage in melee combat. If the Lord of the Feast is reduced below 100 Hit Points, he attempts to escape, but regroups as soon as possible with more hunters in tow to continue the hunt.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws. Hair: Fur. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 152 -153 (Third Party)

monster.name: Lucretia Mathias (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 68 (15d8) plus 68 (15d8) per player character.

trait.name: Holy Aura
trait.text: Lucretia projects a 60-foot Emanation of holy power. At the start of each of her turns, she can choose the aura's effect, which applies to creatures of her choice in the Emanation: • Divine Grace. Creatures in the Emanation that target Lucretia with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This effect doesn't protect Lucretia from area effects, such as the explosion of a Fireball. If Lucretia makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, this trait ends until the start of her next turn. • Pacifying Presence. A creature that starts its turn in the Emanation has the Weakened condition until the start of its next turn. • Wrathful Flame. A creature that starts its turn in the Emanation takes 10 (3d6) Radiant damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

trait.name: Prescient
trait.text: Lucretia can't be surprised while she is conscious.

trait.name: Sanctified By Falling Fire
trait.text: When Lucretia dies, her soul is pulled into the delerium crystal embedded in her chest.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While Lucretia is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier (included above).

trait.name: Undeniable Faith
trait.text: Lucretia automatically succeeds on Constitution saving throws to maintain Concentration on her spells.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: Lucretia always takes her turn on Initiative count 20. On her turn, Lucretia can use her movement and interaction as normal. However, she does not take an action or Bonus Action on her turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Lucretia takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Pacifying Touch
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature within 5 feet of Lucretia. Failure: 35 (10d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Incapacitated condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only. Failure or Success: If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target is stabilized but has the Unconscious condition for 1 hour, even after regaining Hit Points.

action.name: Sacred Flame
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature within 60 feet of Lucretia. Failure: 45 (10d8) Radiant damage, and the target has the Blinded condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Spellcasting (1/round)
action.text: Lucretia casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20, +12 to spell attacks; spells other than cantrips are cast at level 9): At Will: Guidance, Light, Thaumaturgy 2/Day Each: Aid, Bless, Banishment, Dispel Magic, Flame Strike, Hold Person, Mass Cure Wounds, Sending 1/Day Each: Commune, Death Ward, Divination, Scrying, Speak with Dead

action.name: Greater Spellcasting (1/round)
action.text: Lucretia casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20, +12 to spell attacks; spells other than cantrips are cast at level 9): 1/Day Each: Gate, Greater Restoration, Heal, Heroes' Feast, Resurrection, Word of Recall

action.name: Divine Intervention (1/Day)
action.text: Lucretia chooses any spell which doesn't require a Reaction to cast. As part of this Epic Action, she casts that spell without Material components. If she uses this Epic Action to cast the Wish spell, she can't use this Epic Action for the next 1d4 days.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: Lucretia chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting her and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on her. Lucretia can use this action even if she would otherwise be unable to take actions, her actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters her game statistics.

monster.spells: guidance, light, thaumaturgy, aid, bless, banishment, dispel magic, flame strike, hold person, mass cure wounds, sending, commune, death ward, divination, scrying, speak with dead, gate, greater restoration, heal, heroes' feast, resurrection, word of recall
monster.description:
Lucretia Mathias is a willowy and wizened woman with piercing eyes and pursed lips. She is in her early nineties and keeps her graying black hair in a coiled bun beneath a linen shawl. Lucretia wears simple gray robes, and clutches a heavy leather-bound tome. A glowing golden crystal dangles from a silver chain around her neck. Her garb lightly conceals the delirium shard embedded in her heart.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. I am devout. believe intensely in my faith and will give those seeking me a chance to speak. I care deeply for those who seek me out, bringing my full wisdom and passion to bear. • Ideal. The brightest lights shine in the darkest of places. I will find my truth through my commitment to the light. Those who follow me will be spared when the time comes. • Bond. The Meteor. I know the meteor is an early coming of the Tarnas comet, symbolizing all I base my faith upon. Only by coming to the Crater and finding yourself within can you be purified and cleansed of all your sins. • Flaw. I only reveal the greatest truths I have seen to those I am certain can fully grasp and understand them as I do.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 348 (Third Party)

monster.name: Lurker on the Threshold
monster.languages: understands all languages but can't speak, Telepathy 120 ft.

trait.name: Eldritch Blood
trait.text: A creature that deals Piercing or Slashing damage to the lurker while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The lurker has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lurker makes three Tendril attacks. It can replace each Tendril attack with a use of Cosmic Rays.

action.name: Tendril
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 30 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 16). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition. The lurker has ten tendrils, each of which can grapple one creature.

action.name: Cosmic Rays
action.text: The lurker randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet (roll 1d4; reroll if the lurker has already used that ray this turn): 1: Disintegrating Ray. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 27 (6d8) Force damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, it disintegrates into dust. 2: Memory Lapse Ray. Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target's memories become distant for 1 minute. While its memories are distant, the target can't take the Magic action, use class features, or understand language, and has Disadvantage on ability checks. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. 3: Contaminating Ray. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 16 (3d10) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. Success: Half damage only. 4: Existential Dread Ray. On the target's next turn, each time it takes an action other than the Dodge action, moves more than 5 feet, or takes a Bonus Action, it takes 14 (4d6) Psychic damage.

monster.description:
Latching onto the Thin Places between realities, a cackling chorus of chaotic laughter in hysterical and dissonant tones tears through the minds of those who bear witness to the cosmic being. As it peers out with its three unblinking dark pools of eyes, it observes and surveys the realities as its mass of fleshy tendrils dangle from its slimy form. It ripples with black voidlike hues and splashes of deep purples and blues as if its flesh was a moving image of the cosmos.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Lurker on the Threshold, learning the following based on the result. (10+) Baleful Resistance. You know the creature's Immunities. (15+) Arcane Beams. You learn the creature's Cosmic Rays attack action. (20+) Enduring. You know the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics The Lurker on the Threshold is a creature of pure arcane energy and twisted realities. It fires Cosmic Rays at mortal creatures, warping their minds, showing truths that drive them mad, or undoes their very existence on a cellular level. It grabs creatures with its Tendrils and blasts its beams while holding them in place, undoing the creatures from the inside out, before tossing them aside and moving on to the next. The Lurker on the Threshold only flees if it is reduced to under half its Hit Points, not because of any sense of fear, but because it finds specific enemies a nuisance.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze, Mucus. Organs: Eyes, Guts, Glands, Flesh. Natural Weapons: Tentacles. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 309 (Third Party)

monster.name: Lurking Dreg

trait.name: Normal Semblance
trait.text: The dreg has Advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks to disguise itself as, or impersonate, a humanoid creature.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Poison damage.

action.name: Furious Ambush (recharges On a Short Rest)
action.text: The dreg makes two Dagger attacks.

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: The dreg takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

monster.description:
Draped in a dark cloak with the hood pulled up tight, the figure regards you with a cautious disposition. They pace back and forth, watching you, anticipating your actions and readying themselves for any sudden movement. From under the hood, you can make out a toothy smirk and pale flesh. Gently glowing eyes peer out from the shadows, observing you carefully and diligently.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Insight gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study a Lurking Dreg, learning the following based on their result: (10+) Something's Off. You suspect this person may have been exposed to eldritch contamination. (15+) Hiding Something. You are aware of the Lurking Dreg's Cunning Action trait. (20+) Not A Humanoid. You realize this is a Dreg appearing to be a normal humanoid and recognize the Lurking Dreg's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Some Lurking Dregs hide in the shadows, waiting for an opportune moment to strike. Others pose as humans and attempt to converse with prey, hoping to draw them deeper into the ruins. Lurking Dregs have been known to use stories of lost allies, trapped children, and more to lure adventurers into an ambush. When they attack, Lurking Dregs use their Furious Ambush right away to get as many attacks in as possible. They Disengage if they can and attempt to keep their enemies at bay, possibly having other Dregs tie them up while the Lurking Dreg darts in and out. If Lurking Dregs find themselves outnumbered at any point, they run into the shadows and Hide, attempting to escape.
Harvestable Components (Common) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 101 (Third Party)

monster.name: Magma Troll

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The troll regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes Cold damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll makes two Fiery Claw attacks and one Volcanic Bite attack. It can replace its Volcanic Bite attack with Sulphurous Belch, if available.

action.name: Volcanic Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Claw
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. or range 120 feet. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Fire damage, and the target has the Burning condition (4d6 Fire).

action.name: Sulfurous Belch (recharges 5–6)
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on the troll. Failure: 14 (4d6) Fire damage and has the Blinded condition until it or another creature within 5 of it uses an action to clean the ash from their eyes. Success: Half damage only.

monster.description:
Its flesh is like molten rocks, accented by glowing veins of fire. Its eyes are two burning pools of lava. It lets out a roar that sounds like the grinding rock of an erupting volcano. Its steps leave behind pools of hot liquid magma, which drips from its hands and mouth as well.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Magma Troll, learning the following information based on the result: (5+) From Harsh Environments. You know the troll's Immunities. (10+) Hard to Kill. You learn of the troll's Regeneration trait. (15+) Special Weakness. You have insight into the troll's Vulnerabilities.
Combat Tactics Magma Trolls hunt for food during the hottest days of summer or in places of extreme temperatures. Often accompanied by sweltering heat, they begin combat by unleashing their Sulfurous Belch before rushing in to maul foes with their claws and bites. If a Magma Troll takes Cold damage, it immediately flees and attempts to find a safe place to recuperate.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Giant. Fluid: Monster Blood, Elemental Fluid. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws. Hide: Plates. Dust: Elemental Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 275 (Third Party)

monster.name: Master Mage

trait.name: Academy Rings (1/Day)
trait.text: The mage can cast a spell from Spellcasting without expending a use of it.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mage makes three Prismatic Blast attacks.

action.name: Prismatic Blast
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 14 (4d6) Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (mage's choice).

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to spell attacks): At Will: Detect Magic, Light, Mage Armor (included above), Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Unseen Servant 2/Day Each: Fly, Ice Storm, Lightning Bolt 1/Day Each: Banishment, Wall of Force

reaction.name: Counterspell (recharge 5–6)
reaction.text: The mage casts Counterspell in response to that spell's trigger, using the spellcasting ability from Spellcasting.

monster.description:
Dressed in decorated ornate gold and purple robes, these mages carry a staff of black steel with a delerium crystal encased in glass at the top. A book of spells floats beside them as they pull arcane power from the delerium orb atop their staff.
Academy Combat Tactics Broadly speaking, Amethyst Academy mages eschew combat, valuing their own lives too highly to take such risks. They view themselves as researchers, craftspeople, and scholars, not war mages—few bother learning damaging spells beyond simple cantrips, instead focusing on practical magic for their academic and industrial pursuits. Nevertheless, they know that magic is still a dangerous vocation, and ready themselves to flee perilous situations with Invisibility spells or teleportation magic. When violent confrontation seems inevitable, Amethyst Academy agents often hire mercenaries or adventurers, or dispatch summoned creatures in their stead. Nevertheless, there are bold explorers who take to field research and prepare themselves for dangerous expeditions—particularly, those who personally study the ruins of Drakkenheim. They often utilize constructs such as Shield Guardians or summoned elementals bound to service with Planar Binding. Mages usually begin combat with defensive or control spells as befits the situation, such as taking to the air with Fly or subduing foes with Slow. Only once they are certain the situation is under control will they use their signature Prismatic Blasts or area-of-effect spells like Fireball and Lightning Bolt. These mages almost always flee once they've become Bloodied, viewing a temporary setback or mission failure as a preferable outcome over their deaths.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 336 -338 (Third Party)

monster.name: Maw Vermin

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The maw vermin has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The maw vermin makes one Bite attack and three Claw attacks, and it can use Grasping Maw or Glob Launcher.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 5 ft. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) Piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is swallowed. A swallowed creature has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, and has Total Cover from effects originating outside the maw vermin. At the start of each of the maw vermin's turns, a swallowed creature takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one Contamination level. The maw vermin can swallow up to three creatures at a time. If the maw vermin takes 20+ damage in a single turn from a creature inside it, the maw vermin must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which land in spaces within 10 feet of the maw vermin with the Prone condition. If the maw vermin dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting with the Prone condition.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 10 ft. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) Slashing damage, and if the target is Huge or smaller, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 16). Until the grapple ends, the maw vermin can't use this Claw on another target. The maw vermin has three Claws.

action.name: Grasping Maw
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 18, one Medium or smaller creature the maw vermin can see within 15 feet. Failure: The target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the maw vermin.

action.name: Glob Launcher
action.text: The maw vermin coats a swallowed creature in acidic goo and launches it at a point within 120 feet of it. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature within 10 feet of the launched creature as it lands (the launched creature automatically fails). Failure: 21 (6d6) Acid damage, and the target has the Burning condition (4d6 Acid). While Burning, the target has the Restrained condition

monster.description:
A grotesque form lies before you. At first it seems to be just a mound of rotten meat, but its form becomes apparent when it turns toward you. A rat-like snout and eyes protrude from its rolling mass of pinkish flesh and patchy fur. It reaches for you with three long, gangly arms. Its midsection then opens with a yawning moan where a large purple tongue flops from between jagged teeth, slurping gobs of vile saliva as it drags itself towards its next meal.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Maw Vermin, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Filled with Delerium. You recognize that this creature gained the Magic Resistance trait, and has Resistance to Acid, Poison, and Necrotic damage. (15+) Chew and Spit! You learn the details of the Maw Vermin's Bite, and Glob Launcher. (20+) Dim but Enduring. You know the Maw Vermin's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics A Maw Vermin is a primal creature that cannot comprehend anything beyond its next meal. Ratlings give them a wide berth, as it is just as likely to consume them as anything else. When a Maw Vermin senses anything it can eat, it lumbers towards the meal, using its Grasping Maw to pull targets closer so it can Bite them. Maw Vermin want to consume anything in sight, using its own food to secure even more. It uses Glob Launcher to spit half-digested morsels, happily eating whatever mess is left over.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Acidic Bile. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh, Glands. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Claws, Teeth, Tentacles. Hair: Fur. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 133 (Third Party)

trait.name: Construct Resilience

trait.name: Haze Adaptation

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: Minazorond always takes its turn on Initiative count 20. On its turn, Minazorond can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect.
