This ratling sports a pair of thick goggles and an impressive custom-built crossbow. The skittish rat wears a scraped-together, acid-stained leather coat and a bandolier of bubbling flasks and vials that hangs along its belt. It mixes glowing liquids that fume and sizzle, preparing to hurl a vial toward you.

monster.description:
This burly ratling stands a head taller than their broodlings, wearing a fearless expression upon their snarling snout. Clad in scavenged bits of armor, they carry a broad, makeshift shield which may have once been a window shutter, tabletop, or part of a door. They wield a long spear topped with a vicious chunk of sharp scrap metal that appears to be coated in some kind of toxic sludge.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Athletics or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Ratling Burrow Warden, learning the following based on the result: (5+) Powerful Ratling. You know these creatures have similar senses and Immunities as a typical ratling but are physically tougher and much stronger. (10+) Aggressive Attacker. You are aware of the Burrow Warden's Pack Tactics trait and Shield Shove action. (15+) Strong and Tough. You recognize the Burrow Warden's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Ratling Burrow Wardens often form a tight formation during an attack, taking up their shields and poison-tipped spears to defend choke points. They especially like using their Shield Shove to push attackers into pits or other prepared traps in the burrow.

monster.description:
A cloaked ratling appears from out of the shadows, a wicked blade carved from delerium in its claws. A hand crossbow hangs at their side with a quiver of poison-tipped bolts. They fire at you, then dash from the shadows, lunging to attack.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Sleight of Hand or Stealth gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Ratling Guttersnipe, learning the following based on the result: (5+) Mutated Monstrosities. You understand these creatures have an excellent sense of smell, Darkvision, and are capable climbers and swimmers. They are Immune to Contamination, but have no other special Resistances. (10+) Mob Attacks. You learn of the Ratling Guttersnipe's Pack Tactics trait and its Ratling Cunning. (15+) Nimble but Weak. You know the ratling's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Ratling Guttersnipes stick to the shadows, staying hidden as long as possible. They are likely to position themselves on rooftops or behind rubble, and often secure their locations with pit traps, flasks of oil, torches, or other devious traps when they are able. Once they notice their target is in position, Ratling Guttersnipes unload a volley of poison-tipped bolts, or unleash deadly traps. After their targets are weakened, the ratlings rushes in to surprise and stab creatures with their delirium blades, and then quickly dart back out. As with all ratlings, if the fight turns against them, they will flee or beg for their lives.

action.name: Infection (3/Day)
action.text: The ratling causes one creature it can see within 60 feet to be infected with a disease. At the start of each of its turns, the target is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: 13 (2d12) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage. After three successes, the disease ends. Failure or Success: A Lesser Restoration spell ends the disease early.

action.name: Metastasize
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, one creature within 15 feet that is infected with a disease. Failure: The target has one of the following conditions (the ratling's choice): Addled, Clumsy, or Enfeebled (save ends). The condition immediately ends and is replaced by a new condition if the ratling uses Metastasize on the target again. Failure or Success: 9 (2d8) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Rampant Sickness (Bonus Action)
action.text: The ratling spreads its Infection from an infected target to another creature adjacent to that target

monster.description:
Cloaked in a thick leather jacket and a crude, custom-made gas mask, this ratling scurries forth clutching a worn satchel brimming with poisons and potions. An acrid smell wafts off the ratling, combined with burnt hair and something putrid and rotten. Its fur is mottled, and burned away in patches across its neck, arms, and legs. Its flesh is covered in sores, blisters, and infected wounds. It rummages through its bag before producing a vial and tossing it forcefully to the ground at your feet.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Medicine gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Ratling Pathogenist, learning the following based on the result: (5+) Furry Monstrosities. You understand these creatures have an excellent sense of smell, Darkvision, and are capable climbers and swimmers. They are Immune to Contamination, but have no other special Resistances. (10+) Infectious You are aware of its Plaguebringer Aura and Infection action. (15+) Nimble but Weak. You recognize the ratling's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Ratling Pathogenist is a cunning killer and loves to riddle its foes with diseases. The ratling will release one of its deadly infections into a creature nearby and use Rampant Sickness to spread it to anyone nearby. Metastasis causes the disease to kill its target even faster. The pathogenist prefers to keep their distance and will attempt to scurry away if cornered or forced to fight in melee. It will also run if it is alone, or if its allies are fewer than its enemies.

monster.description:
A pair of glinting yellow-purple eyes appear down the dark tunnel ahead, then another, then more. A scurrying mass of furry bodies bound up in mud-spattered cloth and greasy leather surges forward. Their rodent-like claws brandish rust-caked blades as many squeaking voices erupt into a cacophony of chittering, chirping, screeching, and finally a howl of "Kill! Kill! Kill!"
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Ratling Warrior, learning the following based on the result: (5+) Mutated Monstrosities. You are aware these creatures have an excellent sense of smell, Darkvision, are capable climbers and swimmers, and are Immune to Contamination. (10+) Mob Attacks. You learn of the Ratling Warrior's Pack Tactics trait and Ratling Cunning action. (15+) Swift, Weak, and Cowardly. You know its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Ratlings fight together in large groups to surround and overwhelm their foes with Pack Tactics. They use whatever rusty weapons they can find, or use their teeth and claws when nothing else is available. Occasionally, ratlings carry makeshift slings and hurl anything they pick up off the ground at their enemies: rocks, bones, or even chips of delerium. However, ratlings flee and hide using Ratling Cunning when they don't have a numerical advantage over their foes. Indeed, they won't start fights if they don't outnumber their foes at least two to one, but while they outnumber their foes three to one or more, the typical ratling warrior can become insanely brave. When ratlings overpower their foes, they may even grapple them down and take them as prisoners to eat later.

monster.name: Ravenous Flora (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 42 (4d10 + 20) + 42 (4d10 + 20) per player character.

trait.name: Writhing Aura
trait.text: The ground within 30 feet of the ravenous flora is filled with plant roots and becomes Difficult Terrain. A creature that starts its turn in the aura takes 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

trait.name: Poison Ivy
trait.text: If the ravenous flora would take Poison damage, it instead takes no damage and regains Hit Points equal to the Poison damage it would have received.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The ravenous flora always takes its turn on Initiative count 20. On its turn, the ravenous flora can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the ravenous flora takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Piercing damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target has the Restrained condition and the ravenous flora can't Bite another target.

action.name: Spit Acid
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Acid damage, and the target has the Burning condition (2d4 Acid). While Burning, the target has the Blinded condition.

action.name: Swallow
action.text: The ravenous flora makes one Bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it has Grappled. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed and the grapple ends. The swallowed target has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, has Total Cover from attacks and effects outside the flora, and takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage at the start of each of its turns. The flora can have up to four targets swallowed at a time. If the flora takes 15 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which land with the Prone condition in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of it. If the flora dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting with the Prone condition.

action.name: Hypnotic Pollen (1/round)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 60-foot Emanation originating from the ravenous flora. Failure: 9 (2d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Weakened condition (save ends). While Weakened, the target must spend all of its movement on each of its turns to move directly toward the ravenous flora. During this movement, the target ignores Difficult Terrain caused by the flora's Writhing Aura.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: The ravenous flora chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The ravenous flora can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

monster.description:
This massive plant writhes forward on a mass of roots and vines. Its large leaves waving back and forth surround its great floral head. Glowing hypnotic octarine petals surround a central bulb that opens into a mouth oozing with saliva nectar as a leaf-like tongue licks in anticipation. Its maw is filled with hooked, jagged teeth. The creature looks ready to swallow you whole.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Ravenous Flora, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Plant-like nature. You understand the Ravenous Flora's Immunities and its Poison Ivy trait. (15+) Giant Maw with Toxic Pollen. You learn of its Writhing Aura and Swallow. (20+) Large and Slow. You recognize its movement speed and Dexterity saving throw.
Combat Tactics The Ravenous Flora attempts to hypnotize its prey with its Hypnotic Pollen. Because it is a slow-moving creature, it uses this to attract victims before attempting to Bite and Swallow its targets. If no targets are in range, it Spits Acid at them and does its best to move to an advantageous position.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Plant. Fluid: Sap, Acidic Bile. Organs: Flowers. Bones: Stems. Natural Weapons: Needles, Spores. Hair: Leaves. Dust: Plant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 212 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ravenous Ghoul

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The ghoul has Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the ghoul's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

action.name: Rancid Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Poison damage.

action.name: Aggressive (Bonus Action)
action.text: The ghoul moves up to its Speed toward a Hostile creature it can see.

monster.description:
The emaciated figure has ash-white skin and is completely hairless. The monster's eyes are two pools of abyssal blackness. Its fingers end in long points, and its teeth are jagged. It lurches away from a fresh corpse it was feasting upon, blood and gore dripping from its maw as it sniffs the air. Smelling something alive, it knows another meal is close by. Its gaze turns in your direction.
Thick poison drips from the grimy teeth and claws of these feral, unarmored ghouls. Their sunken, stark white eyes glisten as they lick their lips with a long, slimy pointed tongue, hungry for their next meal.
Study The Foe Characters proficient in Religion or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine a Ghoul, learning the following based on the result. (5+) Undead Resistance. You recognize the creature's Immunities. (10+) Pursuing Hunger. You know the creature's melee attacks and its Bonus Actions. (15+) Agile Attacker. You are aware of its highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics Ghouls are mindless and vicious. They charge towards enemies with an insatiable hunger for human flesh, and rarely flee from a fight. They can be easily distracted by a fresh corpse to eat, and follow the whims of their masters. The hungrier the ghoul is, the less mindful it is, and the more aggressive it becomes. Some vampires are known to starve their ghouls for months before unleashing them into battle. Although these ravenous ghouls are less coherent, their complete frenzied hunger makes them a much more dangerous threat. Ghoul priests and Ghoul Lords often accompany larger arrangements of ghouls to help focus them towards their vampire master's enemies. The priests keep them fighting through mortal wounds while Ghoul Lords lead the charge into combat.

Failure: The target has the Immobilized condition until it leaves the Emanation. While Immobilized, the target believes itself to be in an altered and confused environment of shifting forms, and can't see or hear anything else. The target does not perceive itself to be stationary, and instead believes it is walking through a bizarre landscape. It can take an action on its turn to repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the creature succeeds on its save or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the reality cyst's Unhinged Reality for 24 hours.

trait.name: Unusual Nature

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Psychic Whip
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) Psychic damage, and the target has the Dazed condition until the end of the reality cyst's next turn. The reality cyst can target a creature Immobilized by its Unhinged Reality with this attack even if the creature has Total Cover.

action.name: Feed (Bonus Action)
action.text: Each creature Immobilized by Unhinged Reality takes 10 (3d6) Psychic damage. The reality cyst regains Hit Points equal to the total damage dealt, and its Hit Point Maximum increases by the same amount.

reaction.name: Fracture
reaction.text: Trigger: The reality cyst takes damage. Response: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 60-foot Emanation originating from the reality cyst. Failure: The target has the Addled condition (save ends).

monster.description:
You come across a glistening mass of pustules that seem to grow directly out of the physical structures of the city, as if the natural wood, stone, and earth are alive. These cysts are a cancer growing within Drakkenheim. The very air around the cyst changes, the light refracts in incorrect patterns, and the lines and angles of its surroundings seem to fracture in incoherent designs. To look upon it is like looking at reality itself through a broken mirror. One that is both present and not present at all, where your every move and step are strained and confused. For a brief moment, you seem to forget what you saw at all, and the landscape around you seems unfamiliar. Have you been here before? How did you get here in the first place? Your mind strains to grasp these questions.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana gain Advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks to Study a Reality Cyst, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Unmoving Aberration. You learn the Reality Cyst's creature type and speed. (10+) Draining Rejuvenation. You are aware of the creature's Feed Bonus Action. (15+) Anomalous Influence. You recognize the cyst's ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Reality Cyst is less of a hunter than it is a disease. It feeds off the confusion of creatures trapped in its illusions. It mimics the bending realities of the Space Between Worlds and mirrors that into the minds of those who are close to it. After their target enters a trance, it drinks their mental energy and grows. The Reality Cyst does only one thing: it feeds. It cannot move or defend itself well against attacks. It relies on creatures succumbing to its Unhinged Reality trait and devouring their minds. Once discovered, there is little the cyst can do to survive.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Mucus. Organs: Glands. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 72 -73 (Third Party)

monster.name: Reautomata
monster.languages: Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
trait.text: If damage reduces the reautomata to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken, unless the damage is from a Critical Hit. On a success, the reautomata drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The reautomata's Long Jump is up to 50 feet and its High Jump is up to 30 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The reautomata makes two Arm Blade attacks and one Entrapping Rend attack.

action.name: Arm Blade
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) Slashing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed up to 5 feet away from the reautomata and has the Prone condition.

action.name: Entrapping Rend
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft., one Prone target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) Piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 17). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition and the reautomata can't make Entrapping Rend attacks against another target.

action.name: Aggressive (Bonus Action)
action.text: The reautomata moves up to its Speed toward a Hostile creature it can see. This movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks.

monster.description:
Charging towards you with unbound fury is a lithe human clad in a hulking suit of full plate wielding a pair of oversized scimitars. As they draw closer with a snarl, it becomes clear you face no mere warrior, but a monstrous abomination of metal and flesh. The emaciated figure is not wearing the armor: the plates have been riveted and bolted into their bones. Globs of weeping, infected scar tissue pulsate where the body fights against the metal fused into muscle and sinew. It does not hold its weapons: its forelimbs have been entirely replaced with scything talon-blades. Their metal helmets are smooth and featureless save for a single ocular delerium lens, and expose the creature's sickly mouth and sharpened teeth, its breath giving off a rank chemical odor.
Constructs of Metal and Flesh. Despite their outward appearances, Reautomata are constructs, not undead: their organic components operate more like machines than mere flesh. Such is the composition of a Reautomata that they fight on despite grievous injury, unflinching even as they are dismembered. Stopping a Reautomata necessitates mangling its body past the point of physical operation. Reautomata are ultimately brutal and decisive combatants that fight without regard for their personal well-being.
Created in Torment. Reautomata must be skilfully made by a master Reanimator using the finest components. It is essential the work begins on both a living and fully conscious individual. Typically, most apothecaries perform the work without anesthetic, instead opting to sever the vocal cords of their victims so as to not have their screams disturb the grim work involved. Limbs are removed and replaced, and metal is grafted into flesh and welded into the bone of the fully aware subject. Nervous tissue is pulled from the brain and distributed from the body, giving the construct nearly perfect proprioceptive awareness while excising unnecessary or superfluous brain tissues associated with cognitive functions. The process renders the Reautomata fully obedient, but not mindless.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Reautomata. Each successful check reveals one of the following pieces of information: (16+) Dispassionate Metal and Flesh. You are aware of the Reautomata's Relentless Endurance trait, as well as its damage and condition Immunities. (19+) Limb Weapons. You know of the Reautomata's Arm Blades and Entrapping Rend attacks. (21+) Focused Killer. You learn the Reautomata's Wisdom, Intelligence, and Charisma saving throws.
Combat Tactics Reautomata fight with outward ferocity and aggressive attacks which belie the cold, unfeeling calculation at the core of each soldier. In battle, Reautomata launch themselves towards their foes in great leaps, impaling their targets upon their rending arm blades. The rending blades flense into flesh and latch on like hooks, allowing the Reautomata to restrain their targets. They then use their great strength to rend apart their restrained victims. Reautomata unquestionably obey the orders of their creator and will fight until destroyed without regard for their own bodies. However, even with only general instructions, Reautomata fight intelligently and know how to utilize the environment to their advantage, making use of their climb speeds and jumping ability to prioritize dangerous targets.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Construct. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Brain. Bones: Skull, Spine. Natural Weapons: Blades. Hair: Stitches. Hide: Skin, Plates.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 208 -209 (Third Party)

monster.name: Reautomata Wrecker
monster.languages: Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The reautomata deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The reautomata makes one Drill attack and one Wrecking Ball attack.

action.name: Drill
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach 5 ft. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) Piercing damage.

action.name: Wrecking Ball
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach 20 ft. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) Bludgeoning damage. Strength Saving Throw: DC 20. Failure: The target has the Dazed condition (save ends) and the Prone condition.

action.name: Destructive Rampage (recharge 6)
action.text: The reautomata moves up to its Speed in a straight line, moving through the space of any Medium or smaller creature on its path. The first time its enters each creature's space during this move, it can make a Drill or Wrecking Ball attack against that creature.

action.name: Overdrive Engine (1/Day; Bloodied Only) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The reautomata's Destructive Rampage recharges, and it gains Immunity to all damage and conditions until the end of its next turn. For the duration, the reautomata automatically succeeds on all saving throws and Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution- based ability checks and has Advantage on attack rolls. It can't be forced to move or affected by spells of level 8 or lower unless it chooses to be. Features and effects that ignore Resistances and Immunities, such as a Vorpal Weapon, don't function against the reautomata unless those effects are caused by a level 9 spell or an artifact. At the end of its next turn, the reautomata dies and explodes. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 20, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the reautomata when it dies. Failure: 20 (8d4) Acid damage plus 36 (8d8) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage.

monster.description:
This monstrous construct is the size of an ogre. It lets out a low bellow like the droning cry of an approaching whale. Suddenly, it breaks into a charge like a thunderous rhinoceros, racing forward with uncanny speed despite its onerous bulk. It is covered in armored tanks with hoses attached to its head, directly into the ears, nose, mouth, neck which pump its body full of strange chemicals.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 211 (Third Party)

monster.name: Reborn Vladimir von Drakken (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 95 (10d8 + 50) + 95 (10d8 + 50) per player character.

trait.name: Ascendant Transformation
trait.text: When Vladimir von Drakken drops to 0 Hit Points, his body explodes in a shower of gore and he reappears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet as Ascendant Vladimir von Drakken. His Initiative doesn't change.

trait.name: Aura of Dread
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Vladimir von Drakken takes 21 (6d6) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Bloodthirsty
trait.text: Vladimir von Drakken has Advantage on attack rolls against a target with the Bloodied or Bleeding condition.

trait.name: Daywalker
trait.text: Vladimir von Drakken doesn't possess any Vampire Weaknesses.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Vladimir von Drakken regains 30 Hit Points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 Hit Point remaining.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: Vladimir von Drakken can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken always takes his turn on Initiative count 20. On his turn, Vladimir von Drakken can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or Bonus Action on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Vladimir von Drakken takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Bloodmourne
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach 5 ft. Hit: 27 (6d6 + 6) Force damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition (4d4). In addition, Vladimir von Drakken can apply one of the following martial maneuvers to the target: • Advance. Vladimir von Drakken pushes the target 15 feet, then moves up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target without provoking Opportunity Attacks. • Hamstring. The target has the Immobilized condition until the end of its next turn. • Overpower. The target has the Staggered condition until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach 5 ft. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 20).

action.name: Bite (1/round)
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 49 (14d6) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Weakened condition (DC 20 Constitution save ends). Vladimir von Drakken regains Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. A Humanoid killed by this damage rises on its next turn as a Vampire Spawn under Vladimir von Drakken's control.

action.name: Dominate (1/round)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature Vladimir von Drakken can see within 120 feet. Failure: The target has the Charmed condition until the end of its next turn. While Charmed, the target obeys Vladimir von Drakken's commands and can't take Reactions. Failure by 5 or More: The Charmed condition lasts 24 hours or until Vladimir von Drakken is reduced to 0 Hit Points. Each time the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. Success: The target has Disadvantage on its next attack roll against Vladimir von Drakken.

action.name: Wing Blast (1/round)
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 20, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from Vladimir von Drakken. Failure: 14 (4d6) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from Vladimir von Drakken and has the Prone condition. Failure or Success: Before or after using this Epic Action, Vladimir von Drakken can move up to half his Fly Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

action.name: Shadow Step (2/round)
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet that is in Dim Light or Darkness. He has Advantage on the next melee attack he makes before the end of this round.

action.name: Shape-shift (1/round)
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken shape-shifts into a Tiny bat (Speed 5 ft., Fly Speed 30 ft.) or a Medium cloud of mist (Speed 5 ft., Fly Speed 20 ft. [hover]), or he returns to his vampire form. Anything he is wearing transforms with him. While in bat or mist form, Vladimir von Drakken can't speak. His game statistics, other than his size and Speed, are unchanged, but he can't use Epic Actions other than Shape-Shift and Epic Resistance. While in mist form, Vladimir von Drakken can't speak or manipulate objects, and loses his Aura of Dread. He is weightless and can enter an enemy's space and stop there. If air can pass through a space, the mist can do so, but it can't pass through liquid. He has Resistance to all damage.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: Vladimir von Drakken chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. He can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

reaction.name: Spell-reflecting Strike
reaction.text: Trigger: Vladimir von Drakken makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses him. Response: Vladimir von Drakken can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) he can see within 120 feet of him. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of Vladimir von Drakken. If the spell forces a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

monster.description:
"None without this blood within may strike you down, and by this blood you shall not die." — Prophecy uttered during the Sanguine Rite
Vladimir von Drakken stands awash in mighty power. Standing nearly seven feet tall, he is armored head to toe in ornamented and blood-drenched plate mail. The breastplate bears the ancient sigil of House von Drakken. Draconic wings unfurl from his back, the membranes colored a deep red like a dying star. His snarling face has the chiseled features of a calculating predator. He growls, bearing his long, sharp fangs which dribble fresh blood around his perfectly trimmed salt-and-pepper beard. In a single hand, he holds a vicious greatsword, which he points towards you, issuing a mortal challenge.
This is Vladimir von Drakken's normal form, once he has regained his full strength. In this form, he is a cunning and strategic adversary.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. Vladimir speaks with vile overconfidence, a sinister smirk, and a demeanor of a creature who believes himself a god, he does not tolerate others treating him as any less than a king of kings. • Bond. Vladimir will stop at nothing to conquer the continent and reclaim his throne in Drakkenheim. He made it, and it is his to rule, any other who attempts to sit upon it is an imposter. • Ideal. "This realm belongs to the dead, and the dead shall keep it. Any who stand in the way of my reign will join my legions by choice, or by force." • Flaw. Vladimir believes himself entirely indestructible and is blind to the loopholes within the rites that created him. Nevertheless, he is hesitant to trust anyone. He refuses to let anyone get close and assumes everyone is plotting against him.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Religion gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine Vladimir von Drakken, learning the following based on the result: (15+) Deadly Foe. You know of the creature's Resistances and Immunities. (20+) Renowned Swordsman. You are aware of his Bloodmourne and Bite attacks. (25+) Nearly Undefeatable. You recognize his Reborn or Ascendent Transformation trait.
Combat Tactics Vladimir von Drakken is presented here in three forms. As the Ascendent Vampire grows in power he transforms into a new form until he returns to his full strength. If he is successfully resurrected with the Sanguine Rite, Vladimir von Drakken first begins in his Crypt-Starved form. He remains in this form until he consumes the blood of a living descendant of House von Drakken, which enables him to turn into his Reborn form. If reduced to 0 Hit Points in his Reborn form, Vladimir von Drakken unleashes his Ascendant form. In his Crypt-Starved form, Vladimir von Drakken is a craven and desperate combatant. He primarily aims to drink as much blood as possible using his Bite to transform into his Reborn form. He makes use of Shadow Step and Terrifying Glare to reposition himself and hold foes at bay. Once he regains his Reborn form, Vladimir von Drakken is nearly unstoppable. He wades into melee with Bloodmourne, demonstrating his martial superiority by using his manoeuvres. He uses his Claws and Bite as finishing moves and uses Dominate to bend his foes to his will. When surrounded, he uses Wing Blast to reposition. Assuming his Ascendant form, Vladimir von Drakken becomes an engine of bloodlust and destruction, fueled by primal rage and undead power. In this form, he rips foes apart with melee attacks and flays their spirits whenever his Soul Rend becomes available.
Slaying Vladimir von Drakken Vladimir cannot be fully destroyed unless he is wholly unmade at the place he was first transformed. Wholly destroying Vladimir von Drakken is difficult. Once he is defeated in combat, with the final blow struck by one who shares his blood, his heart must be cut out, and placed upon the altar within the Standing Stones in in the Brachenwald where he was transformed into a vampire.Under a full moon at midnight, a wooden stake made from a branch from Elenthas the Evertree must be driven through the heart by one of his blood descendants. Then, the heart must be left there until sunrise where it is destroyed by first light. Vladimir von Drakken's minions do not stand idly whilst this happens, and launch a massive assault upon the grove with the desperate aim of retrieving his heart before it is destroyed by the sun.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 262 -263 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ripper
monster.languages: Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Dismemberment
trait.text: Creatures killed by attacks made by the ripper can't be restored to life except by a Resurrection spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Feed On Fear
trait.text: Frightened creatures have the Helpless and Defenseless conditions against attacks made by the ripper.

trait.name: Insensitive to Pain
trait.text: Critical Hits against the ripper become normal hits.

action.name: Whirling Bonesaw
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) Slashing damage, and the ripper can immediately make another Whirling Bonesaw attack against the same target. This attack ignores Resistance and Immunity to Slashing damage.

action.name: Gory Display (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature that can see the ripper. Failure: 14 (4d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition (save ends). While Frightened, the target's Speed becomes 0 and can't increase.

reaction.name: Unstoppable Lurch
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature deals damage to the ripper. Response: The ripper moves up to half its Speed toward that creature without provoking Opportunity Attacks. If the ripper ends this movement within reach of the creature, it gains Advantage on its next attack roll against the creature.

monster.description:
This massive creature is made up of mutated, stitched-together body parts. The process of joining parts and intentional mutations has rendered the former patient into a mindless beast, nearly swallowed by its own growths. Its oversized arms carry a great whirling bone saw that spins and whirs as it lumbers forward, spraying gore and soaking its aprons in blood, bone, and grey matter. They wear a blood-soaked medical apron and mask.
Parts Collectors. Apothecaries stitch all manner of extra arms, hands, and limbs to their Rippers, which the creature uses to gather severed body parts and hold down subjects.
Fear Engine. The Ripper's tortured mind sympathetically responds when it senses a victim's fear and terror, but its twisted brain responds with adrenaline and bloodlust.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Ripper, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Occult Science Construct. You know of its Insensitive to Pain trait, as well as its damage and condition Immunities. (15+) Razor-Sharp Weapons. You recognize the Ripper's Whirling Bonesaw attack, and its Feed on Fear and Dismemberment traits. (20+) Formidable but Dim-Witted. You learn the Ripper's Constitution, Dexterity, and Intelligence saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Ripper is an unsubtle and unsophisticated combatant, but it can follow its creators' orders intelligently. Unless directed otherwise, a Ripper usually begins battle by using its Gory Display to terrify its victims. It then ponderously moves towards its chosen target before lowering its Saw Blade down, preferring Frightened targets to benefit from its Feed on Fear trait. During its turn, a Ripper continues attacking with its Saw Blade until it misses. If it reduces a target to 0 Hit Points, it does not stop making attacks until its target dies.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Construct. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Chemical Solution. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts. Bones: Skull, Spine. Natural Weapons: Blades, Claws. Hair: Stitches. Hide: Skin, Plates.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 213 (Third Party)

monster.name: River

trait.name: Academy Rings (1/Day)
trait.text: River can cast a spell from Spellcasting without expending a use of it.

action.name: Force Missile
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range 120 ft. Hit: 28 (8d6) Force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: River casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to spell attacks): At Will: Detect Magic, Find Familiar, Light, Mage Armor (included above), Mage Hand, Prestidigitation 2/Day Each: Detect Thoughts, Dimension Door, Dispel Magic, Identify, Invisibility (level 4 version), Sending 1/Day Each: Scrying, Telepathic Bond, Teleportation Circle

action.name: Misty Step (recharge 5–6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: River casts Misty Step using the spellcasting ability from Spellcasting.

reaction.name: River's Contingency
reaction.text: Trigger: River becomes Bloodied. Response: River casts Mislead and teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 30 feet.

monster.spells: detect magic, find familiar, light, mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, identify, invisibility, sending, scrying, telepathic bond, teleportation circle, misty step, mislead
monster.description:
River is a short tiefling woman in her late twenties. Her attire is practical and professional: a hip-length purple jacket with a high collar. Belted at her waist are several pouches and pockets. She wears five rings on her right hand. Two oddly-shaped dark brown horns sprout backwards from her flowing blue hair, creating the impression of two boats at sea. River has spotted brown skin and impish features: her teeth are too sharp, her tongue too long, and it's slightly unsettling when she smiles.
Roleplaying Traits • Personality Trait. I converse using precise academic terminology, but amongst those I trust as competent and capable, I inject a wry and sardonic sense of humor. • Ideal. I like people who are professional, deliver results, and don't ask questions. I cannot stand fools who waste my time with buffoonery, haggling, and excuses. • Bond. Eldrick Runeweaver is my mentor, teacher, and friend. I've worked alongside him for years, and any success he has will be mine as well. • Flaw. I grew up surrounded by the magical amenities of the Amethyst Academy, so I don't understand what life is like for those who had a more mundane upbringing.
Combat Tactics River is not a combatant and never initiates violence. If she is attacked or finds herself in the midst of conflict, her sole objective is survival. Her first action is always to cast either Dimension Door or Invisibility and flee. She won't take risks with her own life, even to fulfil a critical objective for the Amethyst Academy or save someone she cares about. However, she will take the opportunity to help another ally escape by using Invisibility on them or bringing them with her when she teleports.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 340 (Third Party)

monster.name: Royal Assassin
monster.skill: Acrobatics +8, Deception +8, Perception +9, Sleight of Hand +12, Stealth +12

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Studded Leather

trait.name: Death Strike
trait.text: When the assassin reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, the creature immediately dies.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The assassin makes three Poison Weapon attacks.

action.name: Poisoned Weapon
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) Poison damage. Once per turn, the assassin can apply one of the following additional effects to the target: • Silent Scream. Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target has the Bewildered condition (save ends). While Bewildered, the target is unable to speak. • Sap Strength. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition (save ends). While Poisoned, the target also has the Weakened condition. • Sluggish Sinews. Strength Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target has the Dazed condition (save ends). While Dazed, the target also has the Slowed condition.

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: The assassin takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

monster.description:
Dressed in black and red, with a large hood and mask concealing their face and a flourished cape trailing behind them, this assassin brandishes a series of poison-tipped throwing daggers. They are posed ready to strike.
Combat Tactics The Royal Assassins have a selection of potent poisons applied to their weaponry. They carefully prepare and select each dose for their intended targets. They use Silent Scream against spell- casters or when absolute quiet is needed, Sap Strength against warriors likely to put up stiff resistance of their own, and Sluggish Sinews against agile targets who may try to escape.
Queen's Men Combat Tactics Amongst the Queen's Men, different groups may be organized as infiltrators, thieves, saboteurs, and assassins, who work unseen until the moment they strike. In contrast, highway robbers and enforcers operate openly, trying to shakedown and intimidate their marks to give up any valuables without a fight. Regardless, members of the Queen's Men are seldom willing to stick around when a fight starts going against them, valuing their own lives first and foremost.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 349 -350 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sanctified Knight

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Longsword, Plate

trait.name: Sanctified By Falling Fire
trait.text: When the knight dies, its soul is pulled into the delerium crystal embedded in its chest.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The knight makes three Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) Slashing damage if wielded with two hands, plus 9 (2d8) Radiant damage.

action.name: Lay on Hands (3/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The knight touches another creature. The target regains 11 (2d8 + 2) Hit Points and is cured of one disease or the Poisoned condition.

reaction.name: Deny the Witch (3/Day)
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature the knight can see within 60 feet of it casts a spell. Response: If the spell is level 3 or lower, the spell fails, but no resources are wasted.

monster.description:
Clad in plate armor and carrying a longsword, the Sanctified Knight's delerium shard embedded in their chest glows through their armor as they protect the pilgrims from any threats.
Falling Fire Combat Tactics Falling Fire pilgrims give up their possessions and wealth and often carry very little on them. For the most part, common Falling Fire devotees are not equipped to fight. Most members try to avoid combat. Preferring a peaceful approach, they are more reactionary in their tactics and hope most situations do not come to bloodshed. However, Drakkenheim is a dangerous city, and monsters and bandits have attempted to thwart the efforts of the devout worshippers often. Pilgrims have been known to take up clubs, daggers, and any mundane weapons they can find to defend themselves, and often groups of traveling pilgrims are accompanied by armored zealots and spellcasting divine leaders who are ready to protect their flock.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 342 -346 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sanctified Monk

trait.name: Sanctified By Falling Fire
trait.text: When the monk dies, its soul is pulled into the delerium crystal embedded in its chest.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The monk makes three Unarmed Strike attacks or five Dart attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range 20/60 ft. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage.

action.name: Flame Step (Bonus Action)
action.text: The monk teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet that is in Bright Light. It gains Advantage on its next melee attack.

monster.description:
Dressed in simple white tunics and loose trousers, these monks have sworn themselves to the Faith of the Falling Fire and have taken the Sacrament, pulling divine energy from within themselves and using it to channel their martial arts and combat capabilities.
Falling Fire Combat Tactics Falling Fire pilgrims give up their possessions and wealth and often carry very little on them. For the most part, common Falling Fire devotees are not equipped to fight. Most members try to avoid combat. Preferring a peaceful approach, they are more reactionary in their tactics and hope most situations do not come to bloodshed. However, Drakkenheim is a dangerous city, and monsters and bandits have attempted to thwart the efforts of the devout worshippers often. Pilgrims have been known to take up clubs, daggers, and any mundane weapons they can find to defend themselves, and often groups of traveling pilgrims are accompanied by armored zealots and spellcasting divine leaders who are ready to protect their flock.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 342 -345 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sanctified Soul

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Breastplate, Quarterstaff

trait.name: Sanctified By Falling Fire
trait.text: When the sanctified soul dies, its soul is pulled into the delerium crystal embedded in its chest.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) Bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Guiding Bolt
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range 120 ft. Hit: 14 (4d6) Radiant damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The sanctified soul casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to spell attacks): At Will: Light, Thaumaturgy 2/Day Each: Faerie Fire, Flame Strike 1/Day Each: Wall of Fire

reaction.name: Flash of Light
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature the sanctified soul can see makes an attack roll. Response: The sanctified soul imposes Disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.spells: thaumaturgy, faerie fire, flame strike, wall of fire
monster.description:
Wearing no symbols of their faith, and dressed simply, the glow of their delerium shard embedded in their chest glows through their robes signifying their dedication to the Falling Fire. Carrying a book in one hand and speaking passages of the Falling Fire, Sanctified Souls gather flocks of pilgrims before them.
Falling Fire Combat Tactics Falling Fire pilgrims give up their possessions and wealth and often carry very little on them. For the most part, common Falling Fire devotees are not equipped to fight. Most members try to avoid combat. Preferring a peaceful approach, they are more reactionary in their tactics and hope most situations do not come to bloodshed. However, Drakkenheim is a dangerous city, and monsters and bandits have attempted to thwart the efforts of the devout worshippers often. Pilgrims have been known to take up clubs, daggers, and any mundane weapons they can find to defend themselves, and often groups of traveling pilgrims are accompanied by armored zealots and spellcasting divine leaders who are ready to protect their flock.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 342 -346 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sanguine Witch

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The vampire regains 10 Hit Points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 Hit Point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes Radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Forbiddance
trait.text: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

trait.name: Harmed By Running Water
trait.text: The vampire takes 20 Acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.

trait.name: Stake to the Heart
trait.text: If a Piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is Incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is Paralyzed until the stake is removed.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
trait.text: The vampire takes 20 Radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The vampire makes two attacks and uses Feast, if available. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Blood Drain
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: 21 (5d6 +4) Necrotic damage, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. The target has the Weakened condition (DC 15 Constitution save ends).

action.name: Feast (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the vampire. Failure: 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage plus 14 (4d6) Psychic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The vampire regains Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The vampire casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to spell attacks): At Will: Mage Armor (included above) 2/Day Each: Darkness, Fear, Hold Person, Inflict Wounds, Ray of Enfeeblement, Suggestion 1/Day: Bestow Curse, Dominate Person, Hypnotic Pattern, Vampiric Touch

reaction.name: Arcane Denial
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature the vampire can see within 60 feet casts a spell of level 3 or lower. Response—Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: The spell fails, but no resources are wasted.

monster.spells: mage armor, darkness, fear, hold person, inflict wounds, ray of enfeeblement, suggestion, bestow curse, dominate person, hypnotic pattern, vampiric touch
monster.description:
These creatures are draped in funeral dresses with blood stains and tears. Veils are drawn over their faces, hiding their features, but one can still make out the glowing red eyes and glistening fangs. Their spindly bony fingers twitch and flick as crackling unholy energy sparks and ignites around them.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Religion or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine a Sanguine Witch, learning the following based on the result: (5+) Unnatural Resistances. You recognize the creature's damage Resistances and Immunities. (10+) Siphon Vitality. You learn of the creature's Feast action. (15+) Arcane Caster. You know the creature possesses formidable spellcasting abilities.
Combat Tactics The Sanguine Witch uses Darkness to hide themselves and attempt to enthrall subjects with Hold Person before using Feast to feed on them. The witch's goal is to create thralls of their opponents. If the Sanguine Witch is in direct sunlight, or at less than half their Hit Points, they attempt to flee.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Undead Animus. Fluid: Monster Blood. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Undead Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 252 -253 (Third Party)

monster.name: Scrap Reautomata
monster.languages: Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Combustion
trait.text: While the reautomata has the Burning condition, its Speed becomes 50 feet and its melee weapon attacks deal an extra 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The reautomata makes two attacks.

action.name: Rusty Weapon
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

action.name: Ignition (recharges After a Short Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The reautomata has the Burning condition (2d6 Fire).

monster.description:
This zombie has been hastily enhanced, using scrap plating and arcane instrumentation. Rusted weapons and haphazard metal are grafted into its body.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 210 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sentient Planetoid
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Beyond Space and Time
trait.text: The sentient planetoid always acts on Initiative count 20. Additionally, it can't be moved, teleported, or sent to another plane of existence against its will.

trait.name: Gravitational Pull
trait.text: The sentient planetoid exerts its own force of gravity in a 100-foot Emanation. A creature that starts its turn in the Emanation falls towards the sentient planetoid, taking falling damage as appropriate if it collides with the planetoid. A creature can make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, avoiding the fall on a success.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The sentient planetoid is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The sentient planetoid has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sentient planetoid makes four attacks, only one of which can be an Unfathomable Knowledge attack.

action.name: Unfathomable Knowledge
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +14, reach 5 ft. or range 250 ft. Hit: 39 (6d12) Psychic damage, and the target has the Addled and Weakened conditions until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Crashing Comet
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +14, range 150 ft. Hit: 27 (6d8) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Burning condition (3d8 Fire).

action.name: All-knowing Magic (recharge 5–6)
action.text: The sentient planetoid casts any spell of level 5 or lower, using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell save DC 22, +14 to spell attacks).

monster.description:
The surface of the planet drifting before you suddenly begins to swirl and shift, mirroring the human features of a face within the canyons and ridges of its form. A telepathic voice booms in your ears as it leers at you with a cold stare glistening with curiosity and mild disdain.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Sentient Planetoid, learning the following based on the result. (10+) Mental Fortress. You are aware of the creature's Resistances and Immunities. (15+) Panoptic Arcanist. You learn of the creature's AllKnowing Magic action. (20+) Unfathomable Strength. You know the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics Sentient Planetoids are not all hostile creatures. Some of them, who have knowledge of mortals, deem them a pest or a problem, especially if traversing the Space Between Worlds. Like a mortal who finds a rat in their home, a sentient planetoid will attempt to remove the creature or kill it. Some planetoids might wish to converse with mortals, wanting to learn information from them about simple concepts of mundane life, or ask questions they think a mortal would know, only to confuse them with esoteric concepts and broad ideas of the universe. This can sometimes frustrate a planetoid who may react by simply wanting to eradicate the creature who bothered it.
Harvestable Components (Legendary) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor. Hide: Plates. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 323 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sewer Thing

trait.name: Instinctive Ambusher
trait.text: At the start of the sewer thing's first turn of each combat, if the sewer thing attacks a creature, it can make one additional Tendril Lash attack as part of its Multiattack action.

trait.name: Poison Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the sewer thing takes Poison damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Poison damage dealt.

trait.name: Toxic Aura
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the sewer thing is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12. Failure: 5 (1d10) Poison damage.

trait.name: Unexpected Appearance
trait.text: If the sewer thing is motionless at the start of combat, it has Advantage on its Initiative roll. Additionally, if a creature hasn't observed the sewer thing move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the sewer thing is animate.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sewer thing makes two attacks and uses Engulf.

action.name: Tendril Lash
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 30 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 16).

action.name: Reel
action.text: The sewer thing pulls each creature Grappled by it up to 20 feet straight toward it.

action.name: Engulf
action.text: The sewer thing engulfs a Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of it that is Grappled by it. The grapple ends. The target has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, is suffocating, and is subjected to the following effect at the start of each of the sewer thing's turns. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 11 (2d10) Poison damage plus 11 (2d10) Acid damage. If the sewer thing moves, the target moves with it. The sewer thing can have up to four creatures engulfed at a time. An engulfed creature can take an action to escape with a successful DC 16 Strength (Athletics) check, landing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the sewer thing.

monster.description:
The murky sewer waters churn as something below the surface stirs. A mass of debris, algae, and waste slowly rises from the water, and a sloping mass of sewage emerges with a gurgling hiss. Before you, a great shambling form launches towards you, grasping with its writhing tendrils, moving through sewage with surprising speed.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival gains Advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks to Study a Sewer Thing, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Resilient Plant. You know it's creature type, Resistances, and Immunities (10+) Poisonous Engulfer. You learn of the creature's Poison Absorption and Engulf features. (15+) Sense of Self. You understand the creature's Wisdom and Charisma ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Sewer Thing waits for the opportune moment to strike. It lets creatures approach, appearing as plant matter over some sewer debris. Once its prey is close, it springs to life, lashing out with its tendrils at any it has surprised, attempting to Engulf them. This tactic works well if it is in water or sewage, where it can pull victims beneath the surface. The Sewer Thing starts combat attempting to Engulf surprised targets. Once a creature is Engulfed, the Sewer Thing retreats into the sewer water and flees. It is a hunter, consuming its prey by dissolving them inside of it. Once it has its food, it has no reason to stay and fight.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Plant. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze, Venom, Sap. Organs: Flowers, Flesh. Natural Weapons: Tentacles. Hair: Leaves. Dust: Plant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 74 (Third Party)

monster.name: Shardmaul Manticore

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The manticore makes two Claw attacks and one Stinger attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Slashing damage. If the manticore flies 30+ feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target has the Prone condition and the manticore can make a Bite attack against it as a Bonus Action.

action.name: Stinger
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 20 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: 24 (7d6) Necrotic damage. Failure by 5 or More: The target also gains one Contamination level. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Wing Shards (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the manticore (flying creatures have Disadvantage). Failure: 28 (8d6) Piercing damage, and if the target is flying, it has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

monster.description:
Swooping above on thick leathery wings is a large lion-like predator with a disturbingly human head contorted into an expression of fury. Its body bristles in a thicket of crystalline quills that painfully jut out through its mane, along its wing-tips, and down its spine. It has a long, chitinous tail ending in a cluster of wicked stingers. Each begins as a spike of blackened bone but ends as a glittering delerium shard.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Shardmaul Manticore, learning the following based on their result: (10+) Mutated Manticore. You're aware the creature has no special Resistances or Immunities but is a capable flier. (15+) Death From Above. You recognize the manticore's Stinger and Wing Shards attacks. (25+) Strong, Fast, and Tough. You learn the manticore's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Shardmaul Manticore attacks from above, choosing whichever target looks weakest and the least armored. It descends from above suddenly, making Bite and Claw attacks against the weakest prey it detects. After its first descent, it lifts off again, using Wing Shards to cover its ascent. It then repeats its attack pattern. A Shardmaul Manticore is bold enough to attack when outnumbered but typically flees if it faces stiff opposition that reduces it to half its Hit Points or fewer.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws, Needles. Hair: Fur. Hide: Skin, Webbed Membrane.
Delerium: The quills on its body are made of delerium and may be harvestable: 1d6 – 2 delerium fragments can be collected from its quills (minimum 0).
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 75 (Third Party)

monster.name: Silver Order Cavalier

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Javelin (3), Lance, Shield, Splint Armor

trait.name: Holy Weapons
trait.text: When the cavalier hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 9 (2d8) Radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Skilled Rider
trait.text: While mounted, the cavalier can force an attack that targets its mount to target the cavalier instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cavalier makes two attacks.

action.name: Lance
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7 (with Disadvantage against a target within 5 feet), reach 10 ft. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) Force damage plus 9 (2d8) Radiant damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Force damage plus 9 (2d8) Radiant damage.

action.name: Summon Steed (1/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The cavalier magically summons a Griffon, which appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the cavalier and obeys its commands. The steed takes its turn immediately before or after the cavalier. It remains until it or the cavalier dies, or the cavalier dismisses it as a Bonus Action.

monster.description:
Garbed in heavy armor with blue capes lined in silver trim, embroidered with the symbol of the Silver Order, the paladin's helmet has a large blue plume. A quiver of javelins rests upon their back.
Combat Tactics What the Silver Order lacks in subtlety they make up for with sheer force. They are a military organization, and their soldiers are well trained and work together as a team. When they tackle problems, they do so in a uniform fashion, knowing when to rely on one another, complete tasks and make pushes in unison. The Silver Order has simple call signs, hand signals, commands, and strategies that they can rely on in the field. Silver Order knights and paladins should work as a cohesive unit who know their strengths and how to protect their weaknesses. Any Silver Order regiment is accompanied by at least one paladin or Flamekeeper, and usually at least one of each. Larger organized military missions will see griffon riders as well as entire units of paladins and several Flamekeepers or Pyre Priests. This means that no Silver Order unit is without moderate healing, protective buffs, and often forms of divination and holy battle magic. When push comes to shove, the order's divine spellcasters tend to have a few Fireballs and Flamestrikes amongst their options.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 353 -356 (Third Party)

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Javelins (3), Longsword, Plate

trait.name: Holy Weapons
trait.text: When the paladin hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 9 (2d8) Radiant damage (included in the attack).

action.text: The paladin makes two attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Force damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) Force damage if wielded with two hands, plus 9 (2d8) Radiant damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Force damage plus 9 (2d8) Radiant damage.

action.name: Lay on Hands (3/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The paladin touches another creature. The target regains 11 (2d8 + 2) Hit Points and is cured of one disease or the Poisoned condition.

reaction.name: Deny the Witch (3/Day)

monster.name: Silver Order Recruit

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Breastplate, Longsword, Quiver (20 Arrows), Shield, Shortbow

trait.name: For the Flame! (3/Day)
trait.text: The recruit can take an additional Multiattack action on its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The recruit makes two attacks using its Longsword or Shortbow in any combination.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) Slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range 80/320 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: The target is pushed 5 feet away from the recruit and has the Staggered condition (save ends).

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Trigger: The recruit is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. Response: The recruit adds 2 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

monster.name: Silver Order Squire

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Quiver (20 Arrows), Shield, Shortbow, Shortsword, Studded Leather

trait.name: For the Flame! (1/Day)
trait.text: The squire can take an additional Multiattack action on its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The squire makes two attacks.

action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow

action.name: Helping Hand

reaction.name: Look Out! Trigger
reaction.text: An ally within 5 feet of the squire is hit by an attack. Response: The squire takes the attack's damage instead.

monster.description:
Dressed in leathers, and carrying a short sword, shield, and shortbow, the young squire hefts a small backpack of gear for maintaining and patching armor and weapons, griffon care, ammunition, and other essentials that may be needed on the field. They are eager to serve, and to prove themselves in battle.

monster.name: Skeleton Archer

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Longbow, Quiver (10 Arrows)

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

action.name: Chillsteel Longbow
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Cold damage. Critical Hit: The target has the Frozen condition (DC 10).

action.name: Steady Aim (Bonus Action)
action.text: The skeleton archer grants itself Advantage on its next ranged attack roll this turn. It can use this Bonus Action only if it hasn't moved during this turn, and after it uses this Bonus Action, its Speed becomes 0 and can't increase until the end of this turn.

monster.description:
Ancient bones draped in rusted armor scraps rise up with unholy magic. Baring old weapons, they brandish their spears and charge toward you.
Soft blue light glows in the eye sockets of this skeleton, who carries a bow made from bone and ancient sinew. Shards of frost form on its arrow tip as it takes aim.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Religion or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine a skeleton, learning the following based on the result: (5+) Unnatural Resistances. You recognize the creature's Immunities. (10+) Deathly Violence. You know the creature's basic attacks and Bonus Actions. (15+) Unliving Abilities. You learn the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics These skeleton warriors are mindless foot soldiers in the wars of vampires. They march into battle with no care. They feel no pain. They only follow their orders and fight to the death on behalf of their vampiric masters.
Harvestable Components (Common) Animus: Undead. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Dust: Undead Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 254 -255 (Third Party)

monster.name: Skeleton Mage

action.name: Fire Lance
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) Fire damage, and the target has the Burning condition (1d10 Fire).

action.name: Shocking Arc

action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from the skeleton mage. Failure: 13 (3d8) Thunder damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the skeleton mage. Success: Half damage only.

action.name: Teleport (Bonus Action)
action.text: The skeleton mage teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet.

Harvestable Components (Common) Animus: Undead. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Dust: Undead Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 254 -255 (Third Party)

monster.name: Skeleton Soldier

trait.name: Gear
trait.text: Shield, Spear

action.name: Poison-tipped Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Poison damage.

action.name: Shield Slam (Bonus Action)
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 13, one creature within 5 feet of the skeleton soldier. Failure: The target is pushed 5 feet away from the skeleton soldier and has the Prone condition.

monster.description:
Ancient bones draped in rusted armor scraps rise up with unholy magic. Baring old weapons, they brandish their spears and charge toward you.
This robust skeleton warrior is caked in mud and moss, it wears a skull cap, a single shoulder pauldron, and holds a thick rusted shield emblazoned with the arcane sigil of House von Drakken. In one hand it carries a long poison-tipped spear.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Religion or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine a skeleton, learning the following based on the result: (5+) Unnatural Resistances. You recognize the creature's Immunities. (10+) Deathly Violence. You know the creature's basic attacks and Bonus Actions. (15+) Unliving Abilities. You learn the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics These skeleton warriors are mindless foot soldiers in the wars of vampires. They march into battle with no care. They feel no pain. They only follow their orders and fight to the death on behalf of their vampiric masters.
