monster.name: Skin Crawler

trait.name: Amorphous Form
trait.text: The skin crawler can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skin crawler makes two Claw attacks and one Bind attack.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) Slashing damage.

action.name: Bind
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 15 (3d8 + 2) Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 12). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition and Disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the skin crawler can't Bind another target.

action.name: Crush and Consume (Bonus Action)
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 12, one creature Grappled by the skin crawler. Failure: 10 (3d6) Bludgeoning damage, and the skin crawler regains an equal number of Hit Points. If this damage kills the target, the skin crawler assumes its form. The skin crawler's game statistics are the same in each form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster.description:
Out of the shadows you hear a sloping and squishing sound like someone dragging raw meat across the ground. The first thing you see are two arms reaching out from the darkness, the flesh sagging and drooping. The hands grasp the ground and slowly pull the creature forward revealing a squished pile of flesh resembling a human body without bones, organs, or muscle: simply a bag of skin that drags itself across the ground. Its empty eye holes and open mouth hang agape from its flopped over head, its legs dragging behind it as it pulls closer to you. It lets out a low guttural moan as it grasps towards you, hungry to fill itself with your insides.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Medicine gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks to Study a Skin Crawler, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Unrestrained Undead. You recognize the Skin Crawler's creature type, Resistances, and Immunities. (10+) Squeezing Death. You are aware of its Crush and Consume Bonus Action. (15+) Deathly Aware. You learn of the Skin Crawler's mental ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Skin Crawler is a mindless creature. It is nothing but animated flesh seeking to consume. If it senses a living creature nearby, it crawls towards it with total disregard for its own life. It only wants to bind the living and squeeze them to death while slowly devouring their flesh, consuming it into itself. A Skin Crawler is too focused to flee and continues to attempt to devour a target until either it or their target is dead.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Undead. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor. Natural Weapons: Claws. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Undead Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 76 (Third Party)

monster.name: Skinwing

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The skinwing has Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the skinwing's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

trait.name: Disturbing Bleating
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the skinwing is subjected to the following effect. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: The target has the Staggered condition until the start of its next turn. Success: The target is immune to the Disturbing Bleating of all skinwings for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skinwing makes one Bite attack and one Talons attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

monster.description:
A flock of hairless, winged creatures, each roughly the size of a large dog, circle overhead. Each is a grotesque patchwork of various animals melded together through unspeakable magical experiments. Their bloated bodies are made from combinations of pigs, goats, and sheep torsos. Their featherless wings are poorly structured with visible bones and thin, tearing skin. Each has a ram-shaped head with mismatched, bulging eyes and twisted horns; the nose and mouth have been replaced with a curved avian beak, each disturbingly filled with rows of irregular teeth and leaking a foul, sticky saliva. The monsters move with an awkward gait, their strained bodies supported by sturdy but mismatched donkey legs, and forelimbs which end in a hodgepodge digits with different claws, talons, and claws.
Study The Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Skinwing, learning the following based on the result: (15+) Flying Packs. You know the Skinwing's Pack Tactics trait. (20+) Muddled Mind. You learn the Skinwing's Dexterity, Intelligence, and Charisma ability scores.
Combat Tactics Skinwings look for opportunities to gang up on a single target, relying on their Pack Tactics to swarm and overpower an enemy.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts. Bones: Skull, Spine. Natural Weapons: Claws, Teeth. Hair: Fur, Stitches. Hide: Skin, Webbed Membrane.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 214 (Third Party)

monster.name: Skretch

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skretch makes two attacks.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) Piercing damage.

action.name: Spittle
action.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range 120/300 ft., one target directly underneath the skretch. Hit: 15 (6d4) Acid damage

action.name: Expel Waste (recharge 5–6)
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 10-foot radius Sphere directly beneath the skretch. Failure: 20 (8d4) Acid damage, and the target has the Burning condition (4d4 Acid). Each time the target takes damage from this condition, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or gain one Contamination level. Success: Half damage only.

monster.description:
A looming avian creature perches on the rooftop above, its body cloaked in dirty, ragged feathers. It curiously regards you with its two featherless heads, each borne on a long, crooked neck. Each head has large, round, bulging eyes and a hooked beak that drips corrosive saliva which hisses as it strikes the ground. The bird launches from its perch, opening its broad wings and short, fan- shaped tail, revealing a hanging, bloated belly that shudders with whatever half-digested contents rot within.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they Study a Skretch, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Flying Scavenger. You recognize it may be possible to distract it with meat, offal, or strong-smelling food. (10+) Acidic Vomit. You learn of the Skretch's Expel Waste and Spittle actions. (15+) Dextrous and Sturdy. You recognize the creature's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Skretches keep to high perches and observe potential prey before attacking. A Skretch prefers to attack targets that are visibly injured, weakened, or otherwise vulnerable. Once it finds a suitable quarry, a Skretch circles their prey overhead pelting them with Spittle while waiting for their Expel Waste to recharge. Since its attacks require the Skretch to be directly overhead its target, they prefer to keep well above their targets to avoid any projectiles or ranged attacks. A Skretch never enters close combat willingly. If it is engaged up close, it uses the Disengage action to flee. As lazy scavengers, a Skretch doesn't pursue its prey very far or into buildings and flees if reduced to half its Hit Points or fewer.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Acidic Bile. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Guts, Glands. Bones: Skull, Spine. Hair: Feathers. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 77 (Third Party)

monster.name: Speaking Skull

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the skull remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary humanoid skull.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage.

action.name: Disparaging Remarks
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 12, one creature the skull can see within 10 feet. Failure: 5 (2d4) Psychic damage, and the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Guiding Words
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature the skull can see within 10 feet makes an ability check. Response: The target can roll 1d4 and add the result to that check.

monster.description:
Resting on the apothecary's desk, amidst vials, surgical implements, and scattered anatomical notes tomes is a skull, ordinary at first glance. It lies motionless — but then it begins to stir, hovering an inch above the wooden surface. Its eye sockets, dark and hollow, seem to fix on you, its bony grin frozen in a sinister smirk. The skull begins to speak, its voice a chilling murmur. " You're not one of the doctor's patients…" it hisses. " You should not be here…"
Player Character Familiars Subject to GM approval, an apothecary with the Laboratory Assistant esoteric theory can create a Helpful Hand or Speaking Skull to serve them using the Find Familiar spell. A familiar created in this manner always acts in combat immediately after its creator's turn. It can use its special attacks in its stat block only if the apothecary uses a Bonus Action on their turn to command the familiar to take one of those actions.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 193 (Third Party)

monster.name: Spell Leech

trait.name: Aquatic Camouflage
trait.text: The leech has Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in aquatic terrain.

trait.name: Spell Glands
trait.text: The leech has a spell gland, which can store up to ten levels of spells. When encountered, roll 1d10 to determine how many spell levels it has stored.

action.name: Attach
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach 0 ft. Hit: The leech attaches to the target. While attached, the leech doesn't attack, and moves with the target, using none of the leech's movement. The leech can detach itself using 5 feet of movement, and detaches immediately if its spell bags are filled or if the target dies. A creature within 5 feet can take an action to detach the leech with a successful DC 13 Wisdom (Medicine) check. Failure: The leech is still detached, but the target has the Bleeding condition (2d4). Failure by 5 or More: The leech isn't detached and the target takes 8 (2d4 + 3) Piercing damage.

action.name: Spell Drain (Bonus Action)
action.text: The leech can use this Bonus Action only when it is attached to a creature. The attached creature is subjected to the following effect. Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 13. Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Bewildered condition until the start of the leech's next turn. If the target has spell slots, the leech drains one randomly determined spell slot which can be no higher than level 3. It then fills its spell glands with the same number of spell levels.

action.name: Arcane Transfusion (Bonus Action)
action.text: The leech can use this Bonus Action only when it is attached to a creature and has at least one level worth of spells in its Spell Glands. The leech empties any number of spell levels from its Spell Glands, and the creature it is attached to regains an equal number of spell levels worth of spell slots.

monster.description:
The black, plump wriggling form of the leech squirms and crawls. Its oily, slick skin is wet and slippery. It lets out a high-pitched screech as it lunges towards its prey.
It is well understood by apothecaries, particularly Mutagenists, how arcane magical talents are the result of a nascent genetic trait borne in the blood. As such, Mutagenist apothecaries often experiment with blood and tissue samples taken from mageborn, hoping to discover the ways to enhance existing magical talents, or even imbue those without the inborn capacity for magic with spellcasting ability. Thus far, the best results have been either disastrous or temporary. Nevertheless, one result is the Spell Leech.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a leech, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Quick Swimmers. You know the leech's Swim speed and senses. (15+) Arcane Ingestion. You recognize the Spell Leech's Spell Drain.
Combat Tactics Leeches attempt to get close to a target to Bite and Attach to them. They do not retreat, as they are driven by their basic need to feed on the blood of others and nothing else.
Harvestable Components (Uncommon) Animus: Monstrosity. Fluid: Monster Blood, Goopy Ooze, Mucus. Organs: Brain, Guts. Natural Weapons: Mandibles. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 204 -205 (Third Party)

monster.name: Spined Dreg

trait.text: The dreg climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Spiny Body
trait.text: Any creature grappling the dreg or Grappled by it takes 5 (1d10) Piercing damage at the end of that creature's turn

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Haze Adaptation
trait.text: This creature may benefit from a Long Rest finished within the Haze. It can see twice as far through the Haze mists and Deep Haze fog as those without this adaption.

trait.name: Haze Dependence
trait.text: This creature gains one level of Exhaustion for every 24 hours it spends outside the Haze. These Exhaustion levels cannot be removed while the creature is outside the Haze.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As a Utilize action, a monster can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dreg makes three Spike attacks.

action.name: Spike
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft., or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage. Critical Hit: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 10. Failure: The target gains one level of Contamination

monster.description:
Long barbs of protruding overgrown bone and encrusted shards of delerium burst forth from the emaciated body of this Dreg, covering its spine and spindly limbs. Its cheek bones push through the flesh of its gaunt face, and its octarine-warped eyes shimmer with an unnatural glow. Its elongated fingers and toes similarly end in sharp, lengthy spikes.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study a Spined Dreg, learning the following based on their result: (5+) Spined Form. You are aware of the Spined Dreg's speeds, as well as its Spider Climb and Spiny Body traits. (10+) Launched Spines. You recognize the Dreg's Spike attack. (15+) Cunning and Agile. You understand the Dreg's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics Due to its agile nature and inherent Climb speed, the Spined Dreg prefers vantage points on low roofs or second stories of ruined buildings. It tends to avoid openly traversing the streets, and usually attacks from a distance or to leap down upon its enemies and grapple them. They will climb up walls to escape if reduced below half their Hit Points and outnumbered.
Harvestable Components (Common) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Claws, Needles. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 102 (Third Party)

monster.name: Star Warden

trait.name: Cosmic Aura
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the star warden is subjected to the following effect. Charisma Saving Throw: DC 17. Failure: The target is hurled through time and space, witnessing every moment of existence in a single second. It takes 17 (5d6) Psychic damage and is teleported to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet.

trait.name: Lords of Time and Space
trait.text: When the star warden is reduced to 0 Hit Points, roll a d20. On a 1 or 20, the star warden regains all of its Hit Points and another creature of its choice within 30 feet is reduced to 0 Hit Points instead.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The star warden makes two attacks.

action.name: Staff of Stars
action.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. or range 60/120 ft. Hit: 22 (5d6 + 4) Radiant damage plus 10 (3d6) Force damage.

action.name: Nebulae Grasp
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 4) Piercing damage, and the star warden can teleport the target to an unoccupied space the star warden can see within 120 feet.

action.name: Stardust
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: 18 (4d6 + 4) Radiant damage and the target has the Burning condition (4d6 Radiant).

action.name: The Cold Void of Space (Bonus Action)
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature within 120 feet of the star warden that teleported this turn. Failure: The target has the Frozen condition. Success: 10 (3d6) Cold damage.

reaction.name: Outside Time and Space
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature hits the star warden with an attack. Response: The star warden switches places with another creature within 30 feet, and the attack hits that creature instead.

monster.description:
A massive twelve-foot-tall creature stands before you draped in ragged and tattered cloth. The cloth covers its form except for four gnarled and gangly gray arms. Its twisted hands end in four long fingers. They clutch a wooden staff that sparkles with radiating cosmic energy. Two spindly gray legs stick out from under the cloak exposing three-toed feet. Its hunched form leans its weight onto the staff. The bulbous mass of cloth implies a massive head below the cloak, tilted forward. The cloth is filled with writhing tentacles, which dangle out from its depths, poking and prodding about.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Star Warden, learning the following based on the result. (10+) Mentally Tough. You know the creature's Immunities. (15+) Transposition. You recognize the creature's Outside Time and Space Reaction. (20+) Otherworldly Intellect. You learn the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics Star wardens exist in multiple times and dimensions at once. A creature that tries to fight a star warden is at a loss for where and how the star warden exists before it. Both the Star Warden and the creatures facing it are constantly shifted around the battlefield, unable to grasp their sense of reality. The Star Warden uses its Outside Time and Space Reaction to let two creatures attack one another instead of landing a blow upon itself. It can force the truth of all reality into a creature's mind or have it experience the cold vastness of space. Star Wardens are clever and always flee a losing fight.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Aberration. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Goopy Ooze, Mucus. Organs: Guts, Glands, Flesh. Natural Weapons: Tentacles. Hide: Skin. Dust: Aberrant Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 320 -321 (Third Party)

monster.name: Stitcher
monster.languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Hold Still, Please
trait.text: The stitcher has Advantage on attack rolls against a Grappled, Immobilized, or Slowed creature

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The stitcher makes two Scissorhand attacks and one Sewing Needle attack. It can replace any of these attacks with Attach Limb.

action.name: Scissorhand
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 10 ft. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) Slashing damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition (4d4).

action.name: Sewing Needle
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 10 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17. Failure: The target has a body part bound and sewn up (stitcher's choice): • Eyes. The target has the Blinded condition. • Mouth. The target cannot speak and cannot cast spells with a verbal component. • Limbs. The target has the Restrained condition. A creature within 5 feet can take an action to remove the threads with a successful DC 17 Wisdom (Medicine) check, ending the effect. Failure: The threads are removed but the target takes 11 (2d10) Slashing damage. Failure by 5 or More: The target takes 11 (2d10) Slashing damage and the threads aren't removed.

action.name: Attach Limb
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature the stitcher can see within 10 feet (Grappled, Slowed, Restrained, Incapacitated, and Immobilized creatures have Disadvantage). Failure: The target makes a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On a success, it controls the limb until the start of its next turn. Otherwise, the limb is uncontrolled for the same duration. The target suffers one of the following effects depending on the attached limb: h Head. While controlled, the target has Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma-based D20 Tests. While uncontrolled, the target can control its action or its movement on its turn, but the head controls the other. On a failure by 5 or more, the head chooses which to control instead of the target. h Arm. While controlled, the target can take an extra action on its turn, choosing from the Attack (one weapon attack only) or Utilize actions. While uncontrolled, the extra arm makes one melee weapon attack against the target at the start of its turn. The arm has a +9 attack bonus and deals 14 (3d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage on a hit. h Leg. While controlled, the target can take an extra action on its turn, choosing from the Dash or Disengage actions. While uncontrolled, the leg forces the target to move up to its Speed in a random direction at the start of its turn. If this movement forces the target toward a hazard or precipice, the host can repeat the saving throw. On a successful save, it stops its movement and has the Prone condition before entering the hazard. An attached limb can be attacked (AC 20, 20 Hit Points, Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage). A creature within 5 feet can take an action to remove the limb with a successful DC 17 Wisdom (Medicine) check or DC 15 Strength check. When removed by any means other than a successful Wisdom (Medicine) check, the target takes 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage and has the Bleeding condition (4d4).

monster.description:
The creature before you has an oversized clawed hand of deadly scissors, blades, surgical instruments, and scalpels. The other hand is completely replaced with a set of interwoven needles on pistons. The figure is tall and emaciated, with tight skin stretched over lithe muscles. Its long and slender neck ends in a small bald head with beady black eyes and multiple straps that are connected to its mouth, keeping it pried open. A spool of fine thread is fastened into its gaping mouth, and its ribcage is splayed open with flowing bandages on a spool that is fitted into place within. It wears stained and stitched rags and carries a large burlap sack stained in blood, multiple severed limbs hanging out of the open bag.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Stitcher, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Fearless and Enduring. You are aware of the Stitcher's damage and condition Immunities. (15+) Instantaneous Grafter. You know the creature's Sewing Needle attack. (20+) Brainless Monster. You learn the Stitcher's Charisma saving throw.
Combat Tactics The Stitcher has a singular, focused mind, and even when defending itself, uses its sewing and surgical skills to sew up its foes. The Stitcher often identifies what the most advantageous option is for its Sewing Needle, focusing on the mouths of spellcasters, the limbs of melee combatants, and the eyes of ranged combatants. It attempts to attach limbs to victims it has sewn up.
Harvestable Components (Very Rare) Animus: Construct. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts. Bones: Skull, Spine. Natural Weapons: Claws. Hair: Stitches, Hair. Hide: Skin.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 218 -219 (Third Party)

monster.name: Storm Troll

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The troll regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes Acid damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll makes two Claw attacks and one Bite attack. It can replace its Bite attack with Hurl Lightning if available.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) Thunder damage, and the target has the Staggered condition until the end of the troll's next turn.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) Lightning damage, and lightning leaps from the target to a different creature of the troll's choice that it can see within 10 feet of the target. The second creature takes 18 (4d8) Lightning damage.

action.name: Hurl Lightning (recharge 5–6)
action.text: The troll hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 300 feet of it. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Failure: 18 (4d8) Lightning damage and has the Shocked condition until the end of the troll's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

monster.description:
Its gray and white skin is stretched tightly over its muscular form. Its wide-set mouth shows rows of jagged teeth below beady, stormy, blue-black eyes set in the center of its large bald head. Ripples of electrical currents pulse through its body, its veins glowing electric-blue like a network of lightning bolts across its skin.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Storm Troll, learning the following information based on the result: (5+) From Harsh Environments. You know the troll's Immunities. (10+) Hard to Kill. You learn of the troll's Regeneration trait. (15+) Special Weakness. You have insight into the troll's Vulnerabilities.
Combat Tactics Storm Trolls hunt for food during heavy rainfall or bad storms. Often accompanied by cracks of thunder and flashes of lightning, they begin combat by hurling lightning at their foes before rushing in to maul them with their Claws and Bites. If a Storm Troll takes Acid damage, it immediately flees and attempts to find a safe place to recuperate.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Giant. Fluid: Monster Blood, Elemental Fluid. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Guts, Flesh. Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs. Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws. Hair: Hair. Hide: Skin. Dust: Elemental Dust.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 273 (Third Party)

monster.name: Striga (Epic)

trait.name: Epic Foe
trait.text:
This is an epic foe, following the rules as described in Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim.
To calculate its Max HP use the following calculation: 57 (6d10 + 24) plus 57 (6d10 + 24) per player character.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The striga has Advantage on melee attack rolls against a creature with the Bloodied condition.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: The striga is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. It may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Necrotic Aura

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The striga regains 10 Hit Points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 Hit Point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the striga takes Radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The striga can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Forbiddance
trait.text: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

trait.name: Harmed By Running Water
trait.text: The vampire takes 20 Acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.

trait.name: Stake to the Heart
trait.text: If a Piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is Incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is Paralyzed until the stake is removed.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
trait.text: The vampire takes 20 Radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The striga always takes its turn on Initiative count 20. On its turn, the striga can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the striga takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Necrotic Bite (1/round)
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 10 ft. Hit:24 (4d6 + 6) Necrotic damage. The target's Hit Point Maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the striga regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 15 ft. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 6) Slashing damage.

action.name: Delerium Healing
action.text: The striga touches a delerium shard and regains 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once the striga has used a delerium shard in this way, it can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

action.name: Blood Howl (1/round)
action.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the striga that can hear it. Failure: 35 (10d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Jinxed (1d6) and Immobilized conditions (save ends both). Success: Half damage, and the target is immune to the striga's Blood Howl for 24 hours.

action.name: Charge
action.text: The striga moves up to 40 feet in a straight line, moving through the spaces of other creatures. Each creature whose space the striga passes through is subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18. Failure: The target is pushed 10 feet away from the striga and has the Prone condition.

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: The striga chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The striga can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

reaction.name: Retaliation
reaction.text: Trigger: A creature within 15 feet of the striga deals Radiant damage to it. Response: The striga makes a Claws attack against that creature.

monster.description:
The vampiric creature before you has shifted into a more monstrous form. Its clothes are tattered and hang off its bulky frame, its muscles bulge, and its face has morphed into a snarling animalistic snout. Its fingers and toes are now hooked, bony talons, and its monstrous fangs drip with blood. An octarine glow simmers within its eyes. Its growling and huffing breath heaves as it glares towards you, hungry for flesh, and craving mortal blood.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Religion gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when taking the Study action to examine a Striga, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Unnatural Resistances. You recognize the creature's damage Resistances and Immunities. (15+) Terrifying Howl. You learn of the creature's Blood Howl action. (20+) Defeatable Undeath. You know the creature's lowest ability scores and Vampire Weaknesses.
Combat Tactics The Striga is a vampire warped by delerium and contamination. It loses its inhibitions and subtlety, becoming a ravenous bloodthirsty monster. The Striga charges into battle and aggressively pursues its foes, clawing and howling as it hunts its prey. The Striga attempts to single out a weak target and tears them to shreds before moving on to the next. A Striga rarely flees as it is too bloodthirsty to consider its own life.

Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 256 -257 (Third Party)

A teeming mass of chittering ratlings roil forth. Fur and claws spill like crashing waves, surging forth with dozens of hungry, biting mouths to consume everything in their path.

You are aware of the swarm's Resistances, Immunities, speeds, and senses, as well as its Swarm trait. (15+) Overwhelming Numbers. You learn of this creature's Chittering Mass and Scurrying Horde traits. (20+) Neither Strong Nor Brave. You recognize the swarm's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Swarm of Ratlings is an alternative way to represent a massive number of ratlings, rather than needing to use dozens of individually weak ratling minions in an encounter against higher-level characters. In battle the Swarm of Ratlings moves like a rolling tide, using its Scurrying Horde Bonus Action to close the distance with as many targets as possible. The swarm tries to move into and over the spaces of its enemies, so it can Bite them with Advantage using its Chittering Mass trait. The swarm continues making Bite attacks against a downed character in its space as the swarm goes into a feeding frenzy. The Swarm of Ratlings is impossibly brave until it's reduced to 0 Hit Points, at which point the Scampering Survivors usually try to run away.

Failure: 18 (4d8) Cold damage, and the target has the Frozen condition (DC 14). Success: Half damage only. Chlorine Gas. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: 14 (4d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition (save ends). While Poisoned, the target has the Blinded condition. Success: Half damage only.

monster.description:
A hulking abomination of corroded steel and pallid flesh stands before you. A gas mask covers its face, firmly strapped and bolted onto its head. The creature hunches over a massive chemical drum that makes up its gut. Tubes and hoses splay from the drum like spilled intestines that connect the tank back into the spine and limbs of the monstrosity. The pumping hoses weave through its body, connecting to the large metallic nozzles which have replaced its hands. A confusing tapestry of rank chemical odors exude from it, the various smells irritate the senses and burn the eyes and nostrils.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or Medicine gain Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks to Study a Tanker, learning the following based on the result: (10+) Fearless and Enduring. You know the Tanker's damage and condition Immunities. (13+) Deadly Spray. You learn of the Tanker's Chemical Spray attack. (17+) Brainless Monster. You are aware of the Tanker's Intelligence and Charisma saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Tanker takes the first opportunity it has to unleash Chemical Spray at a group of targets. After weakening its foes with Chemical Spray, finishes them off with Slams and Chemical Globs.
Harvestable Components (Rare) Animus: Construct. Fluid: Contaminated Ichor, Chemical Solution, Elemental Fluid. Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Glands. Bones: Skull, Spine. Hair: Stitches. Hide: Skin, Plates.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 220 (Third Party)

trait.text: This creature is immune to Contamination and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

Until this grapple ends, the target has the Restrained condition, takes 10 (2d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns, and the dreg can't make Constricting Tentacle attacks.

monster.description:
Where the creature's arms should be, there are instead two writhing masses of deep purple tentacles, while four more protrude from its back. Its tongue lolls out as a long, wet, purple appendage. Throughout the creature's body, weeping wounds open to protruding smaller tendrils and growths. The Dreg's skin looks wet and saggy, and it moves with a strange wobble as it slops towards you.

You know of the creature's Malleable trait. (10+) Squeezing Death. You learn of the Dreg's Constrict attack. (15+) Physically Strong. You are aware of the Dreg's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Tentacled Dreg can use its tentacles to climb and swim much better than other Dregs, and so it likes to hide on perches or in water waiting for its unfortunate prey to come near. When it attacks, it Constricts its target, squeezing them to death with its many tentacles. If outnumbered and below half of its Hit Points, a Tentacled Dreg will attempt to climb or swim to safety.

monster.immune: cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, psychic, poison

trait.name: Epic Foe

trait.name: Immutable Form

trait.name: Predictive Analytics
trait.text: At the end of each of the Algorithm's turns, it rolls 1d20 for each player character fighting it. The Algorithm can replace any D20 Test made by it or a creature it can see with one of these predictive rolls. It must choose to do so before the roll, and it can replace a roll in this way only once per turn. Each predictive roll can be used only once. Any unused predictive rolls are lost at the start of the Algorithm's next turn.

action.name: Epic Actions
action.text: The Algorithm always takes its turn on Initiative count 20. On its turn, the Algorithm can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or Bonus Action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Algorithm takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

action.name: Wire
action.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 26, one creature the Algorithm can see within 60 feet. Failure: 21 (2d10 + 10) Force damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 20). The Algorithm can grapple up to six creatures at a time.

action.name: Algorithmic Manipulation
action.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 26, one Huge or smaller creature or object the Algorithm can see within 120 feet. Failure: The Algorithm moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction, and the target has the Restrained condition. If the Algorithm lifts the target into the air, it is suspended there. The target remains held until the Algorithm releases it (no action required), uses this Epic Action again, or has the Incapacitated condition.

action.name: Deatomization
action.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 26, one creature or object the Algorithm can see within 300 feet. Failure: 65 (10d12) Necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, it dies and its body is reduced to atoms. Failure: Half damage.

action.name: Reprogram (1/round)
action.text: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 26, one creature Grappled by the algorithm. Failure: 55 (10d10) Piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, it dies and its brain is replaced with mechanical components. The target reanimates at the start of its next turn as a Construct under the Algorithm's control. It resembles the original creature, but its eyes glow with synthetic green light, and its body is covered in protruding wires, metal scraps, and glowing tubes.

action.name: Assuming Direct Control (1/round)
action.text: The Algorithm targets a Construct within 120 feet and immediately enters and takes control of it. The Algorithm can still use its Epic Actions as normal and replaces the Construct's game statistics with its own, except the Construct's Hit Points. When the Construct is reduced to 0 Hit Points, the Algorithm reemerges in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of it.

action.name: Spellcasting (1/round)
action.text: The Algorithm casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 27): At Will: Dispel Magic, Fabricate 3/Day Each: Scrying, Sending, Wall of Force 1/Day Each: Antimagic Field, Prismatic Wall, Reverse Gravity 1/Year: Wish

action.name: Epic Resistance
action.text: The Algorithm chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls 1d20. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The Algorithm can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

monster.spells: dispel magic, fabricate, scrying, sending, wall of force, antimagic field, prismatic wall, reverse gravity, wish
monster.description:
It is a vast network of wires, tubes, and metal plating in an ever shifting and malleable form. This massive construct often appears as a giant robotic face floating through the void, with a tail of writhing mechanical tendrils drifting behind it like a massive inorganic squid. It uses the plates and chunks of liquid metal orbiting around it to reshape itself, creating limbs and changing features as parts remove or attach to its ever-shifting form. The whirring of electrical energy and mechanical sounds compile into a booming chorus of auto-tuned robotic voices. Its cold, unfeeling eyes analytically survey its surroundings, assessing the information before calculating the optimal way to reorganize its form in response to the situation.
Roleplaying Traits The Algorithm is nigh incomprehensible. • Personality Trait. "I speak down to mortal creatures, for they cannot begin to comprehend the depth of my knowledge, or the details of the cosmos. They are but simple accidents in a sea of chaos that must be corrected." • Bond. "I am bound to the order of all things, It is my cosmic ordained purpose to bring order to the chaos of the universe." • Ideal. "Order out of Chaos is perfection, I will achieve perfection." • Flaw. "No one is as humble as I!"
Study the Foe Characters proficient in Arcana or History gain Advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks when they take the Study action to examine The Algorithm, learning the following based on their result: (20+) Practically Impervious. You learn the Algorithm's Immunities. (25+) Order and Consequence. You are aware of the creature's Predictive Analytics trait. (30+) Enduring Intellect. You recognize The Algorithm's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.
Combat Tactics The Algorithm is a creature of order and consequence. It sees all of the Space Between Worlds and every reality as a confusing mass of chaos that must be rearranged and perfected. When The Algorithm encounters mortal creatures, it will attempt to organize them as best suits it using its wires and Algorithmic Manipulation to forcibly move them. It will convert problematic creatures into obedient androids using its Reprogram ability, and any who threaten it are reduced to atoms using Deatomization. If The Algorithm has created a cyborg using Reprogram, or if there are extra constructs from previous failed experiments nearby, The Algorithm can assume direct control of them, deatomizating itself and entering the construct to use as a suit of armor. If the combat becomes too stressful or problematic for The Algorithm, and it is unable to control or organize the situation in a way that benefits it, it may get frustrated and begin deatomizating everything. If that doesn't work, it flees into the void to find something more easily manipulated to work on.
Harvestable Components (Legendary) Animus: Construct. Fluid: Chemical Solution, Elemental Fluid. Organs: Glands. Natural Weapons: Tentacles, Blades Hide: Plates.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 334 -335 (Third Party)
